loans.name: Vata

texts.en: Vata is a married woman. She has six children. She operates a retail business where she sells bedsheets, bed covers etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are good. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a big shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Phonsawang Group

texts.en: Yom’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Yom and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Yom and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within these two years, filter users, like Yom’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs. Children pictured are the children of parents or guardians that are in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gregoria dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Nongkern Group

texts.en: Tan understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Tan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Tan purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Tan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Yudi

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Yudi, who lives in Majalengka, a province in West Java located about a five-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Yudi is a young man filled with entrepreneurial spirit who decided to join Kiva's field partner Ruma as an agent because he saw a technological business opportunity for him in the company. Ruma’s major areas of operation are in cell phone airtime sales and bill-pay services.

By supporting this 12,000,000 IDR loan, you will be providing extra working capital for Yudi's business. This will allow him to become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product called Mapan, a service designed for lower-income communities. Mapan enables customers to save little by little by depositing change with agents such as Yudi, and as their balance grows, customers can purchase merchandise such as housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children.

As a Ruma Mapan agent, Yudi is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. He submits the order via SMS, and within five to ten days the product will be delivered to the customer.

With Mapan, Yudi believes that his community will be able to have access to higher-quality products at lower prices. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to have additional working capital to facilitate Ruma's new savings plan for low-income communities.

loans.name: Nathomkhok Group

texts.en: Onkeo is excited that the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Onkeo and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter that Onkeo and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Onkeo and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease. After totaling up the costs, Onkeo and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Lolita has been in this business for 21 years now.

Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Namon Group

texts.en: Sengmanee’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Sengmanee and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Sengmanee and her village also understand the impact that unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years, and within this two years, filter users, like Sengmanee’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Amphavang Group

texts.en: Dan understands the difference that the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Dan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter which Dan purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Dan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is married with one child. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice and corn on their farm. Previously Maribel was managing her small sari-sari store within her village and she also offered eggs to the vendors in the market. To make their living more comfortable, Maribel decided to rent a stall in the market and she now runs a grocery store.  She offers several grocery items in the market. She wishes to sell more items and earn a bigger income. Hence, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy lard, powdered juice, coffee, canned goods, shampoo, and detergent soap.  Maribel will invest her earnings in buying land for her child's future.

loans.use: to buy lard, powdered juice, coffee, canned goods, shampoo, and detergent soap for her variety store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells goats. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy more stock of goats. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of goats

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Guillerma is 63 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Guillerma has a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines. Guillerma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

Guillerma has been in this business for 10 years. Guillerma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Nhor is 61 years old and a married mother of a child. To make a living, she grows jicama and raises pigs and chickens as the main sources of income. She also weaves scarves in order to earn additional income for her family. She has been in these businesses for 43 years already. She faces a financial problem now because pests are destroying her cash crops. 

This time will be the second cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan successfully. As a leader of three-member group, Nhor will spend her loan portion on buying chicken and pig feeds and building a pig cage and chicken coop. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living conditions so that they are much better than before.

loans.use: To buy chicken and pig feeds and build a pig cage and chicken coop

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Kabao Group

texts.en: Vong’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Vong and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Vong and his village also understand the impact that unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Vong’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to have access to safe drinking water.

texts.en: Vaet understands the difference that the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Vaet knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter which Vaet purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Vaet is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Gahamirani

texts.en: Gahamirani is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Kengchip Group

texts.en: Soonthone is excited that the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Soonthone and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter that Soonthone and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Soonthone and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Soonthone and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business of buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines.

Lucena requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Lucena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Phalanneua Group

texts.en:
Monesark understands the difference that a water filter can make for her family and for her group members' families. Monesark knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Monesark purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Monesark is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Bora's Group

texts.en:
Bora, 39, is a farmer living in the Punhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are still in school and the third is too young to attend school.

To support her family’s living, Bare sells grocery items to earn the main source of her family’s income. She also grows paddy rice to supplement her income. She has been in these jobs for 21 years, but now she cannot earn good income like ever before due to lacking of items available in her store.

This is the third time for Bora with VisionFund (a Kiva partner), and she paid her past loan successfully. Leading a three-member group to get a new loan, Bora will use her loan to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living standard much better than before.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be faithful.

Mirriam operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the loan of 95,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to open more beauty salons within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Mirriam's previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in a rural area in Kashagazi cell, Ishongororo in Ibanda district with his wife and four children who are all in school.

George is and agriculturalist who also deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income. He owns about 30 cows. He has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) to help him buy more cattle to fatten and later sell. His major challenge is customers who buy on credit and those that pay less money for cows, which affects his cash flow.

George hopes to buy another piece of land to provide more grazing space for his cattle and also to construct a permanent home for his family. He is hard working and reslient. He is appreciative of the financial support from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to boost his cattle trade business by buying more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Perla is 57 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Perla has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, threads, and needles for her business.

Perla has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, and needles for her business.

loans.name: Marie Mana

texts.fr: Mana, 39 ans, vit en union libre et a un enfant. Elle gère un magasin dans lequel elle vend des accessoires automobile. Le microcrédit lui sert à acheter suffisamment de pièces détachées et accessoires pour satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Elle veut augmenter son revenu et améliorer sa vie quotidienne.
texts.en:
Mana, who is 39 years old, has a partner and one child. She manages a store where she sells automobile accessories. 

This micro-loan will serve to buy enough spare parts and accessories to satisfy her customers' demand. 

She wants to increase her revenue and improve her daily life.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, who is 34 years old, lives in a community of Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. She has three children who are currently in school.

To make a living and support the family, Chan manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing and selling rice to the local dealer and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this type of business for more than 10 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

As supplementary income, Chan also raises pigs for resale. Currently, she is lacking money to buy more pigs to raise and resell. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy pigs. She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Brigithe

texts.fr: Brigithe vit en union libre. Elle a 44 ans et elle est mère d’un enfant qui est régulièrement scolarisé. Son activité est un petit entrepôt où elle vend des sacs et des marmites de riz. Brigithe vend aussi d’autres produits pour la cuisine. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 6 crédits qu’elle a remboursés sans difficulté, des crédits que Brigitte a utilisé pour faire progresser son commerce. Elle en sollicite un nouveau pour diversifier son activité et attirer de nouveaux clients.
texts.en:
Brigithe has a partner, is 44 years old, and is the mother of one child, who regularly attends school. 

She has a small store where she sells sacs and pots of rice. She also sells other cooking products. 

Brigithe has already benefited from six loans, which she has paid back without difficulty. These loans have been used to advance her business.

She is seeking a new loan to diversify her business and attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy sacs of rice

loans.name: Marieta

texts.fr: Marieta, âgée de 42 ans, vit seule avec ses trois enfants. Son mari vit à l’étranger. Ne voulant pas dépendre entièrement de l’aide de son mari, elle a développé une petite activité de vente de légumes, de vivres et de fruits. Elle a déjà contracté 6 prêts. Son dernier en date va lui permettre d’augmenter son stock pour le mois de décembre ; elle s’attend à faire beaucoup ventes pour la saison des fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en:
Marieta is 42 years old and lives alone with three children. Her husband lives abroad. 

Not wanting to depend entirely on aid from her husband, she developed a small business selling fruits, vegetables, and basic foodstuffs. 

Marieta has already received six loans. Her most recent loan is going to allow her to increase her stock for the month of December. She expects many sales for the festival season at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy sacs of carrots and potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Sababugnuman Group

texts.fr: Sitan ,C’est la femme qui tient les cordes des brebis sur la photo. Malienne, Sitan est âgée de 58 ans. Elle n’a pas eu l’occasion d’aller à l’école.  Veuve, elle est mère de 5 enfants dont trois garçons et deux filles qui sont toutes mariées. Les garçons font l’agriculture avec les parents. Comme elle a pu s’acheter un bœuf avec ses économies antérieures son rêve est de s’acheter un autre bœuf et une charrue pour ses enfants afin de garantir leur avenir dans l’agriculture et avec comme espoir le prêt qu’elle prend au R M C R.. Elle prend le prêt au RMCR pour acheter des moutons pour l’élevage. Elle s’approvisionne au marché environnant et vend au même marché après l’engraissement. Le bénéfice récolté sur la vente des moutons la permet de prendre en charge : la santé, la nourriture et l’habillement de ses enfants ; cela pour un bénéfice moyen de 5700f FCFA par mois par tété. Sitan n’a pas eu de problème avec le prêt du RMCR. Elle compte s’encourager dans son activité d’élevage et faciliter l’agriculture afin de satisfaire suffisamment sa vie et celle de ces enfants.
texts.en:
Sitan, who is the woman holding the goat's leash in the photo, is from Mali and 58 years old. She has not had the chance to go to school. She is a widow and the mother of five children, of whom three are boys and two are girls. All of the children are already married. The boys farm with their parents. 

Although she has been able to buy a cow with previous savings, she dreams of buying another cow and a plow for her children in order to guarantee their future in farming. It is for this hope that she takes loans out with RMCR. 

This RMCR loan will be used to buy sheep to raise. She procures her livestock at the surrounding markets and makes her resales at the same markets after fattening the sheep.

Earnings, on average of 5,700 francs CFA per head, received from the sales allow her to provide for her children's health, food, and clothing. 

Sitan does not have a problem [paying back] loans with RMCR. She hopes to expand her livestock raising and facilitate [her children's] farming in order to provide enough for her life and those of her children.

loans.use: to buy rams to resell

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Thol is 47 years old. She is a mother of three dependent children, one of whom is still in school. 

To make a living, Thol sells grocery items as her main source of income. In order to supplement her income, she grows paddy rice on 80 acres of farmland. Lack of water to support the rice growth and selling grocery items in low quantities are the challenges she is facing these days. In fact, the lack of capital to support her business is why she is applying for a loan. 

This is Thol's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a group leader of three members, she will use her loan to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is single mother and also takes care of additional family members. 

She is a poultry farmer and operates a business from home on retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings form MCDT-SACCO to buy vaccines and poultry feeds. Her major business challenges include diseases which affect the quality of chicks. Her goal is to get more land to build other poultry houses. 

Pamela lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and utilities.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and poultry feed.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a single man. He describes himself as faithful. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are of all types. He says his biggest business challenge is inadequate finances. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more carpentry materials. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more carpentry materials.

loans.name: Nahashon

texts.en:
Nahashon is a married man with one child. He describes himself to be focused. 

Nahashon operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle, and also sells motorcycle spare parts. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy place, and he describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season which affects business. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to resell. His business goal is to have a big autospares shop within five years. 

This is Nahashon's third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy motorcycle spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Marijha

texts.en:
Marijha is a hardworking entrepreneur with three children.

She has an internet café in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy computer supplies for her internet café. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marijha dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

loans.name: Darto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Darto, one of Ruma's agents. Darto lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about five hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. 

Darto owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he has heard before that Ruma has the best service and system, as well as to give more contribution to his community. His community sees him as an informative, kind and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Darto needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Darto’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

Darto is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his village community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve their access to sanitation and water.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-years-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Mohammad opened a store recently for internet services, and he distributes this service to houses and businesses.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy computers and tools he needs in his business. This will enable him to hire more employees and increase productivity.

loans.use: to buy computers and tools he needs in his internet providing office.

loans.name: Charikya

texts.en:
Charikya is 36 years old and lives in the community of Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 7.50 a day.

Charikya wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a married woman and has two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Risper operates a car washing business, and has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy car washing equipment. Her business goal is to open another car washing branch within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will send her children to better schools. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: buy car washing equipment.

loans.name: Bitengo

texts.en:
Bitengo is 28 years old and supports three children. She has been a farmer for the last four years and the business earns her KES 16,5000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her to get a better harvest for family use and the surplus for sale to clients in the market. 

Bitengo plans to use the profits to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to educate her children, and also provide them better medication. Her hope is to improve her living standards  and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her get a better harvest for family use and the surplus for sale to clients in the market.

loans.name: Elecita

texts.en:
Elecita is a hardworking entrepreneur with four children. All of her children are in school.

She runs a variety store in the Philippines and industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming vegetables. She has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Elecita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Endi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Endi, one of Ruma's agents. Endi lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about 5 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his two children. 

Endi sells mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to make more of a contribution to his community. They see him as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Endi needs additional capital and is seeking a loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Endi’s goal for Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product, which is called Mapan, so his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his village community.

loans.name: Dudung

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Dudung is one of Ruma's agents. Dudung lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about five hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only son. 

Dudung sells mobile airtime credits and accessories to his village community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to contribute more to his community, so his community can have communication access to connect with their loved ones. Moreover, his community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Dudung needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Dudung’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

As seen in the photo, Dudung is the one who is standing in front of his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his village community.

loans.name: Cesiri Group

texts.fr:
Nouh, c’est l’homme dont la main est posée sur les sacs de mil dans la charrette sur la photo. Agé de 55 ans, Marié, sa femme est une ménagère. Nouh a fait  l’école coranique, c’est un client du RMCR depuis 3 ans et il est père de 09 enfants,  quatre (04) garçons sont scolarisés, et sont âgés de 07 à 20 ans. Mr Nouh mène deux activités, le stockage et l’embouche bovine et cela  depuis plus d’une décennie, et il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnant.IL achète le sac de maïs à 110 F le kg donc un sac fait 11000 F, Il peut acheter 20 sacs de maïs. Après la vente son bénéfice peut varier par sac entre 1000 f à 1500 f CFA. Avec ces profits il parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille ; comme couverture sanitaire, habillements, la scolarisation de ses enfants et alimentaires
Nouh est à sa cinquième  cycles  et souhaite dans l’avenir avoir plus de fonds afin de pouvoir bien développer son activité et  faire fasse au bien naître de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nouh is the man with his hand on the sacs of millet on the wagon in the photo. At 55 years old, he is married and his wife is a housewife. He has nine children, including four boys who go to school, who are aged between seven and 20 years old. Nouh has attended a Koran school.

Nouh has been a client with RMCR for three years. He has two businesses, warehousing and fattening cattle, which he has done for a decade. He procures his stock and livestock from the surrounding markets. 

He buys corn at 110 francs CFA/kilogram, therefore a sac is 11,000 francs CFA. He can buy 20 sacs of corn.

After the sales, profits can vary between 1,000 and 1,500 francs CFA per sac. With these profits, he will support his family's needs such as covering his children's sanitary, clothing, food, and schooling costs.

Nouh is on his fifth cycle and wishes in the future to have more funds so that he can further develop his business and promote his children's well-being.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man. He describes himself to be honest. 

Francis operates a quarry where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. Francis will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy quarry tools. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy quarry tools.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 60-year-old widowed woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Susana has a business direct selling personal collection products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Susana requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products from personal collections to sell to her customers.

In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products from personal collections to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Rina

texts.es: María de 58 años de edad, vive  en casa propia y humilde junto a su grupo familiar. María es una mujer que se caracteriza por ser muy  laboriosa y emprendedora por lo que siempre hace todo lo posible para poder  tener lo necesario en su hogar, ella desde hace diez años se ha dedicado a la venta de verduras, frutas y hortalizas tales  como: tomates, cebollas, papaya, sandia, apio, cilantro y otros productos mas  a las afueras de su hogar por lo que es bien reconocida en la zona por sus productos frescos y de buena calidad. Pese a las dificultades que se le han presentado en su vida diaria no ha dejado su negocio a un lado ya que es su fuente principal de ingresos económicos para que en su hogar no falte nunca el pan de cada día. María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en verduras, frutas y hortalizas en mayor cantidad porque en su negocio tiene mucha demanda de productos, es por ello que ella quiere ampliar su negocio para aumentar las ventas y obtener mayores  ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old and lives in her own humble home together with her family group. María is a woman characterized by being hard working and enterprising as she always does everything possible to have the necessities in her home.  For 10 years she has worked selling greens, fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, papaya, watermelon, celery, coriander and other products outside her home as she is well recognized in the area for her fresh, good quality produce.  

Despite the difficulties she has been presented with in her daily life, she has never abandoned her business as it is her main source of income to ensure the home is never without bread every day.  María is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in greens, fruits and vegetables in wholesale quantities because her business has high product demand.  For this reason she wants to grow her business to increase sales and obtain better economic income.

loans.use: to invest in greens, fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 38 years old, married, and has three children, who are all in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business, growing vegetables in the Philippines. She has been growing vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Rowena has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mnatsakan

texts.en:
Mnatsakan is a framer who lives in Geghamavan village of Gegharkunik region. He lives with his wife and daughter-in-law (his son is temporarily in the Russian Federation for work). 

Mnatsakan used to work as a driver but now his occupation is farming and on his farm he has cows, calves, a heifer, a bull, a pig, sheep and chickens. His land cultivation also brings some income to his family since he manages to have a good harvest of potatoes and carrots. Mnatsakan sells these vegetables, with his farm products such as milk, meat and eggs at the city wholesale market during the week. 

With this loan Mnatsakan wants to increase his potato production and he wants to buy a lot of potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 38-year-old single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gloria has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for eight years. Gloria requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more root-crops and fruit to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more root-crops and fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Monina works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Monina is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy more bananas to sell to customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang, who is a farmer living in Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, is 64 years old and a married mother of seven children. She struggles for a living, and grows jicama as her main source of income. She also sells grocery items and raises pigs for additional income. She has been in these jobs for 46 years already. 

Now, she cannot manage to earn enough income to support her family’s needs on time because of not being able get outputs from business and having to spend some of her income to buy pesticide. She leads a two-member group to take a new loan, and this is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan helped her to have a better living condition. 

For this new loan she will use it to run a new business, growing pigs for sale, and she will spend her loan to buy pig feed and to build pig cage. She hopes to earn more income to update her living standard much better than before.

loans.use: to run a new business, growing pigs for sale, and she will spend her loan to buy pig feed and to build pig cage

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Ma. Nena

texts.en:
Ma. Nena is 50 years old and is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Nena has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years. Ma. Nena requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

In the future, Ma. Nena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Emperatriz Estela

texts.es: Emperatriz de 33 años de edad, vive muy feliz junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 3 y 1 años de edad en casa propia y humilde. Emperatriz es una mujer trabajadora que posee  en su casa de habitación una  tienda con artículos básicos de primera necesidad entre ellos especies, granos básicos, jabón, aceite, bebidas, etc. mediante esta actividad es como ella brinda a sus hijos lo necesario en su hogar, además su esposo  es agricultor y  lo que cosecha lo vende y es así como aporta a la economía de su familia. Emperatriz solicita un crédito a FUSAI para surtir con mas productos su tienda, con el monto otorgado piensa invertirá en mercadería de primera necesidad  como: harinas, verduras, lácteos, etc. para poner a disposición más productos a sus clientes y obtener a la vez más ganancias para así poder dar un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is 33 years old and lives very happily with her husband and two children, aged 3 and 1 years old, in their own humble home. Emperatriz is a hard working woman who runs a store from home selling basic necessities including spices, basic grains, soap, oil, drinks, etc. Through this activity she can provide her children with what they need at home.  Her husband is also a farmer and sells his crops, and in this way contributes to the family's finances. 

Emperatriz is requesting a loan through FUSAI to stock her store with more products. She intends to use the money to invest in staple goods such as flour, vegetables, dairy products, etc. to have more products to offer to her customers and at the same time achieve a higher income so that she can give her children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase basic necessity goods such as flour, vegetables, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es: Froilán de 44 años de edad es un hombre que muestra su tenacidad cada día para ganarse la vida, ya que a pesar de su dificultad física ha podido salir adelante con su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, actividad que realiza desde hace 17 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Froilán habita en vivienda familiar en compañía de su hermana y el esposo de esta con los que vive desde hace años. Froilán siempre buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos económicos ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, camisas, trajes para niños, etc., para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Froilán is a 44-year-old man who demonstrates persistence every day to make a living. Despite his physical difficulties he has managed to succeed in his small business selling clothes, which he has been doing for 17 years, and as a result he has many customers who request his products. 

Froilán has lived in his family home with his sister and her husband for many years. Froilán is always looking for ways to improve his income and has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to invest in: pants, shirts, children's outfits, etc. to develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, children's outfits, etc. to improve his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in paint, sandpapers, a hammer, polisher, drill and screwdriver for his body shop

loans.name: Gulzhamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день ее прибыль составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Всю прибыль Гулжамал старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, однако в этом году нужно построить забор и отремонтировать дом. Поэтому Гулжамал вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов. Доходы от бизнеса она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Gulzhamal has successfully repaid her loan, having used it as needed. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped her with financing. 

Today, her profit is about 16,000 som (KGS) a month. Gulzhamal tries to invest all profit in the development of her business. However, this year she needs to build a fence and renovate her home. 

Thus, Gulzhamal is again applying to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS), in order to buy building materials. She will invest the funds from her business in the further development of her farm and the improvement of her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairing her house and building a fence.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 44 года, замужем, есть 3 сыновей и 2 дочери. У Замиры среднее образование, она занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 10 овец, 2 лошади. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 28,000 сом (KGS). Замира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки скота для увеличения поголовья. Замира намерена свои доходы и дальше вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zamira is 44 years old, married, and has three sons and two daughters. Zamira has secondary education. She is engaged in animal husbandry. There are four cows, ten sheep and two horses on her farm. Her monthly profit is about 28,000 som (KGS). 

Zamira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) in order to purchase livestock so as to increase her livestock headcount. Zamira intends to further invest her funds in the development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамара, 62 года, вдова, мать 4 детей, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. Тамара на пенсии, у нее среднее образование, занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав свой бизнес 35 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Тамары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец. На 2,70 Га земли она выращивает люцерну и клевер. На ежедневной основе продает экологически-чистое молоко. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Тамара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и накопить на проведение годовщины смерти любимого мужа.
texts.en:
Tamara is 62 years old, widowed, and has four independent adult children. Tamara is retired. She has secondary education, and is engaged in animal and field husbandry, having started her business 35 years ago. 

Thanks to Tamara's persistent hard work, today on her farm there are two cows and ten sheep. On 2.70 hectares of land, she cultivates lucerne and clover. She sells eco-friendly milk on a daily basis. 

In order to further develop her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to buy two dairy cows in order to increase the volume of milk sales. Tamara plans to invest the income earned from the business in the further augmentation of her business, and to save for her beloved husband's death anniversary.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to increase the volume of eco-friendly milk sales.

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Propósito se reúne cada 15 días cerca del mercado central en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Jorge, tiene 58 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposa es ama de casa. 
El señor Jorge es un hombre que ha trabajado toda la vida con la finalidad de darles un buen porvenir  a sus hijos y a su familia, desde hace mas de 34 años se  dedica al comercio, vende mariscos, el todos los días se desplaza hasta el mercado central lugar en el cual tiene un puesto donde vende pescado, camarón, pulpo y otros mariscos que son del agrado de sus clientes que a diario  pasan por el lugar comprando los mariscos para luego llevarlos a sus mesas, esta labor es lo que siempre ha realizado y gracias a esto el saco y sigue adelante en su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar todo tipo de mariscos que el vende. Lleva 2 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten  financiarse y no pagar muchos intereses. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Con Propósito meets every fortnight near the central market in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which have many visitors all through the year and for being a city of unrivalled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

This is where 58-year-old Jorge lives. He is married and from this relationship he has four grown-up children, one of whom still lives in his house. His wife is a housewife. Jorge is a man who has worked all his life with the aim of giving his children and his family a good future. For more than 34 years he has made a living as a vendor, selling shellfish. Every day he goes to the central market, a place where he has a stall where he sells fish, prawns, octopus and other shellfish which suit the tastes of his customers, who pass through the market every day buying the shellfish which they later serve on their tables. This work is what he has always done and it is thanks to this that he brought up his family and continues to make progress. 

This loan is to buy all kinds of shellfish which he sells. He has been in the communal bank for 2 years and he likes it because the loans allow him to support himself financially without paying a lot of interest. His dream is to have large premises.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of shellfish.

loans.name: Daysi Antonia

texts.es: Deysi de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daysi is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and their 2 children.  She has made a living for several years making and selling tortillas.  Her business is located in her home and she has a lot of customers, particularly her neighbors.  

She is applying for a loan to buy corn by the 100kg and lime to be able to continue making tortillas and therefore bring in more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the 100kg and lime

loans.name: Génesis Arianna

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Propósito se reúne cada 15 días cerca del mercado central en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Génesis, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de familiares, ella estudia enfermería en una universidad de la localidad. 
Doña Génesis es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con sus recursos poder salir adelante en los gastos de sus estudios universitarios esperando algún día terminar su carrera y forjarse un mejor porvenir, ella  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo, productos Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella también elabora manualidades hechas en fomix, ella sale a vender por la localidad en sus ratos libres o en la universidad en la cual estudia ya sea sus productos o sus manualidades, deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada 8 días, lleva 6 años con su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, productos Belcorp y materiales para las manualidades. Lleva más 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos
texts.en:
The Mujeres con Propósito (Women with Purpose) Credit Group meets every 15 days near the central market in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are popular year round and for being a city of unmatched beauty with many attractive tourist spots.   

Génesis is a woman who likes to work and use her resources to get ahead with her university expenses.  She is hoping to finish her degree one day and to forge a better future.  She makes a living selling catalog clothing and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women).  She sells door-to-door and she also produces handicrafts made from craft foam.  She goes out to sell her products and handicrafts in the neighborhood in her free time or at the university where she studies.  She allows her customers to buy on credit and collects payment every 8 days.  She has been operating her business for 6 years and it allows her to move forwards.

This loan is for buying clothing, Belcorp products, and materials for making handicrafts.  She has been a member of this credit group for 4 years and she likes it because of the loans that it provides.

loans.use: to buy clothing, Belcorp products, and materials for handicrafts.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es: Maria de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 17 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y ya tiene muchos clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco mas de ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 43 years old, lives in her own house with her three children, and makes a living selling food.  For 17 years her business has been situated in her home and she now has lots of established customers. With what she makes from her sales she manages to get by.  

She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies, primarily rice, chickens, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc., to add variety to her menu and make a little more profit so that she can have more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more supplies, primarily rice, chickens, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Kenis Manuel

texts.es: Con el deseo de progresar, de tener una mejor calidad de vida el señor Kenis hoy viene a solicitar un préstamo uno que le permita mejorar su negocio de cría de ganado porcino, desea reparar sus cocheras, construir canales de alimentación y de desechos, comprar alimento y cerdos, pero ya que no tiene capital hoy apela a los usuario de Kiva buscando ese monto con el que ajustara el dinero para realizar las obras que traerán progreso a su hogar, vive solo y depende del negocio para tener un alimento diario que comer.
texts.en: With the desire to progress and have a better quality of life, Kenis is currrently requesting a loan to allow him to improve his pig farming business. He would like to repair his pig pens, build feed and waste channels, and purchase feed and pigs.  As he does not have the necessary capital he is appealing to Kiva users and requesting this amount which will be used to carry out the work that needs to be done so that he can progress. He lives alone and depends on the business for his daily bread.

loans.use: to repair his pig pens

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Propósito se reúne cada 15 días cerca del mercado central en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Narcisa con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar desde hace mas de 1  años atrás se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo  y productos de  Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale en sus ratos libres y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, ella siempre aprovecha los productos de ofertas ya que compra bastante y luego vende al precio real lo cual le deja buenos ingresos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, cremas, perfumes, entre otros. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos aprovecha para comprar más ofertas. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Propósito [Women with Purpose Credit Group] meets every two weeks in the central market of the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are well visited at all times of the year, and as a city that has an unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions. This is the place where Narcisa lives. She is 54 years old, married and in her marriage has had three children who are now of age, two of them still living at her home. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Narcisa intends to earn something on her own to help her husband with home expenses. For the past year she has been making a living from the sale of all types of clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories). She sells door to door, going out in her free time, but also sells from her home where her best known customers come. She sells on credit and collects payments every week. She take advantage of the products that are on sale, as she purchases much and then sells at the regular price, which earns her a good income.

She will use this loan to purchase clothing, shoes, creams and perfumes, among other products. She has been in the credit group for two lending cycles and likes it because she takes advantage of the loans to buy more products on sale. Her dreams are to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, creams, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lanie is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lanie has a general store business in the Philippines. Lanie requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Lanie has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Lanie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Siynakan

texts.ru: Сыйнакан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 6 коров, на ежедневной основе она продает экологически-чистое молоко. На участке мерою 1,80 ГА она выращивает перец и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 15,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сыйнакан вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, часть средств будет направлена на полеводство.  Доходы от кредита Сыйнакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и завершение строительства жилого дома.
texts.en:
Siynakan has successfully repaid her loan, having used it as needed. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped her with financing. 

Currently, she has six cows on her farm, and she sells eco-friendly milk on a daily basis. On a small plot of 1.8 hectares she cultivates peppers and clover for sales. Her monthly income is about 15,800 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business, Siynakan has again applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to buy livestock, and part of the funds will go into crop cultivation. 

Siynakan plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further expansion of her business and in completing the construction of a residential home.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock and to cultivate land in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Propósito se reúne cada 15 días cerca del mercado central en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 25, 19 y 15 años  de edad, todos ellos aun viven en su casa, el menor estudia en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Ana con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta para ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante a sus hijos y su hogar  desde hace 10  años se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa por catalogo, productos tupperware, así como también  productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale en sus ratos libres y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos,  les deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lo cual le ayuda a realizar más ventas.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, productos tupperware, cremas, perfumes, entre otros. Lleva 4 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos se ayudan para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Mujeres Con Propósito" [Women with Purpose] meets every fortnight near the central market in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which have many visitors all through the year and for being a city of unrivalled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where 45-year-old Ana lives. She is married and from this relationship she has three children aged 25, 19 and 15 years. They all still live in her house and the youngest goes to secondary school. Her husband works as a fisherman.

With the aim of earning something herself in order to help her husband to bring up the children and provide for the home, Ana has worked in retail for 10 years. She sells products from catalogues, Tupperware products and Yanabal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories). Her method of selling is door-to door. She goes out in her free time and also sells from her home where her better known customers come to visit. She leaves items on credit and collects the money once a week, which helps her to make more sales.

She will use this loan to buy clothing, Tupperware products, creams, perfumes and other items. She has been in the Communal Bank for 4 years and she likes it because with the loans they help each other to make progress. Her dream is to have a large sales outlet.

loans.use: to buy clothing, Tupperware products, creams, perfumes etc.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a 48-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Melanie has a general store business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more grocery stock to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery stock to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 50 años de edad, separada y vive con su hija. 
Actualmente se gana la vida con la venta de mercancía por como ropa, calzado y accesorios; esta actividad la inició gracias al apoyo de un familiar, con este negocio ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar el su sustento alternándolo con la venta de comidas.

Es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante para seguir con su negocio. 

Este crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido de mercancía (ropa, perfumería, accesorios, lencería) con el fin de tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos que satisfagan los diversos gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes que principalmente son amigos y vecinos. 

Su principal sueño es tener gran cantidad de surtido y ampliar la cartera con los clientes buenos y aumentar sus ventas, así podrá tener un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Luz is 50 years old. She is separated and she lives with her daughter. She currently earns a living by selling products such as clothing, footwear and accessories; she started out in this business with the support of a family member. Through it she has managed to earn income to support herself. She alternates this activity with selling food.

She is an enterprising and hardworking person, and she is eager to get ahead in order to continue with her business.

She is requesting a loan through the Corporacion Interactuar (Interact Corporation) and would like to invest it in the purchase of an assortment of merchandise (clothing, perfumes, accessories, lingerie) in order to have the opportunity to increase sales by offering a greater variety of products to meet the varied tastes and requirements of her customers, who are mainly friends and neighbors.

Her main dream is to offer a great variety of products and to expand her client base to include good customers and to increase sales, and in this way improve her well-being.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of stock (clothing, perfumes, accessories and lingerie)

loans.name: Miriam Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Propósito se reúne cada 15 días cerca del mercado central en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Miriam, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 15 y 13 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Miriam es una  mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en su casa donde vende ropa de todo tipo, cosméticos y otros productos que sus clientes necesitan, allí ella trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta las 18h00 aunque si sus clientes necesitan alguna prenda ella con gusto les atiende,  ella vende a crédito y al contado. Tiene más de 10  años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo y está atenta a las necesidades de sus hijos que tanto la necesitan.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora su negocio. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a sus  pequeños.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Propósito [Women with Purpose Credit Group] meets every two weeks in the central market of the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are well visited at all times of the year, and as a city that has an unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions. This is the place where Miriam lives. She is 44 years old, married and in her marriage has had two children who are 15 and 13 years old and go to school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Miriam is a woman who likes to work to help her husband to get her family ahead. She makes a living from commerce. She has a shop in her home where she sells all types of clothing, cosmetics and other products that her customers need. She works there every day from 8:00 until 18:00, although if her customers need her, she is always there, selling on credit and on cash. She has been doing this for the past 10 years, earning on her own and attentive to the needs of her children who need her so much.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, children's clothing and cosmetics. She has been in the credit group from its start and likes it because she uses the loans to improve her business. Her dreams are to give the best to her small ones.

loans.use: to buy pants, closes, T-shirts, children's clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 60 years old and married. 

Ninfa has a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ninfa has been in this business for ten years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ninfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de gallinas desde hace 15 años vende con los comerciantes de los mercados que están cerca de su casa y ya tiene clientes establecidos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas gallinas para la comercialización y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old, she lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  She has been making a living selling hens for 15 years, she sells with traders from the markets near her house and she now has established customers.  

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more hens to sell, and this way she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more hens.

loans.name: Kanygul

texts.ru: Каныгул, 48 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, дети и супруг во всем помогают. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Каныгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец. Также в наделе есть плодоносящий сад и посевные поля. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Каныгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и удобрений для полевоства. Доходы от кредита Каныгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kanygul is 48 years old, married, and has five children. She has secondary education. She is engaged in animal husbandry in order to provide income for her family. Her children and husband help her in all areas. 

Thanks to Kanygul's persistent hard work and purposefulness, today her farm has two cows and ten sheep. There is also a fertile garden and arable fields on the allotment. The monthly income is about 25,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her farm, Kanygul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to buy livestock and fertilisers for land cultivation. Kanygul plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and fertilizers for land cultivation.

loans.name: Aitbu

texts.ru: Айтбу успешно погасила свой кредит, средства она использовала по назначению. Айтбу очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто откликнулся и помог ей в финансировании.  На данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 5 овец, лошадь. На 1,57 Га земли выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айтбу вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Aitbu has successfully repaid her loan, and she used the funds as needed. Aitbu is very thankful to Kiva and to everyone who responded and helped her with financing. 

Currently, her farm has two cows, five sheep, and a horse. On 1.57 hectares of land she cultivates barley. The monthly income is about 16,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business, Aitbu has again applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a bull-calf for fattening and resale. She plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further expansion of her business, and in renovating her home.

loans.use: to buy one bull-calf for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Sonia Ejiomar

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Propósito se reúne cada 15 días cerca del mercado central en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores  de edad, uno de ellos aun estudia en colegio y es el que vive con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante. Ella hace años aprendió belleza en una academia de la ciudad.
Doña Sonia en sociedad con una hermana tienen  un salón de belleza en su casa, allí ellas realizan diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas, trabajan todos los días, aunque ella también en las mañanas prepara almuerzos para entregar los mismos que una vez preparados los envía a entregar con su hijo que es quien le ayuda en las entregas, de esta forma logra ganar algo extra con lo cual le ayudan a salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar esmaltes, tintes y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta casi desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora su vida. Su sueño es tener en su casa una cevichería lo cual está próximo a pasar ya que esta por comprar lo necesario y empezar con este proyecto.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Mujeres Con Propósito" [Women with Purpose] meets every fortnight near the central market in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which have many visitors all through the year and for being a city of unrivalled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where 53-year-old Sonia lives. She is married and from this relationship she has 5 adult children. One of them is still studying at school and he is the one who lives with them. Her husband works in business. Years ago she studied a beauty course at an academy in the city. Sonia and a sister jointly own a beauty salon in her house and here they carry out a variety of services such as hair colouring and cutting, nail painting and other tasks. They work every day, although in the mornings she also makes breakfasts for delivery. Once she has prepared them she sends them out to be delivered with her son, who is the person who helps her with the deliveries. By doing this she earns a bit extra which helps them to make progress. 

She will use this loan to buy nail varnish, hair colour and groceries for preparing the breakfasts. She has been in the Communal Bank almost since the beginning and she likes it because with the loans she is improving her life. Her dream is to have a cevichería [restaurant specialising in ceviche, the typical local dish of fresh fish cured in citrus juices] in her home, which is going to happen soon, as she is about to buy what she needs and start out on this project.

loans.use: to buy nail varnish, hair colour and groceries.

loans.name: Rosa Angela

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familias Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 1 de Mayo en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 9 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
