Doña Rosa con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta para ayudarle a su marido en los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de sus hijos  hace mas de 11  años  se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, sabanas y productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale en sus ratos libres y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, ella siempre aprovecha los productos de ofertas ya que compra bastante y luego vende al precio real lo cual le deja buenos ingresos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, cremas, perfumes, entre otros. Esta desde el inicio en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos aprovecha para comprar más ofertas. Sus sueños es darles la mejor educación a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The Familias Unidas loan group meets every two weeks in the 1 de Mayo neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited by many people all year round, and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Rosa lives in this place. She is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and from this relationship has two children, ages 11 and 9 who go to school. Her husband works in fishing.

Rosa, with the intention of earning something for herself to help her husband with the household expenses and with their children's education, has worked selling clothing, shoes, sheets, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories) for over 11 years. She sells from door to door, going out in her free time, and she also sells from her house where her best known customers come. She leaves the products on credit and collects every week. She always takes advantage of the sale items since she buys a lot and then sells them at the real price, which gives her a good income. 

This loan will be used to purchase clothing, shoes, creams, perfumes, and more. She has been in this loan group since the beginning and she likes it because, with the loans, she takes advantage of buying more on sale. Her dream is to give her little ones the best education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, creams, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Amarilis Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familias Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 1 de Mayo en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Amarilis, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen una hija de 7 años que estudia en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Amarilis es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y educación de su hija se dedica a la venta de ropa y ropa interior, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres o cuatro días y aprovecha sus ratos mas desocupados para salir aunque también vende en su casa hasta donde sus clientes cuando necesitan algo de lo que ella vende, ella siempre sus ganancias las invierte en la educación de su hija lo que para ella es lo más importante, lleva más de 12 años con esta actividad y espera seguir mucho tiempo ya que le encanta sus ventas.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa interior. Lleva más de 5 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es que su hija tenga una buena educación.
texts.en:
The Familias Unidas loan group meets every two weeks in the 1 de Mayo neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited by many people all year round, and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Amarilis lives in this place. She is 32 years old, married, and from this relationship has a 7-year-old daughter who goes to school. Her husband works in fishing.

Amarilis is a housewife, but to get her own resources, to help her husband with the household expenses and their daughter's education, she sells clothing and lingerie. She makes her sales from door to door. She works three or four days a week and takes advantage of her least busy times to go out, however she also sells from her house where her customers come when they need something that she sells. She always invests her earnings in her daughter's education which, for her, is the most important. She has been doing this work for over 12 years, and hopes to continue for a long time since she loves sales. 

This loan is to purchase pants, shirts, blouses and lingerie. She has been in the loan group for more than 5 years and she likes it because the loans are fast and help a lot. Her dream is that her daughter gets a good education.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, and lingerie.

loans.name: Freddy Johnny

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familias Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 1 de Mayo en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Freddy, tiene 40 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 16 y 6 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su mujer es ama de casa.
El señor Freddy es un hombre muy trabajador, el es mecánico y trabaja en un taller de mecánica automotriz por lo cual recibe un sueldo  mensual, pero el también en sus ratos y días libres junto a su mujer se dedican  a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ellos salen en las  noches y fines de semana ofreciendo sus productos aunque su mujer también vende en su casa cuando él está en el taller,  son más de 6 años  que se dedica a esta actividad  la cual comenzó con el primer  créditos que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecido con la institución.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, entre otras prendas. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es tener salud y que nunca les falte nada a su familia
texts.en:
The Familias Unidas loan group meets every two weeks in the 1 de Mayo neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited by many people all year round, and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Freddy lives in this place. He is 40 years old, in a common-law marriage, and from this relationship has two children, ages 16 and 6, who go to secondary and primary school. His wife is a housewife.

Freddy is a very hard-working man. He is a mechanic and works in an auto shop for which he receives a monthly salary, but in his free time and days off he also works with his wife selling all sorts of clothing. He sells from door to door. They go out in the evenings and on the weekends offering their products. However, his wife sells from the house when he is at the shop. They have more than 6 years of experience in this work, which he began with the first loans that he got from the group, for which he is very grateful to the institution. 

This loan is to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, and other clothing. He has been in the loan group for 6 years and he likes it for the help that the loans offer him. His dreams are to have good health and that his family never lacks for anything.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, and other clothing.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La Bernardina pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de  productos naturales a base de hierbas que son útiles para la salud, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo anterior y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de  productos naturales.
texts.en:
Bernardina belongs to the "Liderando las Palmeras" [Leading the Palm Trees] communal bank. The borrower continues making a living in the business of herbal-based natural products which are useful for health. She is a responsible and persevering person. 

The borrower thanks the investors for the previous loan and feels happy for their support, this being the way that she gets her family ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy natural products.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Vanessa Tatiana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Propósito se reúne cada 15 días cerca del mercado central en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Vanessa, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Vanessa es una  mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, carteras, cosméticos entre otros, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale tres  o cuatro días por semana ya sea en la mañanas o tardes, no tiene horarios fijos si no cuando pueda, ella también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando quieren alguna prenda, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 o 15 días. Tiene más de 5 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, carteras, cosméticos y todo lo que ella vende. Lleva más de 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora su negocio. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres con Propósito loan group meets every two weeks near the central market in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited by many people all year round, and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Vanessa lives in this place. She is 30 years old, married, and from this relationship has two children, ages 11 and 7, both of whom go to school. Her husband is in sales.

Vanessa is a woman who likes to work to help her husband get their household ahead. She works in sales, selling all sorts of clothing, wallets, cosmetics, and more. She sells from door to door, and goes out three or four times a week either in the morning or the afternoon. She doesn't have a set schedule and does it when she can. She also sells from her house where her customers come when they want some clothing. She leaves the items on credit and collects every week or two weeks. She has been working in this activity for more than 5 years, with which she earns something for the good of her family.

This loan will be used to purchase clothing, wallets, cosmetics, and all that she sells. She has been in the loan group for more than 2 years and she likes it because, with the loans, she improves her business. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, wallets, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familias Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 1 de Mayo en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 45 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores  de edad e independientes. Su esposo es diseñador grafico.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta trabajar así sentirse independiente con sus ganancias, ella se dedica al comercio,  vende de ropa y zapatos de marcas colombianas y productos Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas),  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayoría de sus prendas ella las vende en su casa, ella también junto a su marido elaboran gigantografias y otros materiales publicitarios que son elaboradas por pedidos. Lleva más de 15 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y materiales para elaborar gigantografias. Lleva más de 13 años  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Familias Unidas loan group meets every two weeks in the 1 de Mayo neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited by many people all year round, and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

María lives in this place. She is 45 years old, in a common-law marriage, and from this marriage has three children who are adults and independent. Her husband is a graphic designer.

María is a woman who likes to work to feel independent with her earnings. She works in sales, she sells clothing and shoes from Colombian brands and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She makes her sales from door to door however she sells the majority of her clothing from her house. Also, with her husband, she makes banners and other advertising products which they make to order. She has been in this business for more than 15 years, which lets her get ahead.

This loan is to purchase clothing, perfumes, creams, and materials to make banners. She has been in the loan group for over 13 years and she likes it because the loans are fast. Her dream is to continue on and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, perfumes, creams and materials to make banners.

loans.name: Adrian Alexander

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Propósito se reúne cada 15 días cerca del mercado central en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive el señor Adrian, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de los padres. El estudia Ing. Agrícola en una universidad de la localidad.
Don Adrian es  un hombre muy trabajador para así sacar adelante su carrera universitaria y  mejorar su vida, en sociedad con su papá desde hace tres años atrás surtieron una ferretería en su casa, allí sus clientes encuentran hierro, cemento, clavos, alambres, tubos, materiales de electricidad, entre otros además de herramientas que se requieren para este tipo de labor, allí el trabaja en los momentos que puede ya que también tiene que ir a estudiar, cuando esto sucede su papá se encarga del trabajo, de esta forma el y su familia salen adelante en un negocio familiar.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar todo tipo de materiales de construcción. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Con Propósito meets every two weeks near the central market in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which get  many visitors all through the year and for being a city of unrivaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Adrian lives in this place. He is 23 years old, single, and lives in his parent's house. He is studying agricultural engineering at the city's university.

Adrian is working hard to get ahead in his university studies and improve his life. Together with his father, they have been building a hardware store in their house for the past three years. Their customers can find iron, cement, nails, wire, pipes, electrical equipment and so on, plus the tools that are needed for those kinds of work. He works there whenever he can, because he still has to go to university. When he is at university, his father takes care of the work. This way he and his family make a living in a family business.

He will use this loan to purchase all kinds of construction materials. He has been with the communal bank for five years and likes it because the loans are quickly dispensed and help a lot. His dreams is to finish his studies and be a great professional.

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of construction material.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Liderando las Palmeras” ,la socia continua dedicándose a brindar el servicio  de movilidad escolar, la socia agradece por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas establecidas con mucha responsabilidad, la socia es una persona responsable ,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Liderando las Palmeras" communal bank group. The member continues working offering school transportation services. The member is grateful for the loan and promises to make the established payments very responsibly. The member is a responsible person, since in this way the member gets her family ahead.

The member asks for the loan to do maintenance on her car.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her car.

loans.name: Nancy Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia Nancy pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua con su negocio de hospedaje, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua trabajando en su negocio para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa.
La socia solcito el crédito para la compra de sabanas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member, Nancy, belongs to the Liderando las Palmeras communal bank group. The bank is located in Cusco province, and Cusco department.  The member continues with her hospitality business. She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. The member continues working in this business to be able to continue supporting her family. The member is a responsible and dedicated person.

The member asks for the loan to purchase sheets, and more.

loans.use: to purchase sheets and more.

loans.name: Yenny Edelmira

texts.es:
La socia Yenny Edelmira pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia continua con el negocio de  restaurant, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo  desayunos, almuerzos y cenas a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
The member, Yenny Edelmira, belongs to the Liderando las Palmeras communal bank group. The member continues with her restaurant business. The member is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments. She continues selling breakfasts, lunches, and dinners to all the customers who ask fro them. The member is a responsible and dedicated person. The member wants to continue working so, in this way, to continue supporting her family.

The member asks for the loan to purchase rice, oil, and more.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and more.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia tiene 61 años de edad, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Emilia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Emilia espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Emilia is 61 years old, and lives in a rural zone of Cayaltí district, which is located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The population in this district work primarily in agriculture, raising animals, and sales. 

Emilia works raising and selling small animals such as chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys and more. Her business is located at her home. She has 10 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase a greater number of animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, and more, and also to purchase balanced feed for them. With this, Emilia hopes to offer a better product to her customers, which will allow her to generate more income and in the end will increase her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater number of animals and also to purchase balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Hector Gustavo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, él socio continua con el  negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, el socio continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta manera continuar apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Liderando las Palmeras communal bank. The member continues with the business raising small animals such as guinea pigs. The member continues raising his animals to later sell them to his customers who ask for them. The member wants to be able to continue working so, in this way, to continue supporting his family.

The member asks for the loan to purchase guinea pigs and more.

The member is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and others.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia Norma, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de pabilos, la socia continua vendiendo  sus productos a sus amistades, familiares, clientes entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de  pabilos.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Liderando las Palmeras communal bank, The member, Norma, continues with her business selling cotton twine. She continues selling her products to friends, family members, customers, and others. The member wants to be able to continue working so, in this way, to continue supporting her family.

The member asks for the loan to purchase cotton twine.

The member is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through this platform and commits to making her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase cotton twine.

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita hails from Alegria, Cebu. She is 51 years old, with a fourteen-year-old dependent. As her husband is a fisherman, Virginita is into selling his catch. She also buy fresh fish from other fishermen to increase her income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more fish that she can resell. This will result in a better income for her family. She will be able to provide nutritious food for her child and her husband. In the future, she plans to expand her business for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Magdalena Del Rocio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familias Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 1 de Mayo en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Magdalena, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 2 hijos de 3 años y de 6 meses de edad. Su esposo es obrero y trabaja en una fábrica local.
Doña Magdalena es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ya que son muchos los gastos y lo que él hace no alcanza para solventarlos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatillas y bisuterías, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale ya sea en las mañanas o noches ofreciendo sus productos aunque la mayoría ya son solo para entregar ya que cuenta con muy buena clientela que siempre le piden sus productos, son más de 3 años  que se dedica a esta actividad  la cual comenzó con los créditos y ahora le permiten ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatillas y bisutería. Del Grupo De Crédito le gusta la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The communal bank Familias Unidas [United Families] meets every two weeks in the neighborhood called "1st of May" in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which get many visitors all through the year and for being a city of unrivaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Magdalena lives in this place. She is 34 years old, married, and together they have two children - one 3-year-old and one 6 months old. Her husband is a worker and works in a local factory.

Magdalena is a woman who likes to work to help her husband with the income because the expenses are high and he does not make enough to cover them. She earns money by selling clothes of all kinds, shoes and imitation jewelry. She is selling by going from door to door, either in the mornings or in the evenings, offering her products. Although by now most of them are only for delivery, she has very good customers, who always order her products. 

She has been doing this for more than three years. She started this business with a loan and it now allows her to make a living.

This loan is to buy more clothes, shoes and imitation jewelry. About the communal bank she likes the help these loans offer her. She dreams of giving her little ones the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and imitation jewelry.

loans.name: Zhamila

texts.ru: Жамила, 52 года, вдова, есть сын. Жамила в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, лошадь. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Также на 0,74 Га земли выращивает люцерну для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход около 5,500 сом (KGS). Жамила обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого, домашнего молока. Доходы Жамила направит на развитие бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zhamila is 52 years old and a widow. She has a son. As an income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. She has three cows and a horse on her farm. She sells milk on a daily basis. She also grows alfalfa for own use and for selling on 0.74 hectares of land. The monthly income is around 5,500 som (KGS). 

Zhamila turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 90,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows to increase the amount of ecologial milk for selling. Zhamila will direct the income towards deveoping her business and renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows in order to increase the volume of ecological milk to sell

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 63-year-old woman with three children.She has been a farmer for five years and earns 10,000 KES per month.

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizer  to  get a better harvest for her family and the market. 

She plans to use the  profits to purchase a dairy cow, educate her children, and provide medical care for her family.
 
Her hope is to improve her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 25-year-old  married woman with two children.  She has been a farmer for two years and earns 10,000  KES per month.

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizer to get a better harvest for her family  and the market. 

She plans to use the profits to purchase a dairy cow, educate her children, and provide medical care.

Her hope is to improve her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: KARLA VANESSA: Es una mujer sonriente, cordial, originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está casada y tiene un hijo de 6 años que estudia segundo grado de primaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como taxista. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de su hijo, desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de prendas, ropa nueva y calzado de manera ambulante. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua: aretes, cadenas, anillos, dijes, brazaletes, entre otras prendas de acero.  Ella sueña en construir su propia vivienda, ya que actualmente en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en: KARLA VANESSA is a smiling, warm woman, from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. She is married and has a 6-year-old child who is in the second grade at the primary school. Her husband works informally as a taxi driver. With the goal of having her own source of income and to contribute to the household expenses and her child's education, for the past year she has been working selling clothing, new clothing, and shoes as a street vendor. She is asking for the loan to purchase earrings, necklaces, rings, pendants, bracelets, and other steel items in Managua. Her dream is to build their own house, since currently they live in her parents' house.

loans.use: to purchase earrings, necklaces, rings, pendants, bracelets, and other steel items in Managua.

loans.name: Lucy Vilma

texts.es: Lucy tiene 21 años de edad esta soltera y trabaja en un negocio familiar, también está estudiando Enfermería Técnica donde ya va por el VI ciclo de la carrera en un instituto particular, Ella  se siente muy contenta con la profesión que eligió ya que le agrada cuidar de la salud de los demás. El préstamo lo invertirá para comprar una herramienta de estudio (laptop) y materiales que su estudio le demandan. Lucy tiene como plan a futuro trabajar en diferentes centros de salud y seguir estudiando para especializarse en obstetricia ya que cuidar de la salud de los demás para ella es muy importante. Se siente muy contenta con el apoyo que está recibiendo por parte de los inversionistas de KIVA y desea que el apoyo siga continuando.
texts.en: Lucy is 21 years old, single, and works in the family business. She is also studying technical nursing where she is in her 6th term in the major in a higher education program.  She is very happy with the profession she has chosen since she enjoys caring for others' health. The loan will be invested in the purchase of school supplies (a laptop) and materials that her schooling requires. Lucy has as her future plan to work in different health centers and to continue studying to specialize in obstetrics since taking care of others' health is very important. She is very happy with the support that she is getting from the Kiva investors and hopes that the support will continue.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies (laptop).

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lida; la socia sigue con el negocio de snack cafetería, la socia continua  vendiendo  cafés, hamburguesas, gaseosas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, leche entre otros.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Liderando las Palmeras communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Lida, she continues with her snack bar/café business. The member continues selling coffee, hamburgers, soft drinks, and more. The member is a responsible and determined person. The member wants to be able to continue working so that in this way to continue supporting her family.

The member asks for the loan to purchase rice, milk, and more.

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform, and promises to make the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase rice, milk, and more.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia Esther, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua  vendiendo  sus productos a sus amistades, familiares, clientes entre otros la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de  colonias  entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Liderando las Palmeras communal bank. The member, Esther, continues working in her business selling beauty products such as creams, perfumes, colognes, and more. The member is a responsible and determined person. The member continues selling her products to her friends, family members, customers, and others. The member wants to be able to continue working to continue supporting her family.

The member asks for the loan to purchase colognes, and more.

loans.use: to purchase colognes and more.

loans.name: Teresa Diolina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familias Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 1 de Mayo en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad. Su esposo es maestro constructor.
Doña Teresa es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y sabanas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella sale ya sea en las mañanas o noches ofreciendo sus productos aunque también vende en su casa a sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días lo cual le ayuda ya que cuando cobra realiza nuevas ventas. Ella lleva  más de 2 años  con su negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y sabanas. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank Familias Unidas [United Families] meets every two weeks in the neighborhood called "1st of May" in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which get many visitors all through the year and for being a city of unrivaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Teresa lives in this place. She is 51 years old, married, and together they have three adult children. Her husband is a master builder.

Teresa is a woman who likes to work to help her husband with the income. She is earning money by selling clothes of all kinds and bed sheets. She is selling by going from door to door, either in the mornings or in the evenings, offering her products. She is also selling in her house to her best customers. She gives the products on credit and charges one week later, which helps her because she makes more sales as people pay.

She has been doing this business for more than two years, which allow her to have her own income.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and bed sheets. It is her third loan cycle in this communal bank and she likes it because of the help these credits offer. Her goal is to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and bed sheets.

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone is 62 years old, married and blessed with four children. He has been practicing farming for the last 15 years.

He has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supplement his farming activity. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supplement his farming activity.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine benefitted from her first Kiva Kiva loan which was great and very profitable. She hopes that she will manage her second loan as well and thanks the lenders in advance. 

She lives in the village  of Varser in the Gegharkunik region. Narine has two sons who help her and lighten her farm work. Narine has cows, calves, a bull, piglets, and chickens. She likes her work which keeps her  active and young. She makes different tasty dairy-products  which are quickly sold.   These products include macun (national dairy-product), cheese, butter, and curd. She also sells meat and eggs from her farm. 

Narine relies on Kiva support with the hope of enlarging her farm. She will use this loan of 700.000 AMD to purchase of two more cows and feed,

loans.use: to purchase of two cows and feed.

loans.name: Valerya

texts.en:
Valerya sends her warmest greetings and thanks to all the Kiva lenders and she hopes for second partnership with them. Valerya is 52 years old and she is a widow. Now she lives in Arjut village, which is in Lori region. Valerya’s daughters are married and live with their families separately from mother. 

Valerya has a long time of experience as a biology teacher. The most important activity in Valerya’s life as she says as previously remains teaching students and pupils. She continues to works at the school and at the same time she gives paid privates courses at her house preparing the pupils for University exams. This time her Kiva loan she plans to use for furnishing the room, where she passes her courses each day and the other part of her loan she will use for paying for the training courses that she plans to take part connected with teaching methodology and innovations in that field.

loans.use: for paying for the training courses connected with teaching biology and innovations in that field.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child. She lives at a rental house  without running water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.
 
Fatuma has operated a tailoring business for  ten years to make suits for men and women. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

She will use the loan to purchase fabric and thread. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
A $800.00 loan is offered to Celeste to improve her business. Celeste opened her store in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like  rice,noodles,slippers,biscuits, coffee and salt. Celeste is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a bigger business after years of involving herself in doing business.  Celeste is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy rice,noodles,slippers,biscuits,coffee and salt

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
Sasun is 37 yaers old and he lives in the frontier village Sevkar of Tavush region. He lives with his wife and two sons, but he is one of those many families who decided never to leave their motherland, their native village despite of living in a very dangerous frontier district. He managed to established a farm and also to have his own small business of charcoal production and sale.  

On his farm he is engaged in swine breeding and especially in the sale of pork. In the farm he also has cows, calves, heifers, pigs and piglet and also chickens. Sasun’s wife sells their farm products right from their house; she sells eggs, milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, butter and curd. Their vegetable garden is not big and they use it its potato and tomato harvest for family use. 

This loan Sasun hopes to get as he wants to buy more pigs for his farm and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia  Nicasia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERNADO LAS PALMERAS, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos secos como quinua, trigo entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de maiz entre otros
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nicasia is a member of the communal bank Lidernado Las Palmeras. 

She earns her daily living with her business of selling dry goods such as quinoa, wheat, and so on. 

She has been doing this for a long time, thanks to the effort she puts into her business everyday. She is a responsible and diligent person. She wants to continue with her business in order to keep supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase maize and the like. She feels very grateful for this loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to purchase maize and the like.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shampoo, bath soap, detergent, soft drinks, canned sardines, coffee, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Theary's Group

texts.en:
Theary is a 45-year-old woman with 4 children who lives in the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. One child attends school. 

Theary has grown rice for 25 years. Her husband operates a motorcycle-taxi service to supplement family’s income. There are lots of pests and weeds on her farm. Theary earns 27,500 KHR per day and she cannot afford to support her family.  

This is her sixth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a group leader, she will use her loan to buy rice, fertilizer, and pesticides. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living conditions and to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy rice, fertilizer, and pesticides.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ambaji Group

texts.en:
Ambaji Group was started in the year 2015 at Risida, M. Rampur of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are 11 active, self-dependent women, with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members have their own professions and businesses. 

Babita is one of them, and she has taken a great role for her development and source of revenue improvement. She is standing at the first row as third person from the left side with raised hand in the photo. She is about 37 years old and living with her small family, her husband and one son and one daughter. 

Babita has been engaged in a footwear shop beside her own home at Risida for the last eight years. Her husband is helping her to promote the business. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of 9,000 INR. Her opinion is that from this small income it is very difficult to maintain her family, and to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. In the current market situation, the competition is also very high. 

Another big investment is necessary for the expansion of business, but fund scarcity is the main concern. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to avail a loan for the expansion of her business.

She plans to purchase a huge quantity of modern and popular footwear from the wholesaler. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for re-construction of her house. She also wishes to send her children to a better school for education.

The other 10 members of the group are also smart and actively engaged with different professions like cloth store, cycle store, medical store, tailoring, photo studio, fertilizer, hotel, book store and painting. With this loan, they all hope to boost up their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of modern and popular footwear.

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
Sokna, 42, is local farmer living in Kampong Cham province. She has three children, one attends school and the other one is too young. 

She has grown rice for 21 years and sells Khmer noodles to supplement her family’s income. Her crop has destroyed by insects and the yield was less then expected. Her profit from noodle sales was also down.  

In order to fulfill her family’s needs, she will use a Kiva loan via VisionFund to renovate her old house and build a  latrine. 

She hopes to improve her family’s living standard through this loan.

loans.use: to renovate her old house and build a  latrine.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Tunu Group

texts.en:
Rehema is aged early 50s not married and has got one son and three schooling daughters. She takes care of her family and depends on business income. Seven years now she has been managing a shop selling varieties of cosmetics (wholesale but in small boxes). She starts business from 6am to 5pm per day and is able to realize a good profit each month.
 
Rehema wants to grow her business to other centers so as to maximize income hence be sure in supporting her family.  To meet that, she has approach Tujijenge Tanzania to find credit support and this is her fifth request. She used the previous credits, paid back successful; to restock her shop with most demanded cosmetics.  Rehema earned some extra income which she used to build a house and paid school fees for her children.  She is happy with Kiva’s support. In the coming years, Rehema would like to grow more her business. 

With this new credit request, she will invest part to buy ten boxes of cosmetics. She will share this loan with Tunu, two members group who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy ten boxes of cosmetics for her shop.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia  Margot pertenece al banco comunal LIDERNADO LAS PALMERAS, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de brindar servicio de transporte de turismo, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia transporta a sus turistas a los distintos tours que realizan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
texts.en:
Margot is a member of the communal bank Liderando Las Palmeras. 

She earns her daily living with her business of providing transportation to tourists, and is grateful for this loan and committed to repaying it. She transports tourists to different tours she is offering. 

She is a very responsible and and diligent person, and by being so, improves her family's situation.

She is requesting this loan to perform maintenance on her car.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her car.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with two children, both school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not running water.

She has operated a retail shop business for four years, selling wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

She will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en:
Sochea is a 31-year-old woman with a child who attends school.  They  live in  the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. 

In order to support her family, she has grown rice and vegetables for 10 years. She earns 42,700 KHR per day. She has had insufficient water and insect problems.  These problems have negatively affected the quality of her products for the market. 

This is Sochea’s tenth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and those loans helped her to have better living conditions. She leads a 2-member group to request a new loan. She will use her loan to buy rice, pesticides, and fertilizer. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living conditions and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, pesticide, and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
A $1000.00 is offered to Domingas to improve her business. She has a store where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as sugar,salt,coffee and more.  She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Domingas independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar,salt,coffee and more

loans.name: Sidheswar Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015 ten self-dependent women of Badadunguriguda village of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India, formed a group named Sidheswar. Its main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social livelihood by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Mauna is the most active and energetic lady of the concerned village, and she has taken the leadership to form a self-help group. The incredible lady’s age is about 25 years, and she is standing in the first row, fourth person from left side, wearing a pink colored saree in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

For the last eight years, Mauna has been engaged in a cloth business with the help and support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of INR 8,000 from this occupation. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business through a loan. 

She will purchase a huge quantity of modern clothing items from the nearest market as per demand of the customers. Mauna hopes that this will definitely generate a handsome extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house. 

The other nine members of the group engage themselves in different small businesses like fast food, egg business, vegetable vending, electronic accessories shop, seasonal business, milk selling, cycle store, book store, fishery, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of modern clothing items as per demand of the customers.

loans.name: Maa Kali Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015 11 self-dependent women of M. Rampur village of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India, formed a group named Maa Kali. Its main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social livelihoods by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Gitanjali is the most active and energetic lady of the concerned village, and she has taken the leadership to form a self-help group. The incredible lady’s age is about 27 years, and she is standing in the first row, second person from right side with raised hand in the photo. 

She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

For the last seven years Gitanjali’s husband has been engaged in a welding workshop with the help and support of Gitanjali. He earns a monthly income of INR 8,000 from their occupation. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of the business through a loan. 

She will purchase welding-related items from the nearest market as per demand of the customers. Gitanjali hopes that this will definitely generate a handsome extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house. 

The other ten members of the group are engaged in different small businesses like food products, breakfast centre, vegetable vending, electronic accessories shop, seasonal items, milk selling, cycle store, book store, fishery, etc.

loans.use: to purchase welding-related items as per demand of the customers.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 54-year-old widow  living with her two children. She opened a tailoring shop in 2002 and sells accessories and rechargeable mobiles to help her family. She has a reputation for good work in her region. 

She requests a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. to increase her merchandise. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and improve her income and profit.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Nancy Estamilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia Nancy Estamilda, la socia continúa con el negocio de  snak cafetería, la socia continua  vendiendo  cafés, hamburguesas, gaseosas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de gaseosas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS.  The member, Nancy Estamilda, continues with her snack bar business and the member continues selling coffee, hamburgers and soft drinks amongst other things.  

The member is a responsible and diligent person.  The member hopes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.  

The member is applying for a loan to buy soft drinks amongst other things.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks amongst other things.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina, 40, is from the community of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with three dependents, age 3, 6 and 11.

She earns a living through rice farming and raising hogs. Celestina barely earns an average income of PHP 10,000 per harvest. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and feed for her hogs.  From this loan, she expects a good harvest and an increase in business profitability. 

The additional income will go to her family's daily consumption, school fees and possible new business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
A $ 1000.00 loan is offered to Aida to improve her kiosk business where many people come to buy every day. She will buy  noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, and biscuits.  She has had this business  since 2012 and is comfortable running the business to earn money every day.

Aida is an independent woman because she is responsible for herself and helps her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, and biscuits.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a 30-year-old  married woman who has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She needed working capital and applied for her first loan. She will use a second loan of $ 1.000.00 to buy coffee, sugar, salt, fish, eggs, and biscuits.

She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, salt, fish, eggs, and biscuits.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
A $ 1000.00 loan is offered to Amelia to improve her business. She is married and  has had a kiosk for 3 years. She will use the loan to buy candles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, slippers, and oils. She feels  comfortable  running her business because she earns money every day.

Amelia is independent because she is responsible for herself and  family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy candles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, slippers, and oils.

loans.name: Nueva Imagen Group

texts.es: La Sra. Etelvina tiene 59 años de edad, es soltera con 3 hijos pero solamente 1 depende de ella. Es la presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Nueva Imagen” que está formada por 8 personas con deseos de superarse. Ella tiene como negocio una bodega que ella misma implemento en su casa desde hace algunos años atrás con el propósito de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su hijo. El préstamo lo utilizara para invertir en surtir de más productos como bebidas y alimentos su bodega que viene creciendo considerablemente y por ende su calidad de vida está mejorando. Etelvina tiene en mente seguir esforzándose para que su hijo sea un profesional de éxito y también terminar de construir su casa. En la foto del grupo Ella se encuentra de pie en medio de las demás personas sentadas.
texts.en:
Etelvina is 59 years old, she is single with three children but only one of them depends upon her. She is president of the communal collection box 'Nueva Imagen' (New Image) which is made up of 8 people who want to better themselves. 

She has a wine cellar as a business which she set up in her own house a few years ago, with the intent of earning money to support her child. 

She will use the loan to invest in stocking more products such as drink and food in her wine cellar, which would then grow considerably and improve her quality of life. 

Etelvina thinks of continuing to strengthening herself so that her child will be a successful professional, she also wants to finish building her house. 

In the group photo she is standing amongst the others who are sitting down.

loans.use: but more drinks and food for their shop

loans.name: Verónica Mercedes

texts.es:
Verónica es una joven extrovertida, responsable y ordenada, por ello decidió estudiar administración de empresas porque es una carrera que le permite proyectarse como profesional en cualquier empresa. Ella se siente orgullosa de recibir el apoyo de toda su familia que la motivan a salir adelante.  

Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para comprar  una computadora y para pagar un curso de inglés. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá tener la principal herramienta tecnológica que le permitirá cumplir con todos sus deberes académicos. Asimismo, podrá aprender este idioma que es importante para el desarrollo de su vida profesional. Entre los planes de Verónica esta iniciar un negocio y continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Veronica is a young, outgoing, responsible and organised woman, she decided to study business management because it is a career which allows her to show herself as a professional in any business.

She feels proud of receiving the support of all of her family who have motivated her to continue moving forward. 

However, she is asking for a loan to but a computer and to pay for an English course. 

This will be of help to her because she would have the primary technological tool which will allow her to complete all of her academic work. 

Additionally, she will be able to learn the language which is important in developing her professional life. 

Amongst Veronica's plans, is starting a business and continuing with her studies.

loans.use: to buy a computer and pay for an English course.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start building a well, drilled by hand.

loans.name: Freddy Alberto

texts.es:
El principal criterio que Freddy tomó para decidir cuál carrera elegir fue: una profesión que le permitiera crecer como profesional y a la vez, como ser humano. Actualmente, él estudia tecnología médica y se siente seguro de haber elegido esto. 

Por ello, solicita un crédito para pagar los últimos módulos de titulación que le permitirán egresar de su carrera, además podrá comenzar a trabajar en su profesión. Entre los planes de Freddy están iniciar un laboratorio.
texts.en:
The main criteria that Freddy had when deciding which career to choose was a profession which would permit him to grow as a professional and, at the same time, to be human. Now, he studies medical technology and feels happy with his choice.
Because of that, he is asking for a loan to pay for the last modules of his degree which will allow him to graduate in his career, as well as to be able to work at his profession. One of Freddy's plans is to start a laboratory.

loans.use: to pay for the last modules of his degree

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es:
Con ahorros propios y préstamos de su mamá,  Gilberto inició su negocio de venta de ropa en el mercado.  Sin embargo, con el tiempo fue ganado clientes y convirtió su negocio en próspero y rentable. Ahora, es la principal fuente de ingresos de su hogar. 

Por ello, solicita un crédito para comprar toallas, frazadas, ropa interior, calcetines, pañoletas, etc. Esto le ayudará a ofrecer variedad de productos, en consiguiente sus ingresos aumentarán y podrá continuar invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gilberto started his business selling clothes in the market with his own savings and loans from his mother. However, in time he grew his customer base and his business became prosperous and profitable. Now it is the main source of income for his household.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy towels, blankets, underwear, socks, headscarves, etc. This will help Gilberto to be able to offer a variety of products. As a result, he will earn more income, and he will be able to continue investing in his business.

loans.use: to buy towels, blankets, underwear, socks, and headscarves.

loans.name: Malkia

texts.en:
Malkia is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers are her customers. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. With her KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, cooking fat, and oil. She dreams of expanding her business through the loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, cooking fat, and oil

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For over four years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. With her KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. 

Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Rubenia Carolina

texts.es:
Acceder a la educación superior es un privilegio, no todos tienen la oportunidad de iniciar una carrera universitaria. Por ello, Rubenia se siente gozosa de estar a punto de terminar su carrera de enfermería.

Sin embargo, solicita un préstamo para pagar los gastos de su  tesis, defensa y protocolo. Esto le ayudará a graduarse sin más contratiempo y podrá trabajar en cual área de su profesión. Rubenia planea ahorrar para comprar una vivienda.
texts.en:
Accessing higher education is a privilege, not everybody has the opportunity to start a university degree. For her, Rubenia  feels happy to be near finishing her nursing degree.

Nevertheless, she is asking for a loan to pay the costs of her dissertation, defence and protocol. This will help her to graduate without any more setbacks and she will be able to work in this sector. Rubenia plans to saver in order to buy a house.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of her dissertation, defence and protocol

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La Señora Ana tiene dos hijos, está casada con el Señor Freddy, hace más de 3 años, actualmente vive en casa de sus padres, quienes les han ayudado bastante. La Señora Ana es costurera y trabajo desde adolescente en varios talleres de costura, ella trabajaba desde muy temprano por la mañana y volvía a casa en la noche, con este ritmo de vida no veía mucho a su familia por lo que decidió comprarse sus propias máquinas de costura y actualmente realiza confecciones solo en las noches, aún así no le alcanza el dinero para poder hacer construir su propia casa. Es por esto que ella decidido aprender a conducir una movilidad en un centro de enseñanza, y solicita el crédito para la compra de un vehículo, con esto mejorará su calidad de vida en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en: Ana has two children. She has been married to Freddy for more than 3 years. Currently, she lives in the house of her parents who have helped her a lot. Ana is a seamstress and she has worked since she was a teenager at many sewing shops. She used to work since very early in the morning and to return home at night. With this way of life, she was not able to see her family too much. For this reason, decided to buy her own sewing machines and currently, she sews only in the evenings. However, she does not earn enough money to build her own house. This is why she decided to learn how to drive at a learning center. She is requesting a loan to buy a vehicle. With it, she will improve her quality of life in benefit of her family.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for taxi service to improve her quality of life in benefit of her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy watermelons, water, canned drinks and candies, with the aim of diversifying her products to tend to her customers

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a single woman who has no children. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a business selling clothes, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: María Alicia

texts.es:
Hace más de 8 años, María inició un pulpería con algunos ahorros que le generó su primer negocio de confección de ropa. Con el cual pudo generar lazos de amistad con todos los habitantes de su comunidad, que posteriormente, le hizo más fácil darse a conocer y conquistar clientes. 

Por ello, solicita un crédito para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, golosinas, salsas de tomate, sopas instantáneas, etc. Esto le permitirá tener diversidad de productos, en consiguiente aumentará sus ganancias. Entre los planes de María es convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
More than 8 years ago, María started a convenience store with savings she had from her first business making clothes. Through this, she was able to develop friendships with all of the residents in her community, which made it easier for her to make herself known and get customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy staple grains, soft drinks, sweets, ketchup, instant soup, etc. This will enable her to have a variety of products, which will in turn increase her profits. One of María's plans is to convert her convenience store into a distributor.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, soft drinks, sweets, ketchup, instant soups, etc.

loans.name: Helda

texts.en:
Helda is aged 21 years and she supports two children. She has been a farmer for the last two years and the business earns her KES 10,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her to get a better harvest for family use and a surplus for sale to clients in the market. 

Helda plans to use the profits gained to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to educate her children and also provide better medication for them. Her hope is to improve her living standards, become stable, and expand her agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her to get a better harvest for family use and a surplus for sale to clients in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: LA SEÑORA TIENE 65 AÑOS DE EDAD ES BISABUELA Y AYUDA A SUS HIJAS A CUIDAR A SUS BISNIETOS. COMENTA QUE DESDE NIÑA SE LE DIFICULTABA ESCUCHAR PERO SUS PAPAS NUNCA LA ATENDIERON. CON EL PASO DEL TIEMPO Y UNA VEZ CASADA BATALLABA MAS PARA ENTENDER, CONSTANTEMENTE SE CAÍDA PORQUE SUFRÍA DE MAREOS Y DESEQUILIBRIO. ELLA DESDE ADQUIRIR UN AUXILIAR AUDITIVO PARA PODER ESCUCHAR A SUS HIJOS, NIETOS Y BISNIETOS QUE SON LA ALEGRÍA DE SU VIDA.  DEPENDE DEL INGRESO QUE LE OTORGAN SUS HIJOS QUIENES DESEAN APOYARLA.
texts.en:
This woman, age 65, is a great grandmother.  She helps her daughters care for her great grandchildren.  She says that ever since she was a girl it was hard for her to hear, but her parents never took care of it.  As time passed, and she was married, she struggled more to hear.  She was always falling because she was dizzy and had no balance.  

She wishes to get a hearing aid in order to be able to hear her children, grandchildren, and great grandchildren.  They are the joy of her life.  She is dependent upon the income that her children, who wish to support her, give her.

loans.use: to pay for auditory treatment.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
En algunas comunidades de Nicaragua no se cuenta con trasporte adecuado, por eso se organizaron algunas   cooperativas de trasporte que incluyeron en el plan de circulación vehicular a los triciclos. Rosibel  es propietaria de un triciclo desde hace 8 años y esto se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. 

Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para comprar otro triciclo que le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias. Por ello, planea continuar invirtiendo en su negocio hasta contar con varios equipos de trabajo.
texts.en:
In some communities in Nicaragua, there isn't suitable transportation. As a result, residents organized various transportation co-ops which include tricycles. Rosibel has owned a tricycle for 8 years, and this has become her main source of income.

However, she is requesting a loan to buy another tricycle which will enable her to make more profit. For this reason, she plans to continue investing in her business until she has several teams of workers.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN JOVEN MUY TRABAJADOR SE CASO RECIENTEMENTE, SU ESPOSA SUFRE DE MIOPÍA POR LO QUE NECESITA GRADUARSE LENTES PARA PODER VER BIEN, DEBIDO A ESTA DEFICIENCIA VISUAL LA SEÑORA SUFRE DE FUERTES DOLORES DE CABEZA, LO QUE AFECTA SU VIDA. SU ESPOSO DESEA APOYARLA, LAMENTABLEMENTE SU INGRESOS  SON BAJOS.
texts.en: This young borrower is very hardworking.  He recently married, and his wife suffers from myopia and needs progressive lenses to see well.  Due to her vision problems she gets very bad headaches, which affect her life.  Her husband wants to support her, but unfortunately his income is low.

loans.use: to pay for optical treatment

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La señora es casada tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona muy entregada a su hogar nunca trabajo para dedicarse por completo a su familia, también tiene a su cargo el cuidado de su mama.
Con el paso del tiempo su vista se ha visto afectada y necesita graduarse  lentes ya que padece miopía, lamentablemente los ingresos con los que cuenta son pocos, su esposo trabaja como vigilante.
texts.en:
This borrower is married and has 2 children.  She is a person who is very devoted to her household. She does not work so that she can dedicate her time fully to her family.  In addition, she is in charge of caring for her mother.

Over time, her vision has deteriorated and she needs progressive lenses, because she suffers from myopia.  Unfortunately, she has little income; her husband works as a security guard.

loans.use: to obtain optical treatment

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La señora Gregoria  vive en el trópico de Cochabamba, migro del departamento de Chuquisaca, la señora es concubina y tiene una hija dependiente, actualmente viven en alquiler, antes trabajaban como jornaleros, con sus ahorros decidieron comprarse un lote de terreno agrícola donde ahora trabajan como agricultores, juntos están saliendo adelante con mucho esfuerzo y mucha dedicación a su actividad, a la fecha siguen ahorrando para comprarse un lote urbano, son personas responsables y trabajadoras, su actividad económica es la producción de yuca. La señora solicita un crédito para realizar un mantenimiento y ampliar su producción, así podrá generar buenos ingresos y pagar los gastos de su familia brindándoles mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria lives in the tropics of Cochabamba.  She migrated there from the department of Chuquisaca.  She is married, and has a dependent daughter.  At this time they are living in a rented dwelling.  They used to work as farmhands, and with their savings they decided to buy a plot of land where they now work as farmers. Together they are getting ahead with a lot of effort and dedication to their business.  Right now they continue to save to buy an urban lot.  They are responsible and hardworking people who make their living producing cassava.  

Gregoria is requesting a loan to improve her land and increase her production.  This way she will be able to generate good earnings, pay the family's expenses, and provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to improve her land and increase her production

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem is 36 years old, married, and blessed with three children. He has been operating a retail business for the last two years. He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to add more stock of grains and vegetables for resale. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hope is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to add more stock of grains and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is aged 22 years and he supports two children. He has been a shopkeeper for the last four years, and the business earns him KES 6,500 per month. 

He has applied for a first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision FundKenya to purchase more stock of products such as bread, sugar, baking flour and packets of sweets so as to enable him to meet client needs. 

He plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and educate his children. His hope is to expand his business sector.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of products such as bread, sugar, baking flour and packets of sweets to enable him to meet client needs.

loans.name: Filonila Del Rosario

texts.es:
Filonila, práctica el destazo reses y cerdos, también brinda el servicio de molino nixtamal, inicio su negocio hace 20 años, los días martes sale a comprar reses para destazarlas el día miércoles, posteriormente comercializa la carne, hueso y otros derivados  del animal en su comunidad, es una fuente de ingresos estable. La casa donde vive es propia y la comparte con su esposa y tres hijos.
Ha decidido solicitar un crédito en Padecomsm para tener un mejor inventario, comprara reses más grandes y robustas, tendrá oportunidad de aumentar su productividad para atender a más clientes, pretende que sus ventas crezcan y tener nuevos ingresos para ir cumpliendo puntualmente con sus compromisos.
Las aspiraciones de Filonila son tener mejores circunstancias, cancelar sus deudas y aportar más apoyo a su familia para tener una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Filonila, who butchers cows and pigs, also provides the service of a boiled corn mill. She started her business 20 years ago, and on Tuesdays she goes out to buy cows to butcher them on Wednesdays. Afterwards she sells the meat, bones and other animal derivatives in her community, which is a stable source of income. The house where she lives is her own and she shares it with her spouse and three children.
She has decided to ask for a loan with Padecomsm to have a better inventory. She will buy bigger and more robust cows so that she will have the opportunity to increase her productivity to tend to more customers. She expects her sales to grow and to have new income to be able to fulfill her commitments on time.
Filonila's aspirations are to have better conditions, to pay of her debts and to provide more support for her family to have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy bigger, more robust cows to be able to increase her productivity and tend to more customers

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is aged 58 years and married to Florence. He supports six children. He has been a farmer for the last two years, and the business earns him KES 10,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to enable him get a better harvest for family use and for the sale of the surplus in the market. 

He plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and educate his children to higher levels of education. His hope is to expand his agricultural sector and be self-reliant.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to enable him to get a better harvest for family use and for sale in the market.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel,  ha mejorado poco a poco su negocio de cultivo de granos básicos, crianza de ganado y cerdos, con los créditos que Padeccomsm y los inversionistas Kiva le han otorgado, cuenta con estabilidad económica y vive en mejores condiciones junto a su familia.
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para básicamente comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar mano de obra para desarrollar las actividades agrícolas de la temporada y de esa manera sembrar de inmediato granos básicos, espera que las cosechas sean abundantes y sanas.
texts.en:
Little by little Isable has improved his business of growing basic grains and raising cattle and pigs.  He has done this with the loans that PADECOMSM and the Kiva lenders have given him.  He has financial stability, and he lives with his family under better conditions.
