The amount of the loan will be used to purchase cement, sand, bricks and rods so that he can repair his house and provide a comfortable home for his family.
In the future he intends to finish building his house and buy a truck for merchandise transportation.
His biggest challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency in order to guarantee his future loans with Hluvuku Adsema.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, and rods in order to repair his house.

loans.name: Maricela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maricela, de 27 años de edad, está soltera, tiene dos hijos y no estudio debido a los escasos recursos de su familia.

Maricela, tiene su propia venta de verdura, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante.

Maricela, solicita el crédito para comprar redes completas de elotes, para surtir más la venta de frutas y verduras.

El sueño de Maricela, es mejorar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maricela, 27 years old, is single, has two children, and didn't go to school due to her family's limited resources.

Marciela has her own business selling vegetable which, with a lot of effort, she has managed to get ahead.

Maricela asks for the loan to purchase complete full sacks of corn to better stock her fruit and vegetable stand.

Maricela's dream is to improve her business and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase full sacks of corn.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is from Lagodekhi district. She is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children. Madona trades cosmetics and generates a small monthly income. She wants to open a beauty salon and requested a loan. 

The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan for purchasing the equipment such as hair irons, hair dryers, and shampoos. She will run the beauty salon and will offer her customers high quality service. Madona hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon and generate stable income.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a grocery stall selling vegetables; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.pt:
Senhora Ernestina, tem 37 anos de idade, vive maritalmente com o seu esposo, tem 4 filhos frequentando o ensino primário e secundário respectivamente, é negociante e vive em casa própria com a sua família a qual sustenta.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de chapas, cimento, pranchas, barrotes, blocos, para mudar a cobertura da sua casa visto que tem infiltração da água em tempos de chuvas.
No futuro pretende construir dependências para o arrendamento como forma de aumentar a renda familiar.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora como forma de garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 37 years old and in a common law marriage with her husband. She has four children who are in primary and secondary school respectively. She's a vendor. She lives with her family in a house that she owns, and she's the breadwinner.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase metal plates, cement, planks, beams, and bricks in order to replace the roof of her house. There is water sipping into her house when it rains.
In the future she intends to build rooms for renting our as a way of improving her family's income.
Her biggest challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency in order to guarantee her future loans.

loans.use: to purchase metal plates, cement, planks, beams, and bricks in order to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as cigarettes, eggs, biscuits, coffee and sugar. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, eggs, biscuits, coffee and sugar

loans.name: Judit

texts.en:
Judit is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as rice, beer, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, biscuits, candle, coffee, sugar and slippers. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. Judit is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, beer, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, biscuits, candles, coffee, sugar and slippers

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Joana to improve her business. Joana opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own work.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like fish, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, oils and noodles. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, oils and noodles

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en: Florinda is 30 years, and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better since she applied for her first loan, and she is applying for her second loan, of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, including cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, slippers and candles. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, including cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, slippers and candles.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: A $1,500 loan is being made to Genoveva to repair her house. She started construction of her house but she was not able to finish because of lack of money to buy materials, including cement, stone and sand. Now she is applying for a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to help finish off her house.

loans.use: to buy materials, including cement, stone and sand, to finish building her house.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is taking out a loan of $700 to improve her business. She runs a garden that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy additional stock to keep in her store, such as vegetable powder. She opened her garden a year ago, with her own working capital of $300. She is a hard working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetable powder to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is taking out a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, including biscuits, water, Coca-Cola, Sagiko (a fruit drink), Sprite, candles and fish. She opened her kiosk a year ago, with her own working capital of $200. Rosita is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, including biscuits, water, Coca-Cola, Sagiko (a fruit drink), Sprite, candles, and fish.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: MARIBEL: Es una mujer sonriente y amable de 33 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Trabaja como docente de educación primaria, desde hace 7 años.  Está casada, tiene 2 hijos: El mayor de 15 años estudia su tercer año de secundaria y una pequeña de 8 años de edad que cursa su tercer grado de primaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como conductor. Desde  hace 8 años habitan en una casa construida de madera y de tambo, que actualmente necesita reparación.  Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para cambiar madera rústica, madera cepillada, postes de madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella y su marido sueñan con construir su vivienda de concreto, porque es de mayor durabilidad y para brindarle mayor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maribel is a cheerful and kind 33-year-old woman. She belongs to the Miskito ethnic group in the city of Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. She has worked for 7 years as an elementary school teacher.

She is married with two children. The older is 15 years old and in the third year of secondary school, and the younger is a little 8-year-old girl who is in third grade. Maribel's husband works informally as a driver.

For 8 years they have lived in a house made of wood and stilts, and it is now in need of repairs. For this reason they are requesting a loan to replace the crude wood, planed wood, wooden posts, and nails, and to cover the labor costs. Maribel and her husband dream of building a house out of concrete since it is more durable and will provide greater security to their children.

loans.use: to replace her house's crude wood, planed wood, wooden posts and nails, and to cover the labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 62 años de edad, es ama de casa, está soltera y tuvo siete hijos, no estudio por motivo de escasos recursos.

María, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para vender, este negocio lo inicio desde hace 2 años, de esa manera ha generado los ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

María, solicita el crédito para comprar más cerdos medianos para engordarlos y luego ponerlos a la venta y para comprar vitaminas y comida para cerdos.

El sueño de María, es mejorar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a 62-year-old homemaker. She is single, had 6 children, and did not go to school for lack of resources.

Maria makes a living raising and selling pigs. She started this business two years ago, and it has generated enough income to cover the household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy more medium-sized pigs to fatten and put up for sale, and to buy vitamins and food for them. Her dream is to improve her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more medium-sized pigs to fatten and put up for sale, and to buy vitamins and food for them.

loans.name: Topik

texts.en:
Topik is a 43-year-old, married man from the village Nazarlo. He has pensioner mother and a wife who is a housekeeper. Topik is a hard worker who does much for making his precious family's living and covering its increasing needs. He repairs cars and also cultivates a plot of family-owned agricultural land, where he harvests greens to sell at the local market. 

However, he is unable to satisfy all his family's needs and requires an additional source of income to meet the daily costs more effectively. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Topik requested a loan from Credo to start up a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provision of business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Topik will purchase cattle and start selling it at the local open market with price markup.
 
This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Topik will be very thankful for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and start selling it

loans.name: Judit

texts.en:
Judit is applying for a loan of $800 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 28 years old.

She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as beer, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sagiko, Sprite, water, cigarettes, biscuits, candles, body lotion, noodles and slippers. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Judit is living in a town near by the school. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy beer, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sagiko, Sprite, water, cigarettes, biscuits, candles, body lotion, noodles and slippers

loans.name: Felisarda

texts.en: Felisarda is applying for a $1,000 loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She is 38 years old and runs a kiosk in front of her house.  Felisarda lives in a town near the school which means her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.  She will use the loan to buy stock to sell in her store such as biscuits, fish, candles, water, coffee, sugar, salt, and milk. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, fish, candles, water, coffee, sugar, salt, and milk for her shop.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has been involved in business activities since 2013. She started with her own working capital of $800.

She is requesting a loan of $600. She has a small kiosk in her house, so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use it to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including soap, biscuits, scissors, candy, batteries and other things to sell.

Anita is taking this loan because she has a plan to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy soap, biscuits, scissors, candy, batteries and other things to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a farmer who cultivates corn and coffee in the locality of Corostic, which is located in the jungle of Chiapas. Juan lives with his family in a house with no access to basic services such as electricity. Nowadays, Juan and his family burn firewood to light the house after sunset and they are constantly inhaling the smoke from the fire, which is bad for their health conditions. 

Juan wants to purchase a solar system to have access to electricity and with this be able to see better at night. With the solar system, Juan and his family will be able to spend time together and see at night, children will be able to do their homework after sunset, and Juan will be able to charge his cellphone. Juan's family also uses the cellphone to play music.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system to light his house and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gasoline, motor oil, and other types of fuel to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, es madre de 3 hijos, estudio hasta noveno grado, ya que tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven, ahora está casada y su esposo es empleado en un parque memorial en el cual hace trabajos de mantenimiento. 

María, se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos los cuales vende en la ciudad, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años y la aprendió con una señora donde ella trabajaba cuando estaba joven; decidió dedicarse a esta actividad al salir de su antigua vivienda debido a la delincuencia y para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar; María, para vender tiene que abordar el trasporte publico ya que la ciudad está a 6 kilómetros de su vivienda, sus hijos y esposo le ayudan en su tiempo libre para elaborar el producto y salir a venderlo.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar sal, leche y moldes con los que elabora los quesos, la demanda de clientes a aumentado, es por eso que necesita más producto y poder cubrir la demanda que tiene.

María, sueña con hacer crecer su negocio para darles la posibilidad a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios y logren ser profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Maria is the mother of 3 children. She studied until ninth grade, since she had to work since she was very young. Now, she is married and her husband works for a memorial park, where he does maintenance work. 

Maria makes a living by making dairy products, which she sells in the city. She has been doing this for 3 years, and she learned it from a woman where she worked since she was young. She decided to make a living in this business when she left her old home, due to delinquency, and to help her husband with the household expenses. In order to sell, Maria has to use public transportation since the city is 6 kilometers from her house. Her children and husband help make and sell the products in their free time.

The loan will be used to buy salt, milk, and molds that she uses to make the cheeses. Demand has increased. For this reason, she needs more products to be able to cover the demand that she sees.

Maria dreams of growing her business to give her children the opportunity to finish their studies and to become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy salt, milk, and molds that she uses to make cheeses.

loans.name: Marta Dilma

texts.es:
Marta, de 48 años de edad, no estudio, debido a falta de interés de sus padres, está acompañada, vive con su pareja y sus hijos, su pareja se dedica a la pesca artesanal en una laguna así como también a la producción de granos básicos. 

Marta, se dedica al comercio de mariscos y es ama de casa, este negocio lo ejerce desde hace veinte años y su pareja siempre la ha apoyado. 

Marta, necesita el crédito para comprar redes de pesca para continuar con este negocio. 

A futuro Marta, sueña con ampliar su casa y tener un negocio más estable.
texts.en:
Marta is 48 years old and never went to school due to her parents' lack of interest. She is married and lives with her partner and children. Her partner works as an artisan fisherman in a lagoon, and also works in the production of basic grains.

Marta is a homemaker, and she also works selling shellfish. She has worked in this business for the last twenty years and her husband has always supported her.

Marta needs a loan to buy fishing nets in order to continue her business. In the future, Marta dreams of extending her house and having a more stable business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets in order to continue her business.

loans.name: Manuel's Group

texts.en:
Manuel and Miguel are two farmers who cultivate corn, beans, and coffee in the locality of Corostic in the state of Chiapas. Corostic is located in the jungle in the mountains of Chiapas and has around 500 residents. None of the residents have access to basic services such as electricity. 

Manuel and Miguel live with their families and they use firewood and candles as sources of light, so they want to purchase solar systems to light their houses and improve their families' living conditions. With the light generated by the panels, they will be able to see at night.  They will be able to de-kernel corn after sunset and their children will be able to do their homework.

loans.use: to purchase solar systems to light their houses and improve their families' quality of life.

loans.name: Gubkatimali - Nagdigu 1 Group

texts.en:
Fuseina is 40 years old and married with six children, four of whom are dependent on her. She is a member of a shea nuts and butter processing group called "Gubkatimali - Nagdigu" in the northern region of Ghana. 

Fuseina is the individual seated at the middle with the hand raised in the photo.
 
Fuseina and her group have been in business for the past five years and have been trained on how to process premium shea nuts and butter for the local and export markets. Fuseina enjoys doing her business and has requested a loan of GHS 8,900 together with her group. Her share of the loan is GHS 400, which would be used to buy shea nuts for processing.
 
Fuseina wants to earn more income to pay back the loan and support her children to live a satisfied life. Fuseina is looking up to Kiva lenders for support. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Alba Cecilia

texts.es:
Ser más competitiva en el mercado y poder ofrecerles una buena educación a sus 2 hijos son las metas que motivan a levantarse y trabajar duramente a Alba, quien con su negocio de cría de gallinas ponedoras ha logrado tener el sustento para su familia.

Alba es una muestra del emprendimiento y la lucha constante que viven los colombianos para tener una vida digna y mejores oportunidades de progreso.

Alba buscando tener un negocio sostenible, perdurar en el tiempo, mejorar las ventas, tener mayor existencia en su granja quiere solicitar un crédito para construir un galpón, comprar gallinas ponedoras y tener una producción de huevos más alta y ser una distribuidora a considerar.
texts.en:
To be more competitive in the market and be able to offer a good education for her two children are the goals that motivate Alba to get up and work hard. Her business raising laying hens has managed to support her family.

Alba is a master of undertaking and constant struggle that Colombians endure to have a dignified life and greater opportunities to progress. Alba is looking to have a sustainable business, persisting in time, expand her sales and have more stock on her farm. So she is requesting a loan to build an enclosure, buy laying chickens, have higher egg production and become an important distributor.

loans.use: to build an enclosure, buy laying chickens, have higher egg production and become an important distributor.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en:
Sebastiana has a kiosk, where many people come to buy every day. She has been involved in business activities since 2002. 

A loan of $1,000 has been offered to Sebastiana to improve her business. With this loan, she will buy additional supplies, such as rice, beer, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, body lotion, biscuits and noodles.

She feels good about running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made her feel independent, because it enables her to be responsible for herself and also help her family. 

Sebastiana hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, beer, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, body lotion, biscuits and noodles

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily, who works alongside her daughter, Sandra, is an artist from Peru who specializes in silver jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver, gemstones, and chains for her designs. Lily has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is her story: Lily and Sandra are a mother and daughter team from Peru. It all began as a game, when Sandra's little boy was sent to fine psycho-motor therapy. They both became immersed in the manual training and realized that if they let their imagination run wild they could create original works of art. Lily recalls that when she was a child she developed an unexplainable fascination for all kinds of stones. One day, when she was playing with other kids in her parents' ranch in the Nazca valley she cut herself with an arrow. She kept the piece in her hand and treasured it for life, not knowing the stone's true name – obsidian. Now, many of her designs mainly feature obsidian. Lily loves to transform gemstones by giving them life through her designs. "I am a deeply religious person and I am certain that God planned for me and other artisans around the world to find this microcredit opportunity. I am very grateful to all of you. This loan will help cover the cost of acquiring raw materials. Unfortunately, I recently suffered a big loss due to a robbery at my workshop, but my faith has remained strong thanks in part to the timely support I am receiving through this loan." Use the link below to view Lily's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4395

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver, gemstones, and chains for her designs

loans.name: Pascoela

texts.en:
Pascoela is 35 years old. She is a very hardworking woman. Being in business has been her regular activity for the past 15 years. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. She earns a good income from her business. 

She is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She will use her loan to buy stock for her store, such as candles, biscuits, rice, beer, water, milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, cigarettes and fish. 

In the future, she wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy candles, biscuits, rice, beer, water, milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, cigarettes and fish

loans.name: Stainer

texts.es: STAINER: Es un hombre luchador de 45 años de edad, originario de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está casado, tiene 6 hijos en edad escolar. Cuenta con una experiencia de más de dos décadas de ser docente de educación primaria. Desde hace 12 años habita en una casa de tambo y madera. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura para su familia, solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavos. Él sueña con establecer una pulpería o dedicarse a la comercialización de mariscos.
texts.en: Stainer is a determined, 45-year-old man from the city of Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. He is married and has 6 school-aged children. He has more than two decades of experience as a primary education teacher. For the past 12 years, he has lived in a wooden house on stilts. In order to improve the conditions of his home, and to have a more dignified and secure residence for his family, he is requesting a loan to buy construction materials including wood, corrugated metal roofing, and nails. He dreams of establishing a grocery store or to make a living by selling shellfish.

loans.use: to buy construction materials including wood, corrugated metal roofing, and nails.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 47 ans, Abla  est une femme mariée vivant dans le quartier de Djidjolé avec ses deux enfants à sa charge. Abla est très dynamique et vend du charbon de bois dans le quartier afin de procurer un bénéfice nécessaire pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Abla s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Abla demande ce crédit pour commander quelques sacs de charbons de bois pour vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus.
texts.en: Abla is 47. Abla is married, and lives in the Djidjolé district with her two dependent children. Abla is very dynamic and sells charcoal in her neighbourhood in order to earn sufficient profit to provide for her family's needs. Abla buys her stock twice each month at the market. Abla requests this credit to order some sacks of charcoal for resale to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy 7 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dummuga Village. Muhammad joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Muhammad will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Muhammad now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his farm's yield.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Esperanza 3, 4 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Alina is the coordinator of her group, Dios es mi Esperanza 3, 4 & 7 (God is my Hope). This group is comprised of fifteen micro-entrepreneurs, both women and men, and is located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Their community is located in a rural area, surrounded by fields of sugarcane. Alina sells clothes, especially blue jeans. She will use her part of this loan to increase her inventory. 

Alina started her business almost four years ago by taking loans and investing the money in her business. Alina is a single mother and lives with her two children.  Her biggest challenge is raising her children. She is receiving her 7th loan from Esperanza Internacional, and because her previous loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business. She would like to save her profits to make bigger investments in the future. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, 40, is married and has three children to provide for. To earn a living, she is engaged in banana production. She plants bananas and sells them in her neighborhood and at the nearby market.

Emily aims to increase her income to meet her family's needs, so she has decided to borrow money to purchase fertilizer for banana farming.

In the future, she plans to save money from her business income to sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for banana farming.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marivic is 37 years old and has five children who are in school.

Marivic has a repair shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

Marivic has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, no estudio, está soltera, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo dos viven con ella y los otros dos viven en USA y estÁn acompañados y tienen sus propios hogares, de los dos hijos que viven con ella solo uno trabaja, tambien vive con ella su mamá.

Blanca, trabaja con ganado de repasto desde hace más de 8 años y lo decidio por iniciativa propia y para buscar un ingreso economico extra, además trabaja la agricultura, antes solo trabajaba como empleada doméstica y eso le permitio criar a sus hijos y darle educacion porque fue padre y madre a la vez; el lugar en donde tiene su ganado está a una distancia de 6 cuadras.

Blanca, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, para cuidarlos, engordarlos y luego venderlos a una mejor precio.

Su sueño es tener más vacas lecheras y producir lácteos para comercializarlos en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Blanca did not study. She is single and has four children. Only two of them live with her. The other two live in the USA, are married, and have their own homes. Of the two children that live with her, only one of them works. Her mother also lives with her. 

For more than 8 years, Blanca has worked with grazing cattle. She chose this line of work of her own initiative and to obtain extra income. She also works in agriculture. Before, she only worked as a domestic employee. This allowed her to raise her children and provide them with education, since she was both father and mother at the same time. The place where she keeps her cattle is 6 blocks away from her home. 

Blanca needs the loan to buy grazing cattle, in order to take care of them, fatten them, and later sell them at a better price. 

Her dream is to have more dairy cows and to produce dairy products to sell in the community.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Mathew Nahabi

texts.en:
Mathew Nahabi is a Babban Gona farmer from Kunda Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Mathew Nahabi no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to improve his farming. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Mathew Nahabi has ambitious plans to harvest 50 bags of maize. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mathew Nahabi now has the opportunity to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his farm’s yield.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Agée de 55 ans, Ayawa  est une femme mariée vivant à Bè avec ses deux enfants à sa charge. Ayawa est très dynamique et vend des fruits pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Son activité lui procure un bénéfice nécessaire pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Ayawa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Ayawa demande ce crédit pour commander quelques sacs d’oranges et de bananes pour vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Ayawa  is 55. She is married, and lives in the Bè district with her two dependent children. Ayawa  is very dynamic and sells fruit to satisfy her customers. Her business brings in sufficient income to provide for her family's needs. Ayawa  buys her stock twice each month at the market. Ayawa  requests this credit to order some sacks of oranges and bananas for resale to earn more income and ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of bananas and 1 sack of oranges.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 15 years now and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 30 years old and married with one child.

Narcisa earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Narcisa has been raising livestock for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 37 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marilou has been farming vegetables for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en: Marcelo has been involved in operating a furniture shop since 2013. He started his business with his own working capital of $1000. He also cultivates animals, like pigs, chickens and dogs. Marcelo is a carpenter. He has a furniture shop in his house. He is requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin because he wants to buy additional materials, including wood, boards, wooden beams, drilling machines, chisels, profile machines and other materials to use. He is happy because, with this loan from Tuba Rai Metin, he can build his business so big in the future.

loans.use: To buy wood, boards, wooden beams, drilling machines, chisels, profile machines and other materials to use.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio es un hombre emprendedora y dinámico, que se ha criado en el campo, donde su padre le enseñó a cuidar la tierra y criar animales; a sus 46 años de edad, ha ampliado sus conocimientos sobre agricultura y el cuidado del medio ambiente; esto lo motivo para iniciar su propio negocio; un pequeño cultivo de flores que está ubicado en la finca donde reside. 

Sergio solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (semillas, abonos, tierra, musgo, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener unos mejores cultivos y en mejores condiciones.

Sergio es consciente que para lograr la meta propuesta, debe trabajar arduamente, con esmero, disciplina y mucha dedicación, así podrá acreditar poco a poco su vivero para que, en un futuro a mediano plazo pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y ayudar a que otras personas mejoren su calidad de vida, así como el mejorará la suya con su oficio.
texts.en:
Sergio is a dynamic and entrepreneurial man who grew up in the countryside, where his parents taught him to care for the land and raise animals. At 46 years old he has acquired extensive knowledge about agriculture and protecting the environment. This motivated him to start his own business: a small crop of flowers located on he plantation where he lives.

Sergio is requesting a loan, with which he hopes to buy wholesale farm supplies (seeds, manure, soil, moss, and others). This will allow him to have a better crop and better conditions.

Sergio is aware that in order to achieve his goal, he must work arduously with care, discipline, and much dedication. This will enable him to grow his garden little by little, so that in the mid-term future he may generate employment opportunities, and help others improve their quality of life just like he is improving his own with this business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale farm supplies (seeds, manure, soil, moss, and others).

loans.name: Felismina

texts.en:
Felismina is seeking a $1,000 loan to improve her business.  She is married and has a mini shop selling clothing where many people come to buy every day. 

She will use her loan to buy additional inventory such as shirts, shorts, and pants. She has had her business since 2009 and feels comfortable running it because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Felismina independent because she is responsible for herself and also helps her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts, and pants to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.en:
Maria de la Luz is 49 years old, married, and has three sons. She likes to work in her stationary store.  She enjoys buying products to stock her store and dealing with people. In her free time, she works as a volunteer in her neighborhood church. 

She is asking for a loan to restock her store and prepare for the back to school season. Her biggest accomplishment is taking care of her children and making them good citizens and her goal is to keep working hard and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her stationary store and prepare for the back to school season.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva, a businesswoman, lives is Ermera. She has a clothing shop and also sells in the market. She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She started her business with her own working capital of $1,500. 

Eva earns good income from selling clothes, because many people like to buy them. She is still happy to be in her business. She also has animals, such as cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.
 
Eva is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy trousers, turtlenecks, short- and long-sleeved shirts and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Odontsatsral

texts.en:
Odontsatsral, 28, lives with her husband in Kherlen, the easternmost town in Mongolia. She has been working as a saleswoman at a grocery store since 2010. Her husband works in the military. 

With her previous loan, Odontsatsral renovated her house, but her house was greatly damaged by an intense storm last year. So, she is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 Mongolian tugriks to buy building materials, such as cement, sand, pebbles and bricks, to build strong walls for her house. 

After this renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned, releasing fewer pollutants into the air. 

Odontsatsral is very hardworking woman who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to build durable walls for her house

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: María tiene 41 años de edad,  vive en casa propia junto a su hijo de 12 años de edad por quien lucha cada día para poder brindarle sus estudios. María anteriormente solicito un crédito para invertir en la reparación del techo de su vivienda pero debido  al deseo de superarse económicamente y mejorar su calidad de vida decidió redireccionar el monto para instalar  una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad como sopas, granos básicos y bebidas  en su casa de habitación, poco a poco se ha ido dando a conocer en el negocio en su comunidad y cada día son más las personas que prefieren sus productos. María debido a su buena experiencia de superación y con un mismo objetivo de mejorar el techo de su vivienda vuelve a solicitar un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en  lámina galvanizada y polines y de esta manera brindar a su hijo un hogar más digno.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old. She lives in her own house with her 12-year-old son, for whom she fights everyday to offer him an education. 

Maria previously requested a loan to invest in repairing the roof of her house, but because of her desire to improve herself financially and improve her quality of life, she decided to redirect the loan amount to start a small store in her house. Her store sells basic necessities, such as soups, basic grains, and drinks. Little by little, her business is becoming known in her community, and each day there are more people who prefer her products. 

Thanks to her experience with self-improvement and with the same goal of improving the roof of her house, she returns to request a new loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheets and poles. In this way, she will offer her son a more dignified home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets and poles to improve the roof of her house.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Help Juanita see a glimpse of a better future through your generosity today. With a dream to boost progress in her business and provide her children with a better kind of living through enabling them to finish their studies, she works very hard to help her husband sustain the family.

This is Juanita and in addition to the tailoring business she is currently involved in, she also operates a small sari-sari store business where she had spent her previous loan. She was able to faithfully repay the loan she got worth PHP 12,000 recently. This couldn't have been possible without your help lenders. Thank you so much! Through you, she was able to buy enough supplies of variety products for her sari-sari store business, thus, paving the way to a better remedy for their family's daily expenses.

This time, she wants to improve the other business. She would like to ask again for a loan worth PHP 15,000. This would be a big help for her family. She would use this certain amount to improve the inventory by acquiring an additional sewing machine and other raw materials needed in her tailoring business. She knows that with this purpose, clothing production would be much easier.

She is truly hoping that you'll consider her request.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to acquire an additional sewing machine and other raw materials needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Areiso De Jesus

texts.es:
Areiso un humilde agricultor que cada mañana sale a trabajar en su campo, dedicado en pleno a su trabajo, este hombre solo piensa en progresar y entregar un buen producto pues sabe que muchas personas lo consumen y por ello cada gota de sudor que sale de su frente es el empeño que pone para que su productos salgan puros y de calidad, 

Como todo buen agricultor, quiere siempre implementar arreglos y mejoras para a sus cultivos de aguacates es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como riegos, abonos, fungicidas ya si podrá tener unos cultivos en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Areiso is a humble farmer who goes out every morning to work in his fields. He is fully dedicated to his work and thinks only of progressing it and delivering a good product. He knows many people consume the food, so every drop of sweat that falls from his forehead is out of determination to provide pure and high quality products.

Like every good farmer, Areiso is always wishing to make improvements or repairs on his avocado crop. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies such as water for irrigation, fertilizer, and fungicide, so that his crop will be in better condition.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as water for irrigation, fertilizer, and fungicide, so that his crop will be in better condition.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Delia has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a general store.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
Zaman, who is a 33-year-old young man, is from a very poor family. He lives in the village Keshalo. Zaman has a housekeeper wife and two children. 

He was unable to start any stable job, as he has a secondary education only and there is also a high unemployment rate in the region. Zaman has temporal activities and repairs houses on private orders. 

He has a great desire to increase his family's very poor living conditions and meet even their basic needs. Zaman requested financial support to start a stable activity and do his best to tackle the financial difficulties. 

According to above mentioned situation, Zaman lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of 2,500 GEL and start a trading business. 

Zaman will periodically purchase fresh fruits and vegetables to sell in the local market on his own. He will have loyal customers among the local people and will get the opportunity to make a living wage for his family. 

Zaman and his family members rely on the goodwill of Kiva lenders and will highly appreciate your support and kindness.

loans.use: to start trading in fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Cristela Yamileth

texts.es:
Cristela, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres y dos sobrinos.

Cristela, se dedica a la producción de granos básicos, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años, todo lo desempeña con el apoyo de su padre, para la sostenibilidad de la familia y el desarrollo económico. 

Cristela, necesita el dinero para comprar fertilizantes para la producción de granos básicos y sandía.

Cristela, sueña con tener una familia.
texts.en:
Cristela is 26 years old. She studied through ninth grade. She is single, and she does not have children. She lives with her parents and two nephews. Cristela makes a living producing basic grains. She has been performing this work for the past 6 years, and she does everything with the support of her father for the sustainability and economic development of her family.

Cristela is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for the production of basic grains and watermelon. Cristela dreams of having her own family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the production of basic grains and watermelon.

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
What if I tell you, "You can now be an answer to her prayer" What would you do?

Meet Argie. She's undeniably a selfless and passion-driven mother. When we talk about working hard just to raise her children, she's unstoppable. This is maybe the reason why her husband, Michael, loves her so much.

Back then, Argie wasn't able to reach a college phase of life. Today she's 32. But though she and her husband entered into having a family that early (mentioning that they now have two kids), they still remain persevering, knowing that someday they can also rise from an awful poverty.

Argie owns a small sari-sari store today (commonly known as a variety store). Here she sells different commodities such as toiletries, beverages, condiments and other grocery items. Customers are attracted to buy because of the low cost prices of the items. At the same time, she sells mineral water.

To further improve sales, she is asking for your help. She wants to sustain her family needs and she envisions her business turning into a wholesaler business. The realization of this starts today if you let her borrow a loan worth PHP 37,000. She would use this to buy more grocery stuffs and mineral water to sell in her sari-sari store.

She hopes that you will not ignore this. It means a lot to her if you respond to her prayer.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery stuffs and mineral water to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ramanatahiry

texts.fr:
Ramanatahiry est une jeune femme dynamique de 30 ans. Elle vit à la campagne avec son mari et ses 4 enfants. Elle exerce une activité de culture et élève quelques porcs et volaille. Elle tient aussi un commerce de produits locaux dans son village. 
Cela fait 3 ans qu’elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra. Les prêts précédents lui ont permis d’augmenter le capital utilisé dans la vente de  produits locaux et d’étendre l’élevage porcin. Pour son 6ème prêt, elle compte acheter deux zébus qu’elle utilisera pour conduire la herse qui servira à labourer les terres. Elle pourra aussi louer ce service aux autres paysans. 
Ramanatahiry a pu construire une maison avec les bénéfices des prêts précédents et espère gagner encore plus de bénéfices avec ce prêt afin d’épargner pour assurer l’avenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ramanatahiry is an energetic 30-year old woman. She lives in the countryside with her husband and four children. She grows farm crops and raises pigs and poultry. She also sells local products in her village.

She has been a borrower with Vahatra for three years. Her prior loans allowed her to increase her working capital for selling local products and also expand her pig business. For her sixth loan, Ramanatahiry plans to buy two zebus as draft animals to pull  harrows on her field. She would also be able to provide this service to other farmers.

Thanks to revenues enabled by her prior loans, Ramanatahiry has built a house. She hopes to earn additional revenues with her loan, in order to grow her savings and provide for her family's future.

loans.use: to buy two zebus as draft animals for tilling her field as well as for being leased out to other farmers.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 59 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelfa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like canned goods, coffee, cereals, feed, rice, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Adelfa has been in this business for 22 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, cereals, feed, rice, soft drinks, etc.

Adelfa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, coffee, cereals, feed, rice, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jaime Alonso

texts.es:
Jaime nació en una familia campesina humilde y trabajadora, virtudes que le enseñaron sus padres a medida que fue creciendo, además de involucrarlo en todas las actividades del campo. 

Gracias a ello, hoy en día, a sus 20 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, pues posee cultivos de caña, adicionalmente alterna esta actividad laborando como jornalero para complementar los ingresos con los cuales sostiene a su familia. 

Su empuje y tenacidad lo han llevado a lograr los objetivos que se propone y siempre va en busca de alternativas que le ayuden a salir adelante, esto lo motiva para solicitar el crédito con el que comprará insumos agrícolas (venenos, abonos, fungicidas, entre otros) con los cuales continuará cuidando sus cultivos y podrá obtener una cosecha más productiva que le generará mejores ingresos, de esta forma Jaime podrá seguir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de adquirir más tierras y cultivarlas, que su actividad crezca y le permita disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de su amada esposa.
texts.en:
Jamie was born into a humble and hard-working family of farmers.  His parents passed these virtues onto him as he was growing up, and involved him in all of their activities in the field.  

Today, at 20 years old, he makes a living as a farmer thanks to his upbringing.    He owns sugarcane crops and alternates this business with a job as a day-worker to complement his income, which he uses to sustain his family.

His drive and tenacity have brought him to achieve the goals that he puts his mind to and he always goes looking for alternatives that help him to get ahead.  Therefore, he wants to apply for a loan to buy agricultural inputs (pesticides, manure, fungicides, among other things) that he will use to continue to care for his crops and to be able to reap a more productive harvest that will generate more income.  This will allow him to continue forwards to accomplish his dream of owning more land and planting on it, and his business will grow and allow him to enjoy a better life alongside his beloved wife.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs (pesticides, manure, and fungicides, among other things).

loans.name: Jose Farnesio

texts.es:
Jose, con 23 años de edad, es un hombre soltero. 
Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas al lado de su padre; gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene cultivos de caña, cuya cosecha es vendida y de esta manera obtiene los recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar. 

El prestatario es un hombre pujante, luchador, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, eso lo motiva para trabajar largas jornadas y tratar de salir adelante; día a día lucha para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, ha pasado por situaciones económicas difíciles debido al bajo precio del caña en el mercado, lo que afecta el precio de su producto. 

Jose solicita su crédito en la Corporación Interactuar para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas), con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y preparar sus cultivos para cosechar un producto de muy buena calidad.

Jose sueña con mejorar sus cultivos, ampliarlos para obtener de estos una buena renta mensual.
texts.en:
He was born and raised on a farm, where he learned agricultural work from his father. Thanks to this, he now has cane crops, which he harvests and sells. In this way, he earns resources to bring food to his home.

Jose is a thriving and persevering man, who is dedicated to his family and to his work. This is his motivation for working long days and for trying to go forward. Day after day, he first to overcome the obstacles that he encounters. He has gone through difficult financial situations because of the low price of cane in the market, which then affected the price of his product.

Jose requests a loan from Interactuar to invest in buying agricultural supplies, such as manure, fertilizers, and pesticides, with the goal of being able to continue his business and prepare his crops so that he harvests a very high-quality crop.

Jose dreams of improving his crops and increasing them to earn a better monthly profit.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as manure, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beans, peanuts and blankets in the neighboring country for re-selling in the national market.

loans.name: Patricia Saraí

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 28 años de edad, su madre se esforzó para ayudarle a culminar sus estudios de bachillerato, está soltera y aún no tiene hijos.

Patricia se ha dedicado a trabajar en tiendas, luego como impulsadora de ventas en una empresa comercializadora de productos de primera necesidad, actualmente,  vende lociones, cremas y cosméticos para dama, y además trabaja como vendedora de teléfonos.


Ella necesita este crédito para comprar más lociones, cosméticos para damas, cremas entre otros productos.

Ella sueña con estudiar en la universidad y tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Patricia is 28 years old.  Her mother struggled to help her finish high school.  She is single and doesn't have any children yet.  

Patricia has made a living working in stores, and later as a sales promoter in a commercial enterprise selling daily necessities.  Currently she sells lotion, creams, and cosmetics for women, as well as working as a telephone salesman.  

She needs this loan to buy more lotion, cosmetics for women, and creams, among other products.  

Her dream is to study at university and to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more lotion, cosmetics for women, and creams, among other products.

loans.name: Pedro William

texts.es:
Pedro, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, dos hijos ya son independientes y le ayudan en ocasiones económicamente, actualmente se dedica a la venta de gas licuado, además realiza entregas a domicilio, su negocio lo tiene aproximadamente hace cinco años, inicio con poco inventario y utilizo capital propio, ya cuenta con muchos clientes y no representa dificultades.
Necesita de un crédito para comprar una motocicleta para salir a repartir los cilindros de gas licuado, tendrá oportunidad de atender a nuevos clientes y realizar sus actividades en menor tiempo, espera que las demandas continúen aumentando.
La visión de Pedro es tener nuevos ingresos para cancelar su deuda y mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Pedro lives with his wife and children.  Two children are independent now and they occasionally help him financially.  Currently he earns a living selling liquified gas.  He also makes home deliveries.  He has had the business for about five years; he started with very little inventory and used his own capital.  Now he serves a lot of customers and has no difficulties.

Pedro needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for going out to deliver the cylinders of liquified gas.  He'll be able to serve new customers and do his job in less time.  He hopes his demand continues to increase.

Pedro's goal is to have more income to pay back his debt and improve the infrastructure of his home.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for delivering cylinders of liquified gas so he can serve new customers and do his job in less time

loans.name: Jelbie

texts.en:
Jelbie is 29 years old and single. She wants to help her parents to earn a living, so she started growing bananas. She plants bananas and sell them to the local market. She wants to increase her income to provide for the needs of her parents, which is why she borrowed a loan. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her banana farm so that she can produce good quality bananas and sell plenty of them in the market to generate a better income.

In the future, Jelbie plans to buy a new vehicle to use in the delivery of bananas.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina, a 76-year-old married mother of five, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For 20 years she has operated a fruit vending business in the Philippines

Now requesting a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell, Marcelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Nixon Arturo

texts.es:
Nixon de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, ya que desde muy joven ingresó a la fuerza armada, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian, su esposa y ellos dependen directamente de él. 
Nixon tiene un negocio de lavado de autos, también hacen reparaciones de llantas, esto lo aprendió con un amigo más joven, este negocio lo tiene desde hace más de dos años  y su familia se involucra mucho en este trabajo.
Él necesita el crédito para comprar herramientas para su taller de autos.
Él sueña con tener más maquinaria para que su negocio progrese y así mejores su situación familiar.
texts.en:
Nixon is 33 years old. He has studied up to ninth grade, as he joined the armed forces at a young age. He has three children, two of whom are at school. They and his wife depend directly on him.

Nixon has a car-wash business and also carries out tyre repairs, which is something he learned from a younger friend. He has owned his business for over two years, and his family is very involved in this work.

Nelson needs a loan to buy tools for his car workshop. His dream is to have more machinery so his business can progress and so he can thus improve his family situation.

loans.use: to buy tools for his car workshop.

loans.name: Antonia Claribel

texts.es:
Antonia vive únicamente con su hijo de cinco años, no tiene parientes en el extranjero, ella cumple con sus labores domésticas y desempeña el oficio de sastre para tener acceso a recursos económicos que necesita para costear los gastos de su hogar, el negocio lo tiene desde hace más de tres años y lo realiza a tiempo completo, el oficio lo heredo de su madre.
Opta por solicitar un crédito para comprar una máquina de coser eléctrica, tendrá un equipo moderno para realizar sus actividades de elaboración deprendas de vestir, espera que sus clientes estén satisfechos con la calidad de su trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos para cancelar su deuda.
Antonia aspira a tener beneficios para cambiar el estilo de vida familiar y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Antonia lives on her own with her five year old son. She doesn't have any relatives abroad. She completes her household chores and works as a seamstress in order to have access to the economic resources necessary to cover the expenses of her home. She has had the business for more than 3 years and works full-time. She inherited the business from her mother.  

She chose to request a loan in order to buy an electric sewing machine. She will have modern equipment to do her work making clothing. She hopes that her clients will be satisfied with the quality of her work and in this way she will be able to increase her income in order to pay her debts. 

Antonia aspires to have benefits to change her family's lifestyle and offer a better future to her son.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Celia Janeth

texts.es:
Celia es una mujer, ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener ciertas ventas. 

Sueña con ver su negocio crecer y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que apoyen su oficio podrá lograrlo.

Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar más gallinas para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Tatiana también desea tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda su capacidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
Celia is a woman who has had to overcome many hardships throughout her life. Nevertheless, she has always had the strength to succeed and to continue moving forward with her family. Some time ago, she started an egg sale business, for which she has a number of chickens that allow her to make a certain quantity of sales.

She dreams of seeing her business grow, and she knows that she will be able to achieve this with the help of Interactuar and of the people that support her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more chickens in order to increase her egg production capacity so that she can meet the demand of her customers for eggs. This way, her sales will increase considerably. Additionally, her business will recover and move forward. Celia also wishes to have a great business so that she can use all of her working capacity.

loans.use: to buy more chickens in order to increase her egg production capacity so that she can meet the demand of her customers for eggs.

loans.name: Julia Hildai

texts.es:
Julia, tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudian y el otro aún no va a la escuela porque está pequeño, ella estudio hasta bachillerato, no logro continuar estudiando debido porque sus padres eran de escasos recursos, es madre soltera y solo dependen de ella sus 3 hijos.

Julia, se dedica a la venta de lociones y productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace 5 años, ella se dedico a este negocio ya que no encontró otra forma de trabajo para llevar el sustento del hogar, ahora comercializa estos productos en las comunidades aledañas a su vivienda.

Julia, necesita el crédito para comprar más producto como lociones, cremas y maquillaje, de esta forma pretende salir a vender sus productos a lugares diferentes.

Julia, sueña con tener su casa propia ya que actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres, ademas desea en el futuro ver a sus hijos como profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia has 3 children.  2 of them study and the other one doesn't go to school yet because he is still little.  She went to school until high school.  She wasn't able to continue studying because her parents didn't have the necessary economic resources.  She is a single mother and her 3 children depend on her alone.  

Julia has made a living selling lotion and beauty products from catalogs for 5 years.  She made a commitment to this job and didn't find any other kind of job to sustain her household.  Currently, she sells her products in the communities around her home.  

Julia needs this loan to buy more products such as lotion, creams, and makeup.  She intends to go out and sell her products in different places.  

Julia's dream is to have her own home, since she is living in her parents' home at the moment.  She also wants to see her children become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products such as lotion, creams, and makeup to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina de 56 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de prepararse académicamente, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de los cuales ninguno estudió por dificultades económicas, dos de ellos son independientes y solo uno vive con Angelina.
 

Angelina se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos,  como lo es maíz, maicillo, frijoles entre otros, también siembra hortalizas y esto lo ha hecho siempre  ya que su familia se lo inculcó.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar abono para aplicar a sus cultivos.

Su meta es obtener una buena cosecha para su alimentación.
texts.en:
Angelina is 56 years old.  She didn't have the opportunity to prepare herself academically.  She is a single mother of 3 children, none of whom went to school because of economic difficulties.  Two of her children are independent and only one of them lives with her.  

Angelina makes a living growing basic grains such as corn, millet, and beans, among other crops.  She also grows vegetables, as she has always done with her family.  

She is asking for this loan to buy manure to apply to her crops.

Her goal is to reap a good harvest to feed herself.

loans.use: to buy manure to apply to her crops.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, es madre de 3 hijos, estudió hasta primer grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, de sus 3 hijos solo uno vive con ella y es el único que depende económicamente de ella.  

Gloria, se dedica a la venta de ropa y también tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 20 años se dedica a estas actividades, sus padres desde muy joven le enseñaron a trabajar en la tierra y a hacer los oficios domésticos.  

Gloria, necesita el crédito para comprar ropa y mercadería para su tienda como golosinas, arroz y frijoles, con el financiamiento espera dar un mejor manejo a su tienda y obtener mejores ganancias. 

Gloria, sueña con verse como una comerciante exitosa, además sueña con mejorar su casa y construir un cuarto para su hija.
texts.en:
Gloria's the mother of three children.  She studied up to third grade.  She's married and her husband grows basic grains.  Only one of her three children lives with her, and he's the only one who's financially dependent on her.

Gloria earns a living selling clothing.  She has also had a small store for 20 years.  Her parents taught her to work the land and take care of the house when she was very young.

Gloria needs the loan to buy clothing as well as merchandise for her store such as candy, rice, and beans.  With the loan she hopes to better manage her store and earn more profits.

Gloria dreams of being a successful merchant and of improving her house and building a room for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy clothing and merchandise for her store such as candy, rice, and beans

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga, de 42 años de edad, está casada, se dedica al comercio y tiene 3 hijas.

Olga, tiene una tienda en su casa desde hace tres años, quien con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante su tienda.

Olga, solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos pequeños y criarlos para luego ponerlos a la venta.

El sueño de Olga, es poder ampliar más su tienda y de esa manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is 42 years old and married, with 3 daughters.  She makes a living in sales.  

Olga has had a store in her home for 3 years.  She has gone to great efforts to move forwards with her business.  

Olga is requesting a loan to buy piglets and raise them to sell later.

Olga's dream is to be able to expand her store and therefore improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and raise them to sell later.

loans.name: Atalia

texts.pt:
Senhora Atalia tem 34 anos de idade, viúva, mãe de um filho, é negociante, vive em casa própria com o seu filho.
O valor financiado será aplicado para a compra de rachel, farinha de trigo, açúcar para fazer chamussas e a posterior venda no mercado local.
No futuro pretende construir dependências para o arrendamento como forma de aumentar a renda familiar visto que, com o negocio de rachel e de chamusssas não suficiente para suportar as despesas da família.
O seu maior desafio e de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora como forma de garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Atalia is 34 years old and a widow. She has a son. She's a vendor and lives with her son in a house that she owns.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for making samosas which she'll later sell at the local market.
In the future she intends to build rooms for renting out as a way to improve her family's income. This is due to the fact that her samosas business isn't enough for her to afford her family's expenses.
Her biggest challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency so that she can guarantee her future loans.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for making samosas.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz es una persona dedicada a la agricultura de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) esta actividad le ha servido de sustento para ella y su familia  desde hace 13 años, su esposo también se dedica a la siembra  de café y juntos luchan por la superación de sus hijos. En la actualidad la comunidad donde ella reside no  cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica por lo que su aspiración es adquirir un sistema solar para el hogar y de esa manera mejorar su nivel de vida y extender su horario de trabajo en tiempo de cosecha para tener mejores ingresos. Además en su hogar ya no tendrán que sufrir  daños en su salud por el uso de lámparas de querosén y velas.
texts.en: Luz is a person who works in agriculture growing basic grains (corn and beans). This activity has served her to sustain her family for 13 years . Her husband also works growing coffee and together they fight for their children's improvement. The community where they live currently does not have electricity so they want to acquire a solar power system for their home and in this way improve their standard.of living and extend their work time during harvest time to create greater income. They also will not be exposed to health damage from the use of kerosene and candles.

loans.use: to buy a solar light which will help improve the living conditions of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for the home which will greatly benefit him and his family.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro es un agricultor de  café, maíz y frijol desde hace más de 30 años, además se dedica a la construcción. El y su esposa luchan cada día por ofrecer un mejor futuro  a su hijo, por lo que desea obtener un sistema solar para su vivienda ya que no cuenta con el  servicio de energía eléctrica.
 Con este sistema espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia  ya que no tendrá que recorrer grandes distancias para recargar su celular y se evitara el uso perjudicial de lámpara de querosene y velas que dañan su salud.
texts.en:
Alvaro has been a farmer of coffee, corn, and beans for more than 30 years. He also works in construction. He and his wife fight everyday to offer their son a better future. Because of this, he wants to get a solar power system in his home, since he doesn’t have electricity.

With this solar power system, he hopes to improve his and his family’s quality of life, since they will not have to travel long distances to recharge their cell phone and they will avoid the use of harmful kerosene lamps and candles that damage their health.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system, which will be very helpful for his home.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: Alba junto a su esposo  se dedica a la agricultura de café y maíz con lo cual ha logrado sacar adelante su familia ya que este es su principal medio de sustento. Desea dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida que las que ella ha tenido, por lo cual solicita financiamiento para la compra de una lámpara solar; ya que esto contribuirá a que sus hijos tengan un entorno más favorable para poder realizar las tareas escolares  y disminuir el costo en compra de velas y querosén, además ya   no tendrá que recorrer largas distancias para recargar su celular.
texts.en: Alba, along with her husband, works in the agricultural production of coffee and corn, and with this work she has been able to help her family succeed, since this is their primary means of support.  She wants to give her children better living conditions than those which she has had.  Therefore, she is requesting funding to buy a solar lamp, since this will help her children have a more favorable environment for doing their homework, and will decrease the cost of candles and kerosene.  It will also mean she won’t have to travel long distances to charge her cell phone.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system, which will be a great benefit to her home.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Senhora Ana tem 44 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais dois estão na sua responsabilidade frequentando o ensino primário e secundário, é negociante, vive em casa própria em construção.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cimento, varões, areia, para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir a construção da sua casa e construir muro de vedação e comprar carro para o transporte de mercadorias e pessoal.
O seu maior desafio e de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora como forma de garantir financiamentos futuros e consequentemente execução dos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old. She's divorced and has five children. Two of her children are under her responsibility and attend primary and secondary school. She's a vendor and lives in a house that she owns. Her house is under construction.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase cement, rods, and sand so that she can continue building her house.
In the future she intends to finish building her house and build a fence wall. She also intends to buy a car for personal use and business purposes.
Her biggest challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency. That way she'll guarantee that she'll get future loans and therefore accomplish her projects.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, and sand so that she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene un núcleo familiar integrado por su compañero de vida y dos hijas menores de edad, no cuenta ayuda económica del familiares en el extranjero, por la necesidad de tener mejores ingresos familiares emprendió su negocio propio que consiste en la venta de lácteos que ella misma elabora, ofrece cuajada, crema y quesos, sus labores inician a las 6:00 am. y terminan a las 10:00 pm.
Está solicitando un crédito para pagar la remodelación del local del negocio, con ello tendrá mejor imagen y piensa que será más fácil atraer a nuevos clientes, pretende que sus ventas incrementen juntamente con sus ingresos para ir cancelado las cuotas de la deuda.
Sus aspiraciones son tener siempre su fuente de ingresos para apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Rosa's nuclear family is made up of her life partner and two minor daughters.  She has no financial help from relatives abroad.

She needed to have a better family income so she started her own business selling dairy products that she herself makes.  She sells curd cheese, cream, and cheeses.  She starts working at 6 a.m. and finishes at 10 p.m.

Rosa is requesting a loan to remodel her business so it looks better.  She thinks that it will be easier to attract new customers.  She plans to increase her sales and her income so she can pay back the debt.
