Her goal is to always have a source of income to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to remodel her business so it will look better and be easier to attract new customers

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en: Geralyn is 31 years old, married and has three children. Her husband earns a living by providing transport services via motorcycle, and she sells fish in a local market market. She wants to increase her income so that she can better provide for her children, and is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell. Geralyn's goal for the future is expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Teodosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teodosa, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera, no tiene pareja ni hijos, solamente un sobrino depende de ella y está estudiando, también vive con ella un tio y una prima pero no depende economicamente de ella.

Teodosa, trabaja con ganado de repasto desdes hace más de tres años y lo aprendió de sus padres, decidió dedicarse a esto por motivación de sus padres y para buscar un ingreso económico que le permitiera darle lo necesario a su sobrino, la distancia donde mantiene el ganado está a 2 kilómetros de su casa y viaja a pie, en este trabajo le apoya su sobrino y su padre, el horario de trabajo es en la mañana de 6:00 a.m. a 7:30 a.m. para ir a dejarlos al potrero y en la tarde de 2:30 p.m. a 4:00 p.m. para regresar el ganado a la casa.

Teodosa, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, con esto mejorara mucho su negocio, ya que con el préstamo tendrá mayor cantidad de ganado.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y poder darle un mejor futuro a la familia.
texts.en:
Teodosa is 33 and studied as far as secondary school. She is single and does not have a partner or children. Only a nephew is dependent on her, and he is still at school. An uncle and a cousin also live with her, but are not economically dependent on her.

Teodosa has been working with livestock for over three years, something she learned from her parents. She decided to go into this work as her parents encouraged her and also because she needed to find an economic income that would allow her to give the necessary support to her nephew. The livestock is kept 2 km from her house, and she gets there on foot. Her nephew and her father help her in the work. Her work timetable is from 6 am to 7:30 am in the morning, when she goes to leave the animals at the cattle ranch, and from 2.30 pm to 4 pm in the afternoon to return the herd back home.

Teodosa needs the loan to buy livestock. which will improve her business greatly. This will be possible because through the loan she will obtain more cattle. Her dream is to continue working and be able to provide her family with a better future.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Harini

texts.en: Harini earns a living by buying fish from local fisherman and selling them to a wholesaler or directly to her customers. Where she lives, there are two big holidays this month, Idul Fitri for Muslims and Galungan for Hindus, and both generate a demand for lots of fish. She is requesting this loan, her second, to increase her profits by buying more fish to sell. She will use the profit she earns to help pay for her children's university education and to meet other family needs. Harini is very grateful  to her lenders, Kiva and MUK for the support they provide to her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 30 years old, married, and has one child. She has a vegetable garden to earn a living. She plants vegetables and sells them to the nieghborhood and near the market. 

She aims to increase her family income, so she borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer for the vegetable garden so that she can produce plenty of vegetables and sell them to the market to result in a greater income.

Analyn's plan for the future is to save money out from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the vegetable garden .

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Carolina to improve her business. She was going to add money to her principal amount to buy more additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as cooking oils, candles, biscuits, sardines, noodles, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

Carolina lives in Ermera and she is a businesswoman. Most of her daily income is from the store, so she happy to have her business. 

She opened her business in 2011 with her own working capital of $1,000.  It has become her activity so she is happy to do it every day. 

Carolina also raises animals like pigs, cows and dogs.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils, candles, biscuits, sardines, noodles, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Alma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her business.

She has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en:
Bendita lives in Ermera and her business is restaurant food. She lives near many people, so she had an idea to open a restaurant for everybody so they could come eat in her restaurant. She is earning a good income everyday because many people come to eat in her restaurant everyday. 

And now she is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business; someday she wants to open a bigger restaurant. 

She opened her restaurant in 2013 with her own working capital of $600. 

She is taking this loan because she wants used to buy more materials such as chicken, beef, pork, rice, cooking oils, fish, vegetables, vegetables and other things to use.

loans.use: To buy chicken, beef, pork, rice, cooking oils, fish, vegetables, vegetables and other things to use.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is requesting a loan of $700 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, detergents, cooking oils, aqua, coffee, sugar, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell. 

Adriana opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $500. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And with this loan she will be improving her management.

loans.use: To buy slippers, detergents, cooking oils, aqua, coffee, sugar, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Tani Sari Group

texts.en:
As a farmer, one has the ability to predict the weather as it will determine which plants will be planted. The Tani Sari group, chaired by Sayu Putu, have that capability. With proper planning they receive a satisfactory harvest. Sayu Putu cultivates the land together with her husband. With good care, all plants can grow well, avoid disease and get the maximum results. They are very happy about it. After payment for the loan in the earlier period, Tani Sari group agreed to resume borrowing. They will use this loan to buy fertilizers, agricultural equipment and pay maintenance costs. Sayu Putu buys seed with her own money and the loan is used for fertilizer and farm tools. She and all members of Tani Sari hope crops in this period will get better and they will be able to save the profits.

Two members are not pictured because of a religious ceremony at their Temple.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm tools

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria de 73 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está casada y tiene once hijos pero todos ya están acompañados y tienen sus hogares. 

Candelaria se dedica a la agricultura, además cuida ganado con el que obtiene leche para elaborar sus derivados, tiene mucha experiencia en este trabajo pues lo ha hecho toda su vida. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar alambres y postes para cerca unos potreros donde tiene el ganado y pagará mano de obra para los trabajos agrícolas.

Para  un futuro ella sueña con tener el mejor ganado de la zona y dejar como herencia a sus hijos y nietos esta actividad que por muchas generaciones han realizado.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 73 years old. She studied until the fifth grade. She is married and has eleven children but all of them are accompanied with their own homes.

Candelaria works in agriculture and also cares for cattle using the milk she obtains for its derivatives. She has a lot of experience in this work as she has done it all her life.

She needs a loan to buy wire and poles for fencing some fields where she has cattle and she will pay labor costs for the farm workers.

She dreams that in the future she will have the best cattle in the area and dreams of leaving a legacy to her children and grandchildren of this work that has been done for many generations.

loans.use: to buy wire and poles for fencing some fields where she has cattle and she will pay labor costs for the farm workers.

loans.name: Melva Adilia

texts.es:
Melva, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casada, su esposo es empleado y tienen 2 hijos que viven con ellos, uno de sus hijos estudia. 

Melva, era empleada en una finca de café de la zona, pero decidió poner su propia tienda desde hace 15 años, para poder cuidar de su familia y ayudar en el hogar con los gastos, también vende maíz en el cantón ya que no es un lugar adecuado para la siembra de este cultivo y aprovecha esto para hacer crecer su negocio poco a poco, su esposo y su hijo le ayudan en sus tiempos libres. 

El préstamo sera para surtir más su tienda y comprara pan, arroz, azúcar, sal y golosinas, ya que hay muchos productos que le solicitan y no los tiene en su negocio, al tenerla más surtida la tienda podrá atender la demanda. 

Melva, desea que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales, también desea que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Melva, who studied up to ninth grade, is married. Her husband works, and they have 2 children who live with them. One of them is still at school.

Melva was employed on a local coffee farm. However, 15 years ago, she decided to set up her own shop in order to be able to take care of her family and help out with the household costs. She also sells maize in the canton, as it isn't a suitable place for sowing the crop. So she makes use of this activity to grow her business little by little. Her husband and their son help her in their spare time.

She is asking for a loan to stock her shop with more produce. She intends to buy bread, rice, sugar, salt and sweets, as people are asking for a lot of items that she doesn't currently stock. She could meet the demand with a better stocked shop.

Melva wants her children to complete their studies and become professionals. She also wants her business to grow.

loans.use: to stock her shop and buy bread, rice, sugar, salt and sweets.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia integrada por su compañera de vida y sus hijos, tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, muestra tener responsabilidad para pagar sus deudas y en la comunidad es reconocido como una persona honesta y trabajadora.
Solicita capital para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar granos básicos en este periodo, piensa que al tener todo lo necesario a su alcance podrá realizar sus trabajos en el campo sin  dificultades, espera que la cosecha sea abundante para tener el sustento familiar y para comercializar el resto y así tener nuevos ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones son adquirir experiencia en el uso de créditos, tener más clientes satisfechos y reducir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
José lives with his family made up of his life partner and their children. He has worked in agriculture for over 10 years. He displays responsibility to pay his debts and he is recognized in the community as an honest and hardworking person.

He requests capital to buy agricultural supplies to grow staple grains in this period. He believes that by having everything he needs within his reach, he will be able to carry out his work in the field without difficulties. He hopes the harvest is abundant in order to sustain his family and to sell the rest and in that way have new income.

His aspirations are to acquire experience in the use of loans, to have more satisfied customers, and reduce his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to grow staple grains.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.en:
Juan Miguel has owned his neighborhood business for 10 years, employing several people from the surrounding North Bergen area. Azucar Club is a Latin restaurant, bar and nightclub that serves clients for lunch, dinner, happy hours, and late night dancing. Azucar has created its own niche in the community. Unique features in the club, such as its own cigar lounge on the second floor, add to the allure of this locally owned gem. The club is also know for its specialty refreshments and typical dishes like their Ropa Vieja. 

Juan Miguel is looking for funds to invest in his business so he can renovate and remodel the restaurant and ensure the continued success of his business. This loan will help Miguel replace old equipment, and do some renovations to continue serving the North Bergen area.

loans.use: to remodel his restaurant and bar

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis owns a distribution business, KGL Distributors, that sells Latino products to local stores and restaurants in New Jersey. 

Luis is looking for capital to invest in his business so it can grow to the next level. 

Originally from Peru, Luis owned a restaurant for over 10 years before moving to America to pursue larger opportunities. After a few years in New Jersey, Luis opened up his distribution company. He noticed a market need for more Latino products in his community, and through personal connections was able to build his client base. 

Today, Luis' company is growing, and he has the opportunity to expand his market to distribute in New York. This loan will ensure that Luis has the funds to buy the inventory he needs.

loans.use: to buy new inventory for his distribution business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is encouraged that she continously receives aid to sustain her ornamental plant business. She is thankful that she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She trusts that she can again request another loan for 50,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to buy seedlings, pots, wires and netting, which she needs to grow ornamentals to sell. 

Typical of Filipino mothers, Marcelina finds ways and means to augment her income. In her case, she was driven to go into the direct-selling business. She will use part of the loan to pay for beauty products. Although at times her sales are low, she does not loose hope that God will provide enough for their needs. 

Marcelina believes that, with her perseverance and hard work, life will get better for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials for her ornamental plant business and beauty products for her direct-selling business.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.ru: Заида, 36 лет, замужем, 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода с 2006 года занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Заиды, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1,80 Га земли, где она выращивает фасоль и клевер для реализации. Также есть 3 коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Заида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и обработку почвы. Доходы от кредита Заида планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, покупку трактора и подготовку сына к школе, в этом году он идет в первый класс.
texts.en: Zaida, 36, is married and has four children. She has a high school diploma and from 2006 has been engaged in farming. She started her business with a sum of 10,000 som. Through her hard work, she owns a 1.80 ha plot of land where she grows beans and clover for sale. She also has three cows and ten sheep. Her monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). Hoping to expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to buy additional livestock and fertilizer. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business, buy a tractor and prepare her son for primary school.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount and to cultivate her land

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 34 years old and married with one child. With her child in school, Analie works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years. She sells a variety of items, such as biscuits, diapers, sanitary pads, canned goods, soft drinks, cereal and milk. 

Analie has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Analie would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ru: Фатима, 53 год, вдова, мать 3 детей, по хозяйству помогает младший сын, после смерти супруга 2 года назад, сын - главный помощник, дети Фатимы всегда ее поддержка и опора. Образование у нее средне-специальное медицинское. Фатима оказывает односельчанам медицинские услуги - ставит капельницы, делает уколы. На протяжении 30 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть дойная корова, 2 теленка, 20 овец, на ежедневной основе продает экологически-чистое молоко. На 1,20 Га земли выращивает перец и клевер. Доход Фатимы составляет около 11,400 (KGS) в месяц. Этих средств ей не хватает на достойную жизнь. Поэтому Фатима решила развить свою деятельность и увеличить доходы, обратившись в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Прибыль от кредита позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи и накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Fatima, 53, is a widow. She is a mother of three children. Her younger son helps her to run the household. He has been her main helper since she lost her husband two years ago. Her children are a constant source of support. 

Fatima finished a vocational medical school and provides medical services to other villagers. She administers intravenous medications and makes injections. In the past thirty years she has been engaged in farming. She has a dairy cow, two calves and twenty sheep and sells organic milk on a daily basis. She also grows clover and peppers for sale on a 1.20 ha plot of land. Her monthly income is about 11,400 Kyrgyz som (KGS). This money is not enough for a dignified life. 

Fatima is requesting a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy additional livestock. This would allow her to expand her business and increase her income. She plans to use the profit to improve her family’s well-being and save up for her son’s wedding.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, expand her business and improve her family's income and well-being

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
Ana de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta 3er grado, está acompañada y su pareja es corralero, tiene 2 hijos que viven con ellos y están estudiando sexto y primer grado en la escuela de la comunidad, con su pareja son los responsable de mantener a sus hijos. 

Ana tiene el negocio de destazo de cerdos y res y aprendió sola, tiene 3 años de realizar el negocio el cual hace en su casa, cada 15 días destaza un cerdo y una vaca para mantenerse activa con sus actividades.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar cerdos para destazar y comercializar la carne.

Ella espera que sus hijos terminen el año escolar y mantener su  negocio para pagar los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old.  She studied up to the 3rd grade.  She is in a relationship and her partner is a ranch hand.  She has 2 children who live with them.  They are in grade six and grade one in the school in their community.  With her partner, she is responsible for supporting the children.

Ana has a business butchering pigs and beef.  She learned it on her own.  She has been doing this business for 3 years from her house.  Every two weeks she butchers a pig and a cow in order to remain active in her occupation.

The loan is needed to buy pigs in order to butcher them and sell the meat.

She hopes that her children complete the school year and that she maintains her business in order to pay the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs in order to butcher them and sell the meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for new equipment that will allow 3D urn printing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, beer, sugar, cigarettes, water, rice, body lotion, fish and slippers.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2001. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Maria independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family.

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, beer, sugar, cigarettes, water, rice, body lotion, fish and slippers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa lives in Maliana. She is married and she has one child. 

She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of second-hand clothes, and she is also selling in the market. She started to do this business in 2010 with her own working capital of $200. 

Rosa is earning a good income from selling her second-hand clothes because many people like to buy them as they are cheap and unique if compared to new clothes.

She is taking this loan because she wants to use it to buy more clothes like skirts, short-sleeved shirts, long-sleeved shirts, shorts and other clothes to sell. She also keeps animals like pigs and goats.

loans.use: to buy skirts, short-sleeved shirts, long-sleeved shirts, shorts and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and works hard to support her family. 

Carina has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Carina would like to build and expand her business to secure he family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Irma Noemy

texts.es:
Irma de 60 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera y vive con dos hijos y una nieta de 5 años. 

Irma tiene una pequeña librería y fotocopiadora, tiene más de 15 años de experiencia en la actividad, anteriormente era empleada pero decidió poner su propio negocio el cual está a 15 minutos de su casa y viaja en bus.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como papel bond, cuadernos, lápices, borradores, sacapuntas, plumones, etc. para surtir su negocio.

En un futuro ella quiere poner su negocio en su casa para no tener que viajar a otro lugar, además le gustaría ver a su nieta convertirse en profesional.
texts.en:
Irma is 60, and studied up to secondary school. She is a single mother, and she lives with her two children and her five-year-old granddaughter.

Irma has a small stationery shop and a photocopier. She has over 15 years of experience in this work. Before this, she worked as an employee, but she decided to set up her own business. This is located 15 minutes from her house, and she travels there by bus.

She needs a loan to stock her shop by purchasing goods such as bond paper, notebooks, pencils, erasers, pencil sharpeners and felt-tip pens.

In the future she would like to set up her business in her own home so as not to have to travel to another place. She would also love to see her granddaughter become a professional.

loans.use: to stock her business by purchasing items such as bond paper, notebooks, pencils, erasers, pencil sharpeners and felt-tip pens.

loans.name: Sanavar

texts.ru: Санавар, 49 лет, в разводе, есть 4 детей, младший сын живет с Санавар. У нее среднее образование, работает поваром и дворником в школе, также с 2005 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 12 овец. На 0,58 Га собственной и 0,50 Га арендованной земли выращивает кукурузу и клевер. Санавар трудолюбивый, спокойный, любезный человек. На сегодняшний день деятельность Санавар приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). Накопленные средства стараются вкладывать в покупку скота. Однако в этом году Санавар решила улучшить жилищные условия, за счет постройки летней кухни. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку песка, кирпичей, щебня и прочего. Доходы Санавар планирует и дальше использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Sanavar, 49, is a hardworking, quiet and amiable person. She is divorced and has four children. Her youngest son lives with her. 

Sanavar has a high school diploma and works as a cook and school janitor. Since 2005 Sanavar has also been earning a living from farming. She owns three cows and twelve sheep. She also grows corn and clover on 0.58 ha of her own and 0.50 ha of rented land. Her business makes a profit of 5,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) a month. She tries to invest the money she saves in livestock. 

However, Sanavar decided that this year she should improve her living conditions by building a summer kitchen. She is requesting a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy sand, bricks, rubble and other materials. Sanavar plans to reinvest the profit in her business.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, rubble and other construction materials for building a summer kitchen

loans.name: Guillermo Isai

texts.es:
Guillermo, es joven de 24 años de edad, ya formo su propia familia, vive con su esposa de 23 años de edad y un hijo y un año de edad, para generar ingresos y cumplir con la responsabilidad de cubrir las necesidades familiares se dedica trabajar en la agricultura, sus cultivos son de granos básicos, aprendió el oficio de sus padres, tiene 10 años de experiencia y trabaja a tiempo completo.
Necesita de un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, pagar los costos de preparación del terreno en que sembrara granos básicos en esta temporada, espera que la producción sea mayor, para tener alimento para su familia por un largo periodo y comercializar a nuevos clientes su producto, la finalidad de la inversión es tener más ingresos y adquirir experiencia en el uso de los créditos.
Los sueños que Guillermo tiene son darle a su familia mejor calidad de vida y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Guillermo, is a 24-year-old young man. He has his own family; he lives with his wife, who is 23 years old, and their 1-year old son. In order to earn money and take responsibility for his family, Guillermo works as a farmer. He grows basic grains, which he learned to do from his parents. Guillermo has 10 years of experience in this work and he works full-time. 

Guillermo needs this loan in order to buy farming supplies and to pay the costs of preparing his land to sow basic grains this season. He hopes to increase his production so that he has food that will last for his family for a long time and food to sell to new clients. This investment will also increase Guillermo's income and allow him to gain experience with loans. 

Guillermo's dream is to offer his family a better quality of life and to pay off his debts.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay the costs of preparing his land to sow basic grains this season.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
Silvestre lives in Ermera, and he is a business men. He has been doing business since 2013. He started his business with his own working capital of $1,000. 

He is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to his working capital. He will use the loan to buy additional supplies for his store, including detergents, hand and body products, soy sauce, soft drinks and hard drinks. 

He is taking out this loan because he wants to turn his kiosk into a big store in the future and improve his management of his business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, hand and body products, soy sauce, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Jenereen

texts.en:
Jenereen is 28 years old, married and has three children to provide for. She has a fishing business together with her husband. She catches fish and sells it to the market. She wants to give her family a good living. She borrowed a loan to purchase additional fishing net for fishing so that they can catch more fish and be able to sell more fish in the market, which will generate a better income.

Jenereen's plan for the future is to buy a new fishing boat to use in fishing.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for fishing.

loans.name: Genesa

texts.en:
Genesa is 58 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been doing so for six years. She also earns income from a computer shop.

Genesa has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, soft drinks, beer, candies, cooking oil and noodles.

Genesa has borrowed and paid four previous loans from NWTF. She aspires to saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, soft drinks, beer, candies, cooking oil and noodles.

loans.name: Gulsun

texts.ru: Гулсун, 38 лет, замужем. У них с мужем 4 детей. Гулсун в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1994 году начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулсун, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 2 лошади, 10 овец, в аренде 1,0 Га обрабатываемой земли, где выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулсун обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма на пастбище и последующей реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулсун планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса и покупку юрты для пребывания летом в ней на пастбище.
texts.en:
Gulsun, 38, is married and has four children. Her primary source of income is farming. She got engaged in farming in 1994 when she started her business with a sum of 1,000 som (KGS). Through her hard work, Gulsun owns two cows, two horses, ten sheep and a 1.0 ha plot of land where she grows barley. 

Hoping to expand her business, Gulsun is requesting a loan of 150,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy calves for fattening up on pastures and resale. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and to buy a yurt for spending summers on pastures.

loans.use: to purchase some steers for fattening in the pastures and resale

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Gliceria is 50 years old and has seven children, two of whom are in school. She is married.

Gliceria is in the aquaculture business, oyster farming in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy binder, bamboo, and other raw materials for her farm.

Gliceria has been farming oysters for 20 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gliceria would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy binder, bamboo, and other raw materials for her farm.

loans.name: Marlene Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marlene tiene casa propia la cual comparte con su compañero de vida y sus hijos, desde hace 10 años por la necesidad de tener mejores ingresos en su hogar se dedica a la venta de especias como: achiote, manzanilla, canela y otras, lo inicio con ahorros propios, trabaja de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde todos los días, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en sus actividades cotidianas.
Considera que es necesario ampliar su mercado y para ello necesita de un mejor inventario, solicita un crédito para comprar pimienta, chan, orégano, relajo, etc., tendrá la oportunidad de ahorrar en la inversión y de ofrecer la mercadería a precios accesibles para sus clientes, espera que sus ventas sean mejores y que las ganancias tengan un margen mayor.
Los objetivos que Marlene tiene son continuar trabajando, reducir sus deudas y tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Marlene has her own house which she shares with her life partner and her children. In order to obtain better income for her household, she has been engaging in sales since 10 years ago of spices such as achiote, chamomile, cinnamon and others. She started it with her own savings. She works from 8:00 to 17:00 every day. So far, it has not presented difficulties in her daily activities.

She is considering that it is necessary to expand her shop. This will require better inventory. Marlene requests a loan to buy pepper, chan, oregano, relajo, etc. She will have the opportunity to save on investment and offer the goods at affordable prices for the customers. She hopes that the sales will increase and that earnings will have a greater margin.

Marlene’s objectives are to continue working, reduce her debts and have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy pepper, chan, oregano, relajo, etc. She will have the opportunity to save on investment and offer the goods at affordable prices for th.e customers

loans.name: Tolgonai

texts.ru: Толгонай, 36 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает в школе, также уже 18 лет она занимается животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Толгонай есть 4 коровы, 15 овец, лошадь. Ежемесячный доход Толгонай составляет в среднем 7,000 сомов (KGS). Она очень трудолюбива, честна и ответственна. Обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), на который купит овец и телят для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита позволят Толгонай увеличить ее хозяйство и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Tolgonai, 36, is married and has three children. She is a very hardworking, honest and responsible person. She has a university degree and works at school. In the past eighteen years she has also been breeding livestock. She owns four cows, fifteen sheep and a horse, and her average monthly income amounts to 7,000 som (KGS). 

Tolgonai is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy additional lambs and calves. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy additional lambs and calves in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Abiyba

texts.ru: Абийба, 28 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование-среднее. Абийба на протяжении 3 лет занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 3,000 сом (KGS). Абийба знает чего хочет и старается добиваться всего своими силами. Благодаря своей трепетной работе и ответственности на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 0,15 Га земли она выращивает картофель. Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет 11,400 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Абийба обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Abiyba, 28, is married and has two children. She has a high school diploma. Having started her businesss three years ago with 3,000 som (KGS), she has been earning a living from farming. She knows what she wants and tries to achieve everything on her own. Through her hard work and work ethics, she now owns two cows and a 0.15 ha plot of land where she grows potatoes. She makes about 11,400 Kyrgyz som (KGS) a month. 

Abiyba is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy a cow. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ángela Eunice

texts.es:
Ángela de 34 años de edad, está casada y su pareja se dedica al comercio, tiene dos hijas de las cuales una estudia y ambas dependen de ella y su esposo. 

Ángela se dedica al comercio en una tienda, tiene 2 años de tenerla y lo aprendió de su hermana quien también se dedica al comercio de la tienda. 

El crédito lo invertirá para comprar productos como azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, café, etc. para surtir la tienda.

 
Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y así dar una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Angela is 34 years old.  She is married and her husband works in business.  She has two daughters.  One is in school and both children are dependent upon her and her husband.

Angela has a store.  She has had it for 2 years.  She learned the business from her sister who also works in the store.

The loan will be invested in buying products such as sugar, rice, beans, oil, coffee etc. to stock the store.

Her dream is to finish building her house and thus give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products such as sugar, rice, beans, oil, coffee etc. to stock her store

loans.name: Maria Cresencia

texts.es:
María, tiene 2 hijas que ya son mayores de edad y trabajan, está casada, su esposo es agricultor y jornalero, ella solo estudio hasta segundo grado, decidió dedicarse a ayudarle a su madre en los oficios del hogar y a su padre en la agricultura, ya que era la única fuente de ingresos que tenían.

María, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos desde que estaba pequeña, sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo ya que era la única forma que ellos conocían para mantener a su familia, además de trabajar sus propios cultivos, también vende tortillas para ayudar con el sustento diario de su familia, para ir a sus cultivos y trabajarlos tiene que caminar 4 kilómetros desde su vivienda y sus hijas y esposo ayudan en esta labor.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar abono para su cultivo de maíz y frijol, con lo cual mejorara sus ingresos, porque obtendra una buena cosecha.

María, sueña con llegar a tener un terreno propio, para hacer sus cultivos y que sus hijas puedan superarse mediante el trabajo.
texts.en:
María has two daughters who are already adults and work.  She is married and her husband is a farmer and day laborer.  She only has a second grade education, because she decided to help her mother with the housework and her father with farming, since this was the only source of income they had.

Maria has worked planting staple crops since she was small.  Her parents taught her this work since it was the only way they knew of supporting their family.  In addition to working her crops, she also sells tortillas to help with the daily needs of her family.  To get to her crops and work there, she has to walk 4 kilometers from her home and her daughters and husband help her with this work.

The loan will be used to purchase compost for her corn and bean crops, with which she will improve her income because she will have a good harvest.

Maria dreams of someday having her own land to grow her crops and that her daughters will succeed through their work.

loans.use: to purchase compost for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Ladina

texts.ru: Ладина, 33 года, вдова, 3 детей, младшей дочери 9 лет. У нее высшее образование, работает учителем кыргызского языка и литературы в школе. Также в 2005 году она начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, этому делу она верна и по сегодняшний день. Благодаря упорному труду Ладины, на сегодня у нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 50 овец. На 1,60 Га земли выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ладина обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 6 овец для увеличения поголовья скота и доходов семьи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность построить сараи для скота.
texts.en:
Ladina, 33, is a widow. She has three children. Her youngest daughter is nine years old. Ladina has a university degree and works as a school teacher. She teaches Kyrgyz and Literature. From 2005 she has also been engaged in farming. Through her hard work, Ladina owns two cows and fifty sheep. She grows beans for sale on her 1.60 ha plot of land. Her monthly income is about 13,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) but this amount is not enough for a dignified life.

Ladina is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to expand her business. The loan would help her to buy six sheep, increase her livestock headcount and improve her family’s income. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and build livestock sheds.

loans.use: to buy six sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount and improve her family's income

loans.name: Gulimhon

texts.ru: Гулимхон, 28 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж активно помогает по хозяйству. Гулимхон в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в ее хозяйстве на сегодня есть 81 овца, на 1,03 Га земли выращивает арбузы для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулимхон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и рассады для выращивания экологически чистых арбузов. Доходы от кредита Гулимхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы в перспективе построить большой дом для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Gulimhon, 28, is married and has three children. Her husband helps her to run the household. Gulimhon has a high school degree and earns a living by farming. Through her hard work, she owns eighty-one sheep and a 1.03 ha plot of land where she grows watermelons for sale. 

Hoping to expand her business, Gulimhon is requesting a loan of 120,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to buy seedlings and fertilizer for growing organic watermelons. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business and eventually build a big house for her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for growing organic watermelons

loans.name: Mirna Estela

texts.es:
Mirna de 48 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, actualmente se encuentra casada y  su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos los cuales trabajan en albañilería y  agricultura. 

Mirna se dedica a criar cerdos, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este negocio el cual aprendió por medio de su madre que también se dedicaba a lo mismo, además Mirna elabora tamales para vender y sus hijos siempre le ayudan.

El crédito lo invertirá para comprar cerdos para criarlos y comercializarlos. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Mirna is 48 years old.  She studied up to the fifth grade.  She is married and her husband works in agriculture.  She has 4 children who work in construction and agriculture.

Mirna works raising pigs.  She has been doing this for 8 years.  She learned it from her mother who also did the same thing. Mirna also makes tamales to sell and her children always help her.

The loan will be invested in buying pigs to raise them and sell them.

Her dream is that her children have a professional career.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise them and sell them

loans.name: Turgunsa

texts.ru: Тургунса, 46 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование. С 2010 года в качестве дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы. На земельном наделе 2,25 Га она выращивает рис. Тургунса получает ежемесячную прибыль в размере 22,800 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений и оплату услуг по сбору органического риса. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также хочет накопить средства на расширение земельного участка и обучение сына в университете.
texts.en:
Turgunsa, 46, is married and has five children. She has a high school diploma and from 2010 has been making a living from farming. She owns three cows and grows rice on her 2.25 ha plot of land. Her business makes a profit of 22,800 Kyrgyz som (KGS) per month. 

Turgunsa is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy seeds and fertilizer as well as to pay for harvesting organic rice. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and hopes to save money to buy a bigger plot of land and to pay for her son’s university education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds as well as to pay for harvesting of organic rice

loans.name: Mairamkul

texts.ru: Майрамкул, 52 года, замужем, у нее средне-специальное образование, мать 2 детей. Она известна как жизнерадостный, добрый и ответственный человек. Майрамкул уже 4 года занимается бизнесом в увеличении поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве. В хозяйстве у Майрамкул имеется: 82 овцы, 2 коровы. На 3,50 Га земли выращивают фасоль. Всю полученную прибыль старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Майрамкул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Майрамкул планирует использовать для дальнейшего развития ее бизнеса и благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Mairamkul, 52, is married and has two children. She finished a vocational school. She is a cheerful, kind and responsible person. For four years Mairamkul has been working to increase her livestock headcount. She owns eighty-two sheep and two cows. She grows beans for sale on a 3.50 ha plot of land. She tries to reinvest the profit in her business. 

Mairamkul is requesting a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy twenty sheep and to increase her livestock headcount. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business and improving her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep

loans.name: Francisca Soledad

texts.es:
Francisca, estudio hasta cuarto grado debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no contaban con el suficiente dinero para que ella siguiera estudiando, está casada y tiene 6 hijos, una de ellas ya está acompañada, otra trabaja y los demás hijos aún están estudiando, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Francisca, se dedica a la venta de platillos típicos como yuca frita, papitas fritas, tostadas de plátano y de yuca desde hace unos 21 años, prácticamente desde que tuvo su primer hijo y tuvo necesidad de trabajar para poder sacarlo adelante.

Francisca, necesita el crédito para comprar materia prima como yuca, plátanos, papa y aceite, ella quiere comprar al por mayor, para comprarlos más baratos y con estas ganancias satisfacer las necesidades de alimentación, vestuario y salud de su familia.

Francisca, sueña con tener un negocio más grande, para que le genere los ingresos suficientes para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca studied until fourth grade because her parents had limited economic resources and did not have enough money for her to continue studying. She is married and has 6 children. One of which is married, another works and other children are students. Her husband works in agriculture.

Francisca earns living selling typical dishes like fried yucca, potato chips, roasted banana and yucca. It’s been since about 21 years ago when she had her first child. She needed to work to raise her family.

Francisca requests a loan to buy ingredients such as yucca, bananas, potatoes and oil. She wants to buy wholesale for better deals. Her earning will fulfill the need for food, clothing and health of her family.

Francisca hopes to have a bigger business that will generate sufficient income to raise her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as yucca, bananas, potatoes and oil.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh and Sari Mertha group members harvest corn and chili together. They get the maximum results for both because of good treatment and supported by the weather. They are very happy and satisfied with the results they get. After deducting the payment of the loan, the remaining profits can meet the needs of families and saved.

The Sari Mertha group decided to continue the venture capital loans in MUK. Now they are more focused to increase the yield of cocoa plants. With the new loan, Ni Luh buy organic fertilizers, farming tools and insecticides. The price per kilogram of cocoa beans is now quite expensive, depending on the degree of dryness. After drying over 2 days, the price per kilogram of cocoa beans range from 25,000 – 30.000 IDR. They were very enthusiastic about it. Ni Putu hoped, with good treatment, the cocoa will bear much quality fruit and can sell it at a satisfactory price. Ni Putu has a dream to improve her house from the sale of cocoa.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, farming tools and insecticides

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor, se dedica a administrar una granja de pollos de engorde, realiza la compra de pollos recién nacidos, para cuidarlos mejor los tiene en una galera, cuando están robustos y saludables los vende para ir generando los ingresos necesarios para subsistir con su familia, trabaja todos los días y el oficio lo heredo de sus parientes. Víctor tiene 42 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa de 35 años de edad y un hijo  6 meses de nacido, él es único que trabaja y abastece a su familia con lo necesario para tener una vida digna.
Requiere de un préstamo para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para optimizar los cuidados que les da a los pollos, otra parte le será de ayuda para reparar la galera en que habitan los animales, la finalidad de la inversión es mejorar el negocio, tener nuevas ventas y seguir generando ingresos para respaldar el pago de su deuda.
Su principal objetivo es que su familia tenga menos necesidades y juntos compartir un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Víctor is 42, married, and lives with his 35-year-old wife and their 6-month-old son. He is the only one in work, and he earns enough for the family to have a decent life. He runs a chicken-fattening farm. He buys day-old chicks and houses them in a shed so he can care for them better. He sells them when they are strong and healthy so that he can continue generating the necessary income to earn a living for his family. He works every day at this job, which he inherited from relatives.

Victor is asking for a loan to buy food concentrate and vitamins in order to optimise the care he gives to his chickens, as well as to repair the shed where his animals live. The purpose of the loan is to improve his business, to gain new sales, and to continue generating funds to finance the loan repayments. His main goal is for his family to want for less and for them to share a better future together.

loans.use: to buy food concentrate and vitamins to optimise the care he provides to his chickens, as well as to help repair the shed where the animals live.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana está administrando muy bien lo créditos que Padecomsm y Kiva le otorgan, sus cultivo le han dado las cosechas esperadas, la familia se mantienen y junto a ella vive en mejores condiciones.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, semilla y fertilizantes para iniciar el periodo de siembra de maíz, pipián y ejote, ha tomado a bien continuar trabajando con créditos por la facilidad que le dan de tener todo a su alcance para que su negocio siga con vida.
texts.en:
Ana is doing well managing the loans that Padecomsm and Kiva have granted her. Her crop has produced a good harvest as she hoped. She is supporting her family and they are living in better conditions thanks to her.

She is making a requesting for a new loan to buy manure, seeds, and fertilizers, to begin the planting season for corn, squash, and green beans. Ana has taken well to working with loans for the ease they give of having everything within reach, so that her business continues on with life.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, and fertilizers, to begin the planting season for corn, squash, and green beans.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a talented woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1963. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a worker. For about three years, she has been serving Tajik women with traditional dresses. Her daughter helps her to do business.

She was informed about and interested in IMON and opportunities for startup clients. She appealed to IMON and participated in a three-day training for startup clients. She gained a lot and understood how to make her business better. She reopened her business of sewing traditional women’s dresses.

Recently, she needed help to buy a sewing machine that would make her business better and productive. She is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy a sewing machine. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia de 57 años de edad, está soltera y solo tiene una hija que vive en USA, ella se dedica al comercio de panes y hamburguesas y ya tiene 10 años en este negocio, el cual aprendió de su abuela, también es costurera y tiene 30 años de confeccionar ropa. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar otro carretón para vender panes y hamburguesas y para comprar tela para su trabajo de costura.

Su sueño es poner un restaurante  y así tener mayor fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Emilia is 57 years old. She is single and only has a daughter who lives in the USA. She works selling sandwiches and hamburgers. She learned the business from her grandmother and has been in the business for 10 years.

She needs the loan to buy another cart to sell sandwiches and hamburgers and to buy fabric for her sewing work. Her dream is to open a restaurant and thus have a greater source of income.

loans.use: to buy another cart to sell sandwiches and hamburgers and to buy fabric for her sewing work.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio de 58 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar porque sus padres no se la dieron, está soltero y sus hijos están fuera del país, 

Él se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas, atiende  a sus animales dándole comida y alimento.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar maya y lámina para encerrar a sus animales y protegerlos del sol y la lluvia. 

Leoncio sueña para un futuro con llegar a tener una granja más grande y volver a ver sus hijos.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 58 years old. He did not have an opportunity to study because it was not provided by his parents. He is single and his children are out of the country,

He earns living raising pigs and chickens. He attends to them and feeds them.

He requests a loan to buy netting and sheet to enclose his animals and protect them from sun and rain.

Leoncio hopes to have a bigger farm in the future and to see his children again.

loans.use: para comprar maya y lámina para encerrar a sus animales y protegerlos del sol y la lluvia.

loans.name: Sandra Marlene

texts.es:
Sandra, de 39 años de edad, es un mujer emprendedora y vive con su madre y sus dos hijos, ya que es madre soltera.

Sandra, tiene más de 5 años de experiencia vendiendo helados y paletas tradicionales, que son del agrado de los clientes. 

Sandra, necesita el crédito para comprar un nuevo congelador y compara más mercadería para hacer crecer su negocio. 

Sandra, sueña con colocar un local en el parque de la ciudad, para incrementar su cartera de clientes e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra, 39 years old, is an enterprising woman and lives with her mother and her two children as a single mother.

Sandra has over 5 years experience selling ice cream and traditional popsicles, which are liked by the customers.

Sandra needs a loan to purchase a new freezer and purchase more merchandise to grow her business.

Sandra dreams of putting up a locale near the city park, to increase customer base and increase profits.

loans.use: to purchase a new freezer and purchase more merchandise to grow her business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
ANTONIO TIENE 48 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE CON SU CONYUGE Y SUS DOS HIJOS, EN EL DISTRITO DE CALLAYUC QUE PERTENECE A LA REGION CAJMARCA, SIERRA NORTE DE PERÚ.

ANTONIO SE DEDICA A LA DESTILACION DE AGUARDIENTE, CONTANDO CON SU PROPIO TERRENO DE CAÑA DE AZUCAR, SE DEDICA A ESTE RUBRO HACE 10 AÑOS CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES; EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO SERÁ PARA LA COMPRA DE UN ÁREA EN LA QUE PODRÁ SEMBRAR CAÑA DE AZUCAR Y ASÍ AUMENTAR SU PRODUCTIVIDAD, GENERANDO MAYORES INGRESOS Y DE ESTA MANERA PODRÁ MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Antonio is 48 years old and lives with his spouse and two children in the Callayuc district, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. 

Antonio makes a living distilling liquor, relying on his own sugar cane plantation. He has 10 years of experience in this work, and has good personal and professional references.

The loan will be used to buy land in which to plant sugar cane. This will increase Antonio's production, generating greater income and thereby improving quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy land in which to plant sugar cane.

loans.name: Balaganapati Group

texts.en:
Balaganapati Group started in the year 2015 at Naktiguda, Bhawanipatana, of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are ten active, self-dependent women, with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of this group have their own profession and business.

Ranjukta is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and their group members’ source of revenue improvement. She is sitting in the first row as the middle person with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 27 years old and living with her small family: her husband and only one son.

Ranjukta has been engaged with a grocery shop beside her own home in Naktiguda for the last ten years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the business. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of 10,000 INR. Her opinion is that, from this small income, it is very difficult to maintain her family in this current market situation. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So, Ranjukta formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

She planned to purchase a huge quantity of grocery items and other related items from the wholesaler. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of her own house, and wishes to enroll her son in a public school for better education.

The other nine members of the group are also smart at their professions and also are actively engaged with different professions, like a grocery shop, daily needs and cosmetics shop, rice business, tailoring, hotel, bookstore, and coloring & painting items shop. With this loan, they also hope to make their livelihoods better.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, soaps, washing powder, sugar, tea, potatoes, onions, wheat, gram, ground nuts, and different varieties of ready-made snacks.

loans.name: Rosaria

texts.en: Rosaria is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store including slippers, sardines, sugar, salt, candles, eggs, noodles, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2002 with her own working capital of $130. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to have good management to improve her business. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin to her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy slippers, sardines, sugar, salt, candles, eggs, noodles, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan was offered to Maria to improve her business. She is married and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as trousers, building tools, bags and other items. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Maria independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy trousers, building tools, bags and other items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be dynamic.

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

Her business goal is to have a large store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maryline

texts.en:
Maryline is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables.

She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types.

This is Maryline's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a single woman with two children. She describes herself as generous. She operates a retail business where she sells rice and other cereals.

She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is price fluctuations.

This is Ann's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more cereals to sell. Her business goal is to open a cereals store within five years.

loans.use: buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 49 años de edad, es casado y su pareja es comerciante, tiene  hijos que se encuentran estudiando y dependen de él. 

José se dedica a la agricultura,  tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este negocio, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado, el cultivo se encuentra a 20 minutos de su casa, viaja a pie y trabaja de 7:00 am a 12:00 md. 

El crédito lo invertirá para comprar fertilizantes para aplicar a los cultivos de maíz.

 Sus sueños son que su cultivo  crezca en buenas condiciones y así tener una alta productividad.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and married. His partner is a businesswoman, and he has children who attend school and are his dependents.

José works in agriculture, and has many years of experience in this business. He also raises livestock for a living. The plantation is 20 minutes from his house. He travels there by foot, and works from 7 A.M to noon.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for his corn crop. His dream is that the crop will grow in good conditions and therefore have a high rate of production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn crop.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 45 years old and has two children. She is married, and one of her children is still in school.

Alma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Alma has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Mala, one of Ruma's agents. Mala lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about five hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and his two daughters.

Mala sells mobile airtime credits to her village community. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to help her husband increase their income, as well as give more contribution to her community, so her community can have communication access to connect with their loved ones. Moreover, her community sees her as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Mala needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community.

Mala’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community with Ruma’s latest product, called Mapan, so later on her community can have access to better products with lower prices.

Mala is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her village community.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: CLARA: Es una señora afable y emprendedora, pertenece a la etnia miskita, originaria de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Madre soltera de 5 hijos: 3 son mayores de edad y dos en edad escolar. Tiene 44 años de edad. comprando granos básicos, café molido, leche en polvo, bebidas refrescantes, golosinas, chiverías,  agua embotellada, entro otros productos comestibles. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace 20 años estableció un pequeño negocio en el corredor de su casa, donde vende granos básicos, chiverías, gaseosas, agua purificada, detergentes, entre otros productos. Solicita financiamiento para poder comprar más productos para su pequeño negocio para generar más ingresos e incrementar el inventario de mercadería. Sueña con llegar a tener una ferretería.
texts.en: Clara is an affable and enterprising woman who belongs to the Miskito people. She is originally from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. She is a single mother with 5 sons: 3 are adults and 2 are school-aged. Clara is 44 years old. She buys basic grains, ground coffee, powdered milk, soft drinks, candy, snacks, bottled water, and other food products. In order to raise her children, 20 years ago she established a small business in the corridor of her house where she sells basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, purified water, and detergents among other products. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy more products for her small business, and generate more income and increase the inventory of goods. Her dream is to have a hardware store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, purified water, detergents, and other products

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica lives in Maliana and she is a businesswoman. She has been involved in business activities since 2000 with her own working capital but she has difficulties in management.  She has a small store and she hopes to open a bigger store but her capital is not enough so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.  She will use this loan to buy additional items to keep in her store including detergents, soap, shampoo, cooking oil, lighters and other things to sell.  She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve the management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy detergents, soap, shampoo, cooking oil, lighters and other things to sell.

loans.name: Gladys Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Gladys es una mujer muy trabajadora que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella  sale tres veces por semana y también vende en su casa si alguno de sus clientes necesita alguna prenda, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo y se entretiene ya que le encanta el comercio.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de niños. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The credit group "Mujeres Unided" (women united) meets every 15 days in the Abdón Calderón neighborhood of the city of Manta. Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round, for its gastronomy and for being a city of beauty like no other with many tourist attractions. 

Glays lives here. She is 62 years old, is married and from this relationship has four grown and independent children. Her husband is a driver. Gladys works hard to obtain her own resources. She sells all types of clothing which she sells door-to-door. She goes out three days a week and also sells from her home if one of her customers needs a piece of clothing. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. She has been in this business for 10 years and she earns her own money, she also has fun since she loves trade. 

This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts and children's clothing. She has been with the credit group for six years and she likes it because she finances her business with the loans. Her dreams are to have good health and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.pt:
O senhor Samuel tem 34 anos de idade, casado, pai de 03 filhos dos quais 1  frequenta o ensino escolar e 2 ainda sem idade escolar.
É pedreiro e comerciante,nos empréstimos anteriores, comprou mercadoria, construiu uma barraca propria e com este empréstimo de 15.000,00mts, vai comprar cimento,refrescos, cervejas, sabão, fosforo, lampadas, massa alimentar, caldo, acucar, peixe, ovos, patinhas, bolachas, rebuçados, mayo,farinha de milho, oleo,leite para apetreichar a sua barraca em casa.
Ele sonha em concluir a sua casa para confortar os seus filhos. Apesar de enfrentar dificuldades financeiras, tem o desafio de reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Samuel is 34 years old and married. He has three children, one of whom is in school and two are below school age.
He's a mason and a vendor. With the previous loans he purchase merchandise and built his own stall. With this loan for 15,000mts he'll purchase cement, refreshments, beer, soap, matches, lamps, noodles, broths, sugar, fish, eggs, crackers, candy, mayonnaise, flour, cooking oil, milk and other items. That way he'll stock the stall that he owns at his house.
He dreams of finishing his house so he can provide comfort for his children. Despite his financial struggles, he has the challenge of repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, refreshments, beer, soap, matches, lamps, noodles, broths, sugar, fish, eggs, crackers, candy, mayonnaise, flour, cooking oil, milk and other items.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.pt:
A senhora Rosalina tem 38 anos de idade, casado e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 2  frequentam o ensino primario e 3 o ensino secundario, vive em casa propria.
É comerciante, nos empréstimos anteriores comprou mercadoria para o seu negocio e com este empréstimo de 25.000,00mts, vai comprar, refrescos, cervejas, massa alimentar, caldo, pastilhas, biscoitos, pipocas,chocolates para apetreichar a sua barraca que esta em casa.
Ela sonha em ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, melhorar a sua casa para confortar os seus filhos. Apesar de enfrentar dificuldades financeiras, tem o desafio de reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Rosalina is 38 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are in primary school and three are in secondary school. She lives in a house that she owns.
She's a vendor. With the previous loans she purchased merchandise for her business. With this loan for 25,000mts she'll purchase refreshments, beer, noodles, broths, chewing gum, cookies, popcorn and chocolate to stock her stall which is in her house.
She dreams of expanding her business so that she can meet her customers' needs. She also wishes to improve her home in order to provide more comfort for her children. Despite her financial struggles, she has the challenge of repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase refreshments, beer, noodles, broths, chewing gum, cookies, popcorn and chocolate to stock her stall.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 22, 20, 15  y 7 años de edad, tres viven en su casa y los dos menores  estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido  es mecánico.
Doña Rosa se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas),  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por encargos, ella sale dos o tres veces por semana sin horario fijo, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 3 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, bisuterías  y cosméticos. Lleva 5 años  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas Credit Group meets every two weeks in the Abdón Calderón neighborhood of the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited all year around for its cuisine and because it is a city with an unequaled beauty with a lot of tourist attractions.   

This is where Rosa lives. She is 44 years old and is in a common law marriage from which she has four children, aged 22, 20, 15  and 7. Three of them live at home and the youngest two are in high school and elementary school. Her husband is a mechanic.  

Rosa is a merchant. She sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She sells door to door and to order. She goes out two to three times a week with no set schedule. She sells on credit and collects every week or two weeks. She has had this business for more than 3 weeks and it allows her to get ahead. 

This loan is to buy creams, perfume, jewelry, and cosmetics. She has been in the credit group for 5 years and she likes it because the loans are a big help. Her dream is to keep increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.

She hopes that in the future, she will have a large-scale business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.

loans.name: Fanny Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Fanny, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 6  y 4 años que estudian en escuela e inicial. El marido  es maestro soldador.
Doña Fanny es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un taller de soldadura en su casa donde elabora puertas, ventanas y cualquier tiempo de estructuras con el metal, él siempre tiene trabajo ya que es muy bueno en lo que hace y responsable, razón por lo cual le buscan para que él les realice sus obras, de esta forma ellos salen adelante con un trabajo honrado.
Este crédito es para comprar metal, pinturas, soldaduras y otros materiales para elaborar sus obras. Lleva más de 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas Credit Group meets every two weeks in the Abdón Calderón neighborhood of the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are much visited all year round, for its cuisine, and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.   

This is where Fanny lives. She is 23 years old and in a common law marriage with two children, aged 6 and 4. They are in elementary and pre-school. Her husband is a master welder.

Fanny is a very good wife who is taking out the loan for her husband to use for work. He has a welding shop in their house where he makes doors, windows and any type of metallic structure. He always has work because he is very good at what he does and responsible. That is why they seek him out so he can do work for them. This is how they both get ahead with honest work. 

This loan is to buy metal, paints, soldering and other materials to do his work. She has been in the credit group for more than 2 years and she likes it because the loans are a big help. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy metal, paints, soldering and other materials.

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
