El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Adriana, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 11, 8, 5 y 2 años de edad, los tres mayores   estudian en y escuela. El marido  maestro en cerámicas.
Doña Adriana al ver que a su esposo no le alcanza con lo que el gana para sacar adelante a su familia opto por conseguir un trabajo para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos por catálogos y productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale dos o tres veces por semana ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 o 15 días, ella cuanta con buena clientela que ha conseguido en estos 2 años que lleva con este negocio y que hoy le permiten salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos y cosméticos de catálogos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos. Sus sueños son que no le falte nada a su familia.
texts.en: The Women United Credit Group meets every 15 days in the Abdón Calderón neighbourhood in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are well-visited at any time of year, for its cuisine, for being a city whose beauty is without equal, and for its many tourist attractions. In this place lives Adriana, 29 years old. She maintains a common law relationship and has four children aged 11, 8, 5, and 2. The three eldest are studying in school. Her spouse teaches ceramics. Adriana sees that her spouse does not earn enough to help her family and chose to work to help with household expenses. She makes a living in business, selling shoes through catalogues and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). Her sales are made door-to-door. She goes out two or three times a week to offer her products and she allows credit. She collects every 8 or 15 days. With a good clientele she has done well in the 2 years since she opened this business and that has permitted her to get ahead. This loan will be used to buy clothes, shotes, and catalogue cosmetics. She has been in this credit group since its beginning and likes the help that they have given her with the loans. Her dream is that her family will want for nothing.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Sanoeun's Group

texts.en: Sanoeun, living in Sangke district in Battambang province, is a farmer and a married mother of three children. She struggles for a living via selling vegetables in the market near her house as the main source of income. Her husband drives a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi to supplement the family’s income. She has been in her business for five years. Now, she has insufficient capital to support her business, so she is applying for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the fourth time for her. The past loans have helped her to have better living conditions. As a leader of a group of two, Sanoeun will use her loan to buy vegetables to resell and to change a motorcycle for business use. She hopes to earn more income to expand her business to update her living standard.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

Zainab decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 15,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase windows, cement and sand, and to pay for water services.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has been involved in business activities since 2011, when she started with her own working capital of $200. Her life every day is selling gasoline because she earns a good income from this business. She lives near many people who come to buy her gasoline every day, so she is still happy to do her business. Maria is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business and she will use it to buy more gasoline. When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, she said with this loan she can improve her management.

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy products, basic grains, soft drinks and other products.

loans.name: Alba María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Alba, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 24 y 12 años de edad, el menor estudia en colegio. Su esposo es chofer. Sus dos hijos aun viven en su casa.
Doña Alba con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos para ayudarle a su marido a afrontar los gastos del hogar tiene en su casa un local en el cual vende artículos de bazar y papelería, en su local sus clientes encuentran ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, cosas para regalos, recargas telefónicas y una gran variedad en útiles escolares , trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y en ciertas ocasiones hasta mas tarde dependiendo de las ventas, lleva más de 3 años en este local pero dedicada al comercio muchos años mas ya que antes vendía puerta a puerta. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, perfumes y útiles escolares. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Loan Group "Nueva Fortaleza" [New Fortress] meets every 15 days at the Citadel Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year and for being a city of unsurpassed beauty with many tourists attractions.

This is where Alba lives.  She is 51 years old, is married and has two children from this relationship. They are 24 and 12 years old, the youngest one is still in school. Her husband is a driver. Their two children still live at home.

In order to have her own income to help her husband meet household expenses, Alba has a locale in her home where she sells bazaar and stationary items.  In her locale customers find clothes, shoes, cosmetics, items for gifts, telephone charges and a variety of school supplies.  She works every day from 8:00am to 06:00pm and sometimes even later depending on sales.  She has had this locale for 3 years, but has earned a living doing door to door business for many years.  

This loan is going to be used to purchase clothes, shoes, cosmetics, perfumes and school supplies. She has been in the Loan Group for  2 cycles and likes it because the loans are fast and very helpful. 

Her dream is to give the best to their children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, cosmetics, perfumes and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN JOVEN SOLTERO TRABAJA COMO PROGRAMADOR ACTUALMENTE SUFRE DE FUERTE DOLOR EN SUS MUELAS QUE POR FALTA DE INGRESOS NO SE HA TRATADO Y SOLO TOMA ANALGÉSICOS. LAMENTABLEMENTE SU INGRESOS SON POCOS YA QUE ES EL UÚICO SUSTENTO EN SU FAMILIA.
texts.en: This young man is single, and he works as a programmer.  He currently suffers from pain in his molars.  Due to lack of earnings, he has not been treated.  He only takes analgesics.  Unfortunately, his earnings are so small because he is the only breadwinner in his family.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La señora es el único apoyo de su mama, trabaja como obrera en una fabrica sus ingresos son pocos  lo que no le permite pagar el tratamiento que requiere su mama, ella necesita unos aparatos para poder volver a escuchar las risas de sus nietos y poder relacionarse nuevamente de forma normal. Su mamá ya no quiere salir ni ver a su familia pues se apena de que no los puede escucha. Desea poder adquirir dicho aparatos para poder tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This woman is her mother’s only support.  She is a factory worker.  Her earnings are small, which does not allow her to pay for the treatment that her mother needs.  She needs an apparatus to be able to hear her grandchildren’s laughter again and to be able to relate to them in a normal way once again.  

Her mother no longer wants to go out or see her family.  It saddens her that she cannot hear them.  She wishes to be able to get this apparatus in order to be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for hearing treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La señora es madre de familia y quiere apoyar a uno de su hijo a resolver sus problemas dentales ya que tiene la mordida abierta y cuenta con mucho apiñamiento en sus dientes, lo que provoca que su hijo se sienta incomodo en la escuela por la burla que recibe de sus compañeros. Ella labora en una tienda de ropa y es el único sustento de su familia ya que su esposo los abandono.
texts.en:
This woman is a mother, and she wants to help one of her children resolve his dental problems.  He has an open bite, and his teeth are very crowded.  This causes her son to feel uncomfortable at school because his schoolmates make fun of him. 

She works in a clothing store, and she is the only breadwinner in her family.  Her husband left them.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Poline

texts.en:
Poline is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.

Her business is located in a favorable place and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds.

This is Poline's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.	She will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy more cereals and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: buy more cereals and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a favourable place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy a hair dryer. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en: Elisha is a married man. He has 12 children. He operates a poultry farm where he keeps chickens. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more chickens and buy materials to build a poultry house. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big poultry farm. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and buy materials to build a poultry house

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man. He has 3 children. He operates a retail business where he sells cups, jugs, bananas, cereals and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals, cups and clothes. His business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a company. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals, cups,clothes

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: ISAAC: Es un señor trabajador, originario de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está casado con un pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Está solicitando por primera vez un préstamo para cambiar la madera de su vivienda de tambo que se encuentra en mal estado. Con el préstamo podrá comprar madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es  brindarle a su familia una vivienda más segura y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Isaac is a hard-working man from the city of Bilwi in the Puerto Cabezas municipality.  He is married and has a little three year old son.

He is requesting a loan for the first time in order to change the wood, which is in bad condition, on his stilt house.  He will use the loan to buy planed wood and nails and to cover the labor costs.

His dream is to provide his family with a safer house that is in good condition.

loans.use: to buy planed wood and nails and to cover the labor costs to change the deteriorated wood on his stilt house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA PERSONA MAYOR DE EDAD QUE TIENE PROBLEMAS ECONÓMICOS, POR LO CUAL NO HA PODIDO ATENDERSE SUS PROBLEMAS DENTALES DE MANERA ADECUADA. DEBIDO A SU EDAD PRESENTA DESGASTE DENTAL EL CUAL DESEA ATENDERSE DE MANERA URGENTE YA QUE SE LE DIFICULTA CONSUMIR ALIMENTOS.
texts.en: She is a senior citizen with financial problems.  Therefore, she has not been able to take care of her dental problems in an adequate manner.  Due to her age, she has dental erosion, which she wishes to take care of urgently.  This is because it is difficult for her to eat.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Estrella Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Estrella, tiene 48 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es maestro soldador.
Doña Estrella es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y más en lo que ella le encanta que es la cocina, ella  tiene un restaurante  en un local que alquila en el centro de la ciudad el cual es muy concurrido y sus ventas también son muy buenas, allí  ella prepara desayunos y  almuerzos, sus clientes siempre prefieren la gran variedad de platos que ella prepara y su sazón lo cual la hacen especial, trabaja con la ayuda de una nuera a quien ella le paga por sus servicios,  lleva más de  1 año en su negocio el cual le da para ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar mariscos de toda clase y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 5 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los crédito siempre le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener un local propio y no pagar arriendos.
texts.en:
The credit group Crédito Mujeres Unidas meets every fifteen days in the Abdón Calderón neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year round, for its gastronomy, and for being a city unequalled in beauty with many tourist attractions.

Estrella lives here. Estrella is a woman who has always liked to cook and what she loves most is the kitchen. She has a restaurant in a place in the city center that she rents. It is very busy and sales are also very good. There she prepares breakfast and lunches.

Her customers always prefer the variety of dishes that she prepares and the special seasoning she makes. She works with the help of a daughter-in-law whom she pays for her services. She has been in her business more than a year to make a living.

The loan is to buy all kinds of seafood and food supplies. She has been a member of the Grupo de Crédito for five years and she likes it because the communal bank always helps her so much.

Her dream is to own her own establishment and not have to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of seafood and food supplies.

loans.name: Silvia Yadira

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Silvia, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de 11 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es vendedor de productos de consumo masivo.
Doña Silvia es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos para ayudarle a su marido con los con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijas se dedica  al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, edredones, cortinas entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días en su carro a vender sus productos por toda la ciudad y también vende en su casa donde sus clientes llegan cuando necesitan algún producto, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 8 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, sabanas, cortinas y todo lo que ella vende. Está desde hace 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijas y su familia.
texts.en: The Women United Credit Group meets every 15 days in the Abdón Calderón neighbourhood in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are well-visited at any time of year, for its cuisine, for being a city whose beauty is without equal and for its many tourist attractions. In this place lives Silvia, 31 years old. She is married and has 2 daughters aged 11 and 5 who study in school. Her spouse sells mass consumer products. Silvia is a housewife who works to obtain her own income to help her spouse with the household costs and the education of her daughters. She makes a living in business, selling clothing of all kinds, sheets, blankets, and curtains among other things. Her sales are made door-to-door. She goes out every day in her car to sell her products to the entire city and also sells in her house where customers arrive when they need a certain product. She accepts credit and collects every week. She has dedicated more than 8 years to this activity, which started with one of the loans she received from the credit group, and for which she is very grateful. This loan is to buy clothes, sheets, curtains and other things she can sell. She has been in the credit group for 8 years and likes it because her first loan started her business. Her dream is to give the best to her daughters and her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sheets, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for five years.

Her business is located in a favourable place and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is changes in climate.

This is Alice's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy animal feeds.

loans.use: buy animal feeds

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.

Her business is located in a favourable place and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is price fluctuations. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years.

This is Lucy's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with two kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanakombo operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 


With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Belina

texts.en: A loan of $1,000 is offered to Belina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies with this loan including tea, soap, toothpaste, ketchup, biscuits, shampoo, soft drinks and other things to sell.  She has been involving herself in business activities since 2000, with her own working capital. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy tea, soap, toothpaste, ketchup, biscuits, shampoo, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has been involved in business activities since 2010 when she started with her own working capital of $50. She has a small kiosk in her house. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin, to add to her working capital to buy more supplies including candies, coffee, aqua, onion cake and other things to sell. She hopes with this loan, she can improve her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 41 years old, separated and has three children to provide for. As a single parent, she wants to give a good living to her children and be able to provide her children's daily needs. So she borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for her banana farm so that she can produce good quality bananas and deliver plenty of bananas in the market to result in greater income.

Rosalia's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen esta continuando sus estudios en mecánica dental, es una persona que esta poniendo poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante y poder crecer como persona y profesional, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera para poder continuar con sus estudios.
Karen es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante y crecer, es por eso que pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y con ello poder seguir luchando y esforzándose por crecer.
texts.en: Karen is continuing her studies as a dental technician. She is a person who is putting all of her effort into getting ahead and growing as a person and as a professional.  She states that her previous loan was used to pay for her tuition.  Karen is a fighter who wants to get a head and grow. For these reasons, she is seeking a new loan to pay for her tuition so that she can continue to strive and work towards her professional growth.

loans.use: pay her college tuition.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is 37 years old and has a fish-selling business. He has been running this business for six years. He has two children and the oldest is nine years old. He earns about 30,000 PHP per month and works hard to support his family. 

He has requested this loan to purchase additional fish for his business and to buy a water dispenser for his family's use. In the future, Raul hopes to send both of his children to school and to be successful in business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for his business and a water dispenser for his family's use

loans.name: José  Vitervo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive el señor José, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de los padres. El lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido mejorar más su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Don José es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta ganarse lo suyo siempre pensando en forjarse un mejor porvenir para cuando le toque formar su familia, el  junto a su papá se dedican al comercio, venden ropa de todo tipo y zapatillas, ellos salen todos los días en una camioneta que tienen ofreciendo sus productos por la ciudad y sitios más apartados donde tienen muy buenos clientes, trabajan cuatro o cinco días por semana y son los fines de semana cuando mas ventas tienen. Ellos llevan más de 3  años en esta actividad la cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas y zapatillas. Sus sueños son tener su propio carro.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Unidas (United Women) meets every two weeks in the Abdón Calderón neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city well-known for its beautiful beaches that are very visited at any time of the year, for its cuisine and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

José lives here.  He is 19 years old, single and lives in his parents’ house.  He has three cycles in the communal bank and he likes it because thanks to the loans he has been able to improve his business more which allows him to get ahead. 

José is a very hardworking young man who likes to earn his own living always thinking about carving out a better future for himself for when it's his turn to start his family.  Together, he and his father make a living in commerce selling clothing of all kinds and tennis shoes.  They go out every day in their van offering their products around the city and in more remote areas where they have many good customers.  They work four or five days every week and the weekends are when they have the most sales.  They have more than 3 years in this activity which allows them to get ahead.  

This loan is to buy pants, shirts and tennis shoes.  His dream is to have his own car.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts and tennis shoes.

loans.name: Nerida

texts.en:
Nerida is 34 years old, married, and has four children to provide for. She has been engaged in coconut production to earn a living for three years already, and it really helps in their family for their needs.

She wants to increase her income because of the increased demand of her children’s needs. So, she decided to borrow a loan to pay for the labor cost for harvesting the coconuts. Then she can harvest more coconuts and sell them, which will result in a greater income.

Nerida’s plan for the future is to save money for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost for harvesting the coconuts.

loans.name: Humberta Moncerrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Humberta, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos mayores de edad, 4 de ellos aun viven en su casa.  El marido es maestro albañil.
Doña Humberta es una mujer que le ha gustado trabajar para  ayudarle a su marido el cual no gana mucho en su labor, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, colas, aguas en bidón, cervezas entre otros productos, allí trabaja todos los días, sus hijos y su marido  le ayudan cuando ellos pueden  pero es ella la que pasa mayor tiempo en su local, tiene más de 6 años con el negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suyo para sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar víveres para surtir su tienda.  Esta casi desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener una tienda más grande y surtida.
texts.en:
The credit group "Mujeres Unidas" meets every 15 days in the town of Abdón Calderón in the city of Manta.  The area is known for its beautiful beaches that are popular to visit in every season of the year, its food, and for being a city whose beauty is unequaled by many tourist attractions.  

This is where Humberta lives.  She is 50 years old and is in a free union relationship, from which she has 7 adult children, 4 of whom still live in her home.  Her partner is a master bricklayer. 

Humberta is a woman who has enjoyed working to help her partner, who doesn't earn much in his work. She has a grocery store in her home where she sells all types of food and drink, such as sodas, water jugs, beer, and other products.  She works there every day, and her children and partner help her when they can, but it is she who spends the most time in the store.  She has had the business for more than 6 years, which has allowed her to earn an income to get her family ahead.

This loan will be used to buy products to stock her store.  She has been with the credit group almost since it started, and she likes it because the loan are fast and offer a lot of help.  Her dreams a to have a bigger store with more stock.

loans.use: to buy goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a fish-vending business n the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store.

Marietta dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Alianca

texts.en: Alianca is applying for a loan of $1.000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop for her business. She started to do this business in 2010 with her own working capital of $100. She is busy every day with her business. Now she is taking this loan because she wants to use it to buy more items to keep in her kiosk such as shampoo, toothpaste, soaps, sardines, biscuits and other things to sell. She is also cultivate animals like pigs, chickens and goats.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, toothpaste, soaps, sardines, biscuits and other things to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a widowed woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school.. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Beatriz is 47 years old.

Beatriz has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Beatriz requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional beauty products for her business.

Beatriz has been in this business for two years. Beatriz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products for her business

loans.name: Aguida

texts.en:
Aguida is applying for a loan of $1,500 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 38 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house. She will use the loan to buy a refrigerator and stock to keep in her store such as Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, water, noodles, cigarettes, body lotion, and slippers.

She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. She is living in a town nearby the school. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, water, noodles, cigarettes, body lotion, and slippers.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: MAURA: Es una señora sonriente y emprendedora de 41 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita de comunidad de Leymus, municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco. Se trasladó  a la Ciudad de Bilwi desde hace 4 años, por motivos laborales de su esposo. Tiene 6 hijos: 5 en edad escolar y una pequeña de un año. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, estableció una pequeña pulpería.  Con el crédito otorgado anteriormente por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido surtir su negocio. Solicita su tercer financiamiento para comprar como: granos básicos, chivería, pan, toallas sanitarias, papel higiénico, entre otros productos. Su sueño es ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
Maura is a happy and enterprising 41 year old woman. She is for Miskita ethnicity from the community of Leymus in Waspam-Rio Coco. She moved to the city of Bilwi four years ago because of her husbands job.  She has six children, five that are school-aged and one who is a year old. With the goal of having her own source of income and contributing to her household expenses and her children's education, she opened a small grocery store. 

With her previous loans from PANA PANA and Kiva, she has been able to keep her business stocked.  She is seeking a third loan in order to purchase basic grains, dairy products, bread, sanitary napkins, toilet paper and other products. Her dream is to be a successful business owner.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, dairy products, bread, sanitary napkins, toilet paper and other products.

loans.name: Alice

texts.es:
Alice es una persona joven, responsable y muy dedicada. Actualmente vive con su madre y su hermana mayor. En lo laboral está trabajando y a la vez estudia la carrera de agronomía.
Alice quiere ser una buena profesional, es por eso que está poniendo su esfuerzo para poder también ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Alice is a young, responsible, and very dedicated person.  She is currently living with her mother and older sister.  She is working while studying agriculture.  Alice wants to be a good professional, and because of this she is putting in the effort to be able to also help her family.

She is requesting this loan in order to pay university fees as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Mónica Del Rocio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mónica,  tiene 45 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, 3  mayores de edad y la menor de 17 años  que estudia en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en reciclaje.
Doña Mónica es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar ya que el no gana mucho en lo que realiza, ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y en ocasiones ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es salir a recorrer por toda la ciudad, sale casi todos los días y no tiene horario fijo, lleva más de 5 años  que se dedica a esta actividad la cual comenzó con uno de los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales. Ella está desde  el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The credit group "Mujeres Unidas" (women united) meets every 15 days in the Abdón Calderón neighborhood of the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round, for its gastronomy, and for being a city with a beauty like no other and with many tourist attractions. 

This is where Mónica lives. She is 45 years old, is in a common law marriage and from this relationship has four children: three adults and one minor who is 17 years old and is in school. Her husband works in recycling. Mónica is a woman who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses since he doesn't earn much at his job. She sells natural products and occasionally all types of clothing. Her way of selling is to go all over the city, she goes out almost every day and doesn't have a set schedule. She has been in this business for more than five years. She started this business with a loan. 

This loan will be used to buy natural products. She has been with the credit group from its start. She likes it because of the help that the loans provide her. Her dream is to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria tiene 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Luque, con sus padres, trabaja y a la vez estudia la carrera de ciencias contables para poder ser una buena profesional y abrirse camino.
Gloria es una persona luchadora que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder lograr sus metas y anhelos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, esforzándose por ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en: Gloria is 31 years old and lives in the city of Luque with her parents. She works and is also in school to become an accountant in order to become a professional and make a life for herself.  Gloria is a fighter who wants to get ahead, which is why she is making an effort to reach her goals and dreams.  She is seeking a loan in order to pay for her tuition so that she can continue with her education and eventually be someone in life.

loans.use: pay for her college tuition.

loans.name: Frelyn

texts.en:
Frelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Frelyn is 36 years old and both of her children are in school.

Frelyn has a business making and selling bags in the Philippines. Frelyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her bag-making.

Frelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Frelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her bag-making business.

loans.name: Ingracia

texts.en: Ingracia is applying for a loan of $ 1500.00, She is married and her life is devoted to her business.  She has a kiosk. She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including noodles, aqua, coffee, cooking oils, detergents, sugar, soft drinks and other things to sell.  She started her business in 2011 with a working capital of $ 350.00. With this loan  she hopes to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, aqua, coffee, cooking oils, detergents, sugar, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
A USD 1,000 loan is offered to Fernanda to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of USD 100. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as eggs, coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes, and water. She is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk. She has been thinking of running a bigger business after years of involving herself in doing this business.

She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy eggs, coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes, and water

loans.name: Ligia

texts.en: Ligia is applying for a loan of USD 800 to improve her business. She is running a  food stall business in front of her house.  She is making a good income from selling from her food stall and she wants to buy more  with the loan. She lives in a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She began her business a year ago with her own working capital.

loans.use: To buy buffalo meat and beef

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria está en el cuarto año de la carrera de administración agropecuaria, vive con sus padres  y a la vez que estudia también trabaja.
Comenta que aspira a terminar su carrera y llegar a ser una profesional  y así poder desenvolverse en su profesión. Con ayuda de sus padres está estudiando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de universidad y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is in her fourth year studying agriculture and fishing administration.  She lives with her parents and is working and studying at the same time.  She comments that she hopes to finish her studies and become a professional, and so progress in her career.  She is studying with aid from her parents.

She is requesting this loan in order to pay university fees and in this way be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda, is aged 60, is widowed and she has five children.

She has owned and managed a farming business for almost 10 years and earned a net income of PHP 90,000 from the last cropping.

Due to insufficient capital in her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her corn farm. 

She is hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her corn farm.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a single woman and has no children. She is 53 years old and has had a Sari-sari store business for 16 years.

Rosalinda sells items like powdered juices, toiletries, spices, candies, chips and noodles to the people in her community. She usually earns about PHP 5,000 per month from her business.

Rosalinda is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, candles, sugar, powdered milk, noodles, coffee, soap and soft drinks. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, candles, sugar, powdered milk, noodles, coffee, soap and soft drinks

loans.name: Aritas

texts.en:
Aritas is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall for her fish vending business.

Aritas has been in this business for 30 years. Aritas earns more income from food vending.

Aritas has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Jesusima

texts.en:
Jesusima is 54 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jesusima has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. Jesusima requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

Jesusima has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Jesusima would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 46 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Eva is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 3 times in the past to sustain the business.

In the future, Eva would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her pigs.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
A $1,500.00 loan is offered to Veronica to repair her house.

Veronica started construction of her house but she was not able to finish because of lack of money to buy materials such as cement, stone, sand, and other materials.

Now, she is requesting a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to help her finish off her house.

loans.use: To buy cement, stone, sand, and other supplies

loans.name: Terezinha

texts.en:
A $ 1.000.00 loan is offered to Terezinha to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working money of $ 100.00. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like  biscuits, rice, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, body lotion and water. She is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, rice, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, body lotion and water

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a second hand business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy shirts, trousers, and shorts.

She opened her second hand business a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, and shorts.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is taking a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is running a business that helps her to generate income for her family.

She will use the loan to buy chicken. She opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of $200.00.

She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living conditions in the future.

Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy chicken

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es: MARIA JESÚS: Es una señora sonriente y jovial de 62 años de edad, originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Madre soltera con 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Desde hace 3 años sus hijos le establecieron en su vivienda un pequeño negocio de venta de bastimentos y nacatamal. Gracias al crédito otorgado anteriormente por Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, le han permitido diversificar sus productos al establecer una pequeña pulpería y construir un anexo de madera, para utilizarlo como local, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando financiamiento para construir 2 anexos de madera, que serán utilizados como cuartos y alquilarlos a precios accesibles. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
Maria Jesus is a friendly and cheerful 62 year old woman. She is originally from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabeza. She is a single mother of four independent adult children. Three years ago her children set up a small business in their home selling groceries and other supplies and nacatamal (corn, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf). 
Thanks to the previous loan given by Pana Pana and financed by Kiva, they were able to diversify their products and set up a small grocery store and build an addition of wood to use as a location for the store. In this way they helped with the costs of the home. 
She is requesting the loan to build 2 more additions of wood that wil be used as rooms which can rented out at accessible prices. She dreams of being a successful business woman.

loans.use: to build 2 additions of wood that will be used as rooms that can be rented out.

loans.name: Miller

texts.es:
Miller tiene 21 años, cursa el cuarto año de la carrera de administración de empresas, trabaja como mecánico y con el salario mensual paga su universidad.
Miller es una persona que esta poniendo su esfuerzo y lucha para poder crecer y salir adelante. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad para poder seguir estudiando y luchar por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Miller is 21 years old, and is in his fourth year studying business administration.  He works as a mechanic and with his monthly salary pays his university fees.  Miller is a person who is putting in effort and fights in order to grow and get ahead.

He is requesting this loan to pay his university fees so that he can continue studying and fight to improve every day.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela es de la ciudad de Pilar, es funcionaria del Poder Judicial y está realizando actualmente un curso de Postgrado para poder tener acceso a un mejor puesto de trabajo.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza a la par que está trabajando pues también estudia. Quiere crecer y mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos que tiene dentro de su curso de postgrado. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar.
texts.en: Estela is from the city of Pilar. She is an official of the judiciary and is currently in a postgraduate course in order to have access to a better job. She is a hardworking person who strives at the same time while working and studying. She wants and grow and improve every day. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the expenses for her postgraduate course. She is thankful for the opportunity she has received to be able to improve.

loans.use: to pay graduate school expenses.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida es una mujer muy emprendedora que esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser una buena enfermera que ayude a las demás personas en algo tan importante como es la salud, ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Zoraida buscando cumplir con su meta es que pide este nuevo préstamo, para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por sus anhelos. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que recibe de seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
Zoraida is a very entrepreneurial woman who is putting forth her best effort to be able to be a good nurse who helps others in something as important as health. She comments that the previous loan that she received was used to pay her university fees and was a great help. 
Zoraida is looking to achieve her goal and requests this new loan to be able to pay more university fees.  In this way she will be able to continue working towards her goal. She is grateful for the new opportunity to receive a loan that will allow her to continue improving.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria comes from the province of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is 56 years old and is happily married to Arnold, a carpenter. They are blessed with three children, of whom one is in high school and the other two are still at the elementary level. 

Maria has been operating a small general store for nine years now. Her only challenge is collecting receivables from those who buy on credit, but she is thankful to God that her store earnings are enough for their daily sustenance and the earnings have helped send her kids to school.

She is a typical Filipino mother who finds other means to augment her income. Aside from her store, she went into the poultry business as well.

To help her expand her store, she is humbly requesting a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items like canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages, biscuits, bread, etc. She wants to offer more food items at her store to attract more customers. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. She values her store so much since it is where she gets the funds to support her children's school needs.

Maria aims to sustain and grow her small store into a big grocery store. Her simple dream is to see all of her children go to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and it is there where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is 59 years old and has nine children. Bernadita is married and has one child who is still in school.

Bernadita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Bernadita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Bernadita has been farming rice for 35 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 19 times in the past to sustain the business.

Bernadita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Domingus

texts.en:
A loan of $800.00 will help Domingus to send his children to university. He hopes that by continuing his children’s education, they will have more opportunities and a better life.

The money will be used to pay school expenses, including buying notebooks, shoes and other materials for his youngest daughter. He is very happy with the loan that Tuba Rai Metin has offered him for this.

loans.use: To pay for school expenses, including buying notebooks, shoes and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy three pigs and feed and phytosanitary products for the pigs.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: This loan of $1000.00 will allow Georgina to send her youngest daughter, Ausiliadora, to the university. She will use the loan to pay for school, create a task, buy notebooks and other costs for her daughter's education. Georgina loves her daughter very much. She hopes that this loan will help her daughter to have a brighter future. And her daughter is not in this photo because her daughter is in school in another country.

loans.use: To pay for school, create a task, buy notebooks and other costs for her daughter's education

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en:
Joaninha is taking out a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family.

She will use the loan to buy stock of items to keep in her store such as beer, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and biscuits.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 300.00. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy beer, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and biscuits

loans.name: Serengeti Makumbusho Group

texts.en: Lilian, born in 1980, is not married and has one school-aged child. She has been running a mama lishe business for 10 years now. Lilian works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request which she will use to buy food cooking ingredients for her mama lishe foodservice business. Lilian earned an extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. She desires to manage a catering service business. She will share this loan with her loan group "Serengeti" which consists of 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients for her mama lishe foodservice business

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es:
Eulogio es soltero, vive con sus padres, se considera un estudiante dedicado con metas por lograr, le gustaría al terminar su carrera trabajar en su profesión y ayudar a su comunidad.
Eulogio está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino al mundo profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad y de esa forma estar cada vez más cerca de cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Eulogio is single and lives with his parents. He considers himself a dedicated student with goals to achieve. After finishing his degree he would like to work in his profession and help his community. Eulogio is getting an accounting degree and through his degree he wants to make his way into the professional world. He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his university fees and thus be closer to reaching his goals.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias es de la ciudad de Pilar, ya es un profesional recibido, es Dr. Veterinario, hoy buscando crecer y mejorar está siguiendo la carrera de Didáctica Universitaria, para que más adelante pueda enseñar en las universidades y tener un ingreso más que me pueda ayudar a mantener a su familia.
Él es una persona muy sacrificada que lucha para poder crecer y salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Elias is from the city of Pilar. He is a professional with a degree, a veterinary doctor. He is now looking to grow and improve and is following a university teaching career. He hopes to later teach at the university level and have additional income to help support his family. He is a selfless person that strives to improve and get ahead. He is requesting this loan to cover the fees for his degree and thus be able to continue with this studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería en informática, su meta es terminar su carrera para poder así aplicar lo aprendido y superarse como persona mejorando así su calidad de vida. 
Diego es una persona muy luchadora y pide este préstamo para poder pagar la cuota de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Diego is studying for a computer engineering degree. His goal is to finish his curriculum and apply what he learned and excel as a person, thereby improving the quality of life.

Diego is a fighter and requests this loan to pay for tuition and to be able to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Violiza

texts.en:
Violiza is a married woman with three children. She is 41 years old and has run a sari-sari store business for two years.

Violiza sells items like spices, toiletries, coffee, candies, and chips to the community. She usually earns about PHP 3,200 per month from her business.

Violiza is requesting a loan of PHP 15, 000 to buy more items such as canned goods, soft drinks, powdered juice, powdered milk, sugar, noodles and soap. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as canned goods, soft drinks, powdered juice, powdered milk, sugar, noodles and soap

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 28 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Joan works very hard to provide for them.

Joan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, bath soap, sanitary pads, coffee, etc. to sell.

Joan has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as those listed above. 

Joan would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, bath soap, sanitary pads, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima has been involved in business activities since 2011. She started her business with her own working capital of $1000.00.

Fatima is married, and she has 3 children. Fatima has a shop for a business. She is requesting a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants use to buy additional supplies according to what people like, including sugar, water, slippers, candies, noodles, and other things to sell.

She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can run an expanded business in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: To buy sugar, water, slippers, candies, noodles, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman and has two school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Esther has operated a business selling paraffin for use in cooking to neighbours. In addition, she also operates a business renting houses to the community. She faces a challenge of delayed payments and hence low profits in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to establish other rental houses and to purchase cement and sand for construction.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for construction.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una persona que se esta esforzando para poder ser alguien en la vida, por medio de su carrera, la cual es la de enfermería, ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha utilidad.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder cubrir nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y estar cada vez mas cerca de sus metas.
texts.en:
Sonia is striving to be someone in life through her career in nursing. Her previous loan was used to pay for the tuition. It was very useful.

She requests a new loan to cover for the tuition. This will enable her to continue studying and be closer to her goals.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 5 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Angelica, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, y se está esforzando por poder crecer y mejorar en el pequeño emprendimiento que está haciendo. Ella es ama de casa y también se dedica a la venta ambulante, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas, zapatos y otros productos para poder seguir con sus ventas ambulantes.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Activas [Active Women] is in its fifth cycle in the Women’s Committee program, where all work and support each other. They are completing the Survey of Poverty Elimination. Five members are below the poverty line, i.e. in extreme poverty. 

One of the members is Angelica, who is the president of the group. She is striving to grow and improve the small enterprise she is running. She is a housewife who is also engaged in street vending. She requests this loan to buy clothes, shoes, and other products to continue with her peddling.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothing, and other products

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 34, is residing in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has two children.

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small plot of farmland and primarily grows rice. She sells her agricultural product to local dealers and customers at the market.

So far, she has been in this type of business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 2.50 a day.

Currently, she would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
This loan of $800.00 will allow Paulina to send her child, Alarico, to university. She will use the loan to pay building fees, registration and other fees.

Paulina is very supportive of her son and she hopes this loan will help her child to have a brighter future.

Her child is not in this photo because he attends school in the capital.

loans.use: To pay building fees, registration and other fees.

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Judas Tadeo está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité, además forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una lucha y se esfuerza mucho para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Entre el trabajo que ellas realizan, hacen de todo para poder tener los medios para su familia, entre ellas la Sra. Liz, quien se dedica a hacer comidas, que después ella misma sale a vender, y comenta que gracias a que siempre hace ricas comidas ya tiene muy buena clientela. Pide este préstamo para la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras, hortalizas y otros insumos para poder hacer sus comidas.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group San Judas Tadeo is in its second cycle in the Committee Program and the Program of Poverty Elimination, where each works hard and tries to improve their lives and those of their loved ones. 

Among the work that they do, they do everything to improve the living conditions of their family including Liz, who earns her living cooking meals that she sells herself. She always makes delicious meals. Thanks to that, she has a very good clientele. She has requested this loan to purchase meat, spices, vegetables, and other ingredients to make her meals.

She is thankful for the opportunity to get to improve living conditions for their families.

loans.use: to purchase meat, condiments, vegetables, spices, and other ingredients

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nueva Esperanza  está en su ciclo número 10, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una de las 18 integrantes luchan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Celina, quien se dedica a la venta en general, ya que tiene una despensa en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos de la canasta familiar. También se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, quien hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Celina solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus productos tales como: frutas, verduras, carnes, panificados, arroz, yerba, entre otros lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Agradecen por esta oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus vidas y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) is in its 10th loan. They are in the program of poverty elimination, in which each of the 18 members are struggling to improve their living conditions for them and for their families.

One of the members is Celina, who sells basic goods. She has a store in her house where she sells all kinds of staple products. 

It should also be noted that Fundación Paraguaya, the partner, makes permanent monitoring of training and checks that are required while encouraging women to overcome poverty.

Celina requests a loan to buy products such as fruits, vegetables, meats, breads, rice, herbs etc. This will help her realize her business plan and improve her income. the members thank for this opportunity to improve their lives and those for their loved ones.

loans.use: Comprar frutas, verduras, carnes, panificados, arroz, yerba, entre otros

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Martin; está en su ciclo número 2  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, cada una de ellas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y por ello están creciendo y mejorando cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lilian; quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas y comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia.
La Sra. Lilian  solicita de este crédito para la compra de  Blusas, Remeras, Pantalones Bermudas; entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group San Martin is in its second loan of the women's committee program. All the women work and help each other get ahead. Every one of them wants to improve her living conditions and this is why they are growing and improving every day. 

One of the group's members is Lilian who through her efforts, continuous work and applying the characteristics of a successful woman, finds herself improving her situation. She sells clothing and says that through her work she helps her family. 

Lilian is requesting this loan to buy blouses, shirts bermuda shorts and other items. This will help her realize her business plan which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, bermuda shorts and other items.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 41-year-old divorced man living with his two children who are still attending school. He is the main source of income for the family. He works as a driver in a local company in order to fulfill his children's needs and be able to live a respectful life. Today he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his children’s school fees. He is very thankful to Kiva because it will permit him to help his children to achieve high educational levels.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 31-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children who are still attending school. She is a housewife and her husband is the main source of income for the family. He works as a farmer in his town. Due to the hard financial situation, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the last installment of her children’s school fees. Her purpose is to help them achieve high educational levels.

loans.use: to pay the last installment of her children’s school fees

loans.name: Mpipi Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa is a 36-year-old married woman, with two children. 

She has been running a beauty salon and sunflower farming for eight years now. She works from 8 am to 9 pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Mtumwa's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her salon stock with up-to-date products. She has paid back all her loans successfully. 

Mtumwa used the profit from her business to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy new salon products, and the balance will aid in sunflower farming. She dreams of improving her business, and purchasing a sunflower machine. Mtumwa will share this loan with her loan group, Mpipi, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new salon products. The balance will aid in sunflower farming.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 32-year-old single man from Nablus city. He works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income due to the unstable demand. Mustafa decided to start his own business which is buying eggs from governesses chickens and distributing them to the stores and local traders.

Mustafa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a big quantity of eggs to resell. By taking this loan, Mustafa will be able to start his new business and increase his income. After that, Mustafa will start to prepare himself to get married. Mustafa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a big quantity of eggs to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the purchase of the ZEduPad, an e-learning solution for primary school education to help the children in her school receive quality education.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married woman with one child who is too young to attend school. She lives at a own house that has no piped water but has electricity. She cites food as her greatly monthly expense.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the marketplace. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is 36 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, 2 children and mother in the Borjomi district. 

Tea is unemployed, and decided to start a new business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, has enabled her to get a loan for renovating her flat in order to rent it out. This will give her a stable income, and will improve the living conditions of her family. 

Tea is very motivated. She's hopeful that the business will be profitable and successful, because the location is populated with many tourists.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to get stable income

loans.name: Mujeres De Padre Winkel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres de Padre Winkel está en su ciclo número 1 º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una de ellas quieren superarse y poder crecer y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es Liz, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Liz se dedica a la venta de lencería y por medio de su venta tiene los medios para poder dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar lencerías varias para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mujeres de Padre Winkel (Women of Father Winkel) is in its first loan. All members are seeking to eliminate poverty. They want to excel, grow and improve.

One of the members is Liz. With her effort and continuous work, and applications of vital behavior of a successful woman, she is improving her poverty. Liz sells lingerie. This provides her the means to give her family a better lifestyle.

She requests a loan to buy lingerie to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is indeed grateful and encouraged that she continually received aid to maintain and grow her ornamental farm. Typical of Filipino women, she finds ways and means to augment her income to give her family a better life, which drove her to grow agricultural native produce such as bananas, papaya and soursop.

To sustain and grow her farm, she trusts that you could grant her a PHP 50,000 loan to buy fertilizer for her ornamental and crop business. She focuses and values her farm, for it is her source of income to cover their everyday personal and household needs. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and for supporting her livelihood.

Carmelita's prayer is to always have a productive fruit harvest from her farm.  She also prays for good health and protection for her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer, crop  and garden inputs to grow her farm.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Here is Emilia, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. Recently she had a loan which she had used for her business. Actually, she sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. This is why she would like to give her gratitude to those who lent her assistance previously. 

To improve sales, Emilia would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional products such as additional cloth, needles, and other materials needed in her rug-making business. With PHP 9,000, she can certainly improve her livelihood and eventually grow it with the grace of God. For now, it is her desire to have people like you who will assist her in her prospect. 

In the future, Emilia hopes to give her family a more favorable kind of living and simultaneously drive her inventory into progress. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional cloth, needles, and other materials needed in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with five children and is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. 
  
Lorna supports the family through her rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her daughter Mae, who is 18 years old and the youngest of five children in the family. Mae is studying Hotel and Restaurant Management and is currently in the second of this four-year course.

Lorna is borrowing PHP 8,800 to pay for tuition fees for her daughter Mae for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When Mae graduates, she plans to help her parents earn an income to send her brother and sister in college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Anupama Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, eleven self-dependent women of Aamgachhapada, Bhawanipatana of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India formed a group named Anupama. Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social livelihoods by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Laxmi is the most active lady of this village and has taken the leadership to form a self-help group. The lady’s age is about 35 years. She is standing in the first row, fourth person from the right hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

For the last ten years, Laxmi’s family has been engaged with a milk business with the help and support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of Rs. 9,000 from their occupation. But, the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses of her family.
