So, she decided to raise her income by purchasing some more cows through the loan. She will purchase another two cows from the nearest market. Through this, Laxmi hopes that she will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house.

The other ten members of the group also engage themselves with different small businesses, like ready-made snack products, a fast food centre, vegetable vending, a grocery shop, seasonal items, milk selling, a chicken shop, a vehicle garage, and a fishery.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima has been involved in business activities since 2013, when she started with her own working capital of 280 USD. Fatima is requesting a loan of 800 USD to improve her business. She is a businesswoman, so she is taking this loan to buy more additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as hand and body lotion, biscuits, balloon lights, noodles, glue, coffee, rice, candy, insect repellent and other things to sell. When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, she felt very happy because she can improve her business.

loans.use: To buy hand and body lotion, biscuits, balloon lights, noodles, glue, coffee, rice, candy, insect repellent and other things to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité  Mujeres Unidas esta en el 1er ciclo, están iniciando con muchas expectativas ya que quieren ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio del trabajo en conjunto y con el apoyo de la fundación paraguaya.
Lilia es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica la peluquería, tiene muchos clientes que gracias al buen servicio que da, cada día va creciendo más y más. Ella quiere seguir creciendo, es por eso que pone su mayor esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para peluquería como agua oxigenada, cabellos naturales para alargue, algodón, esmaltes, etc. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
The committee of Mujeres Unidas (United Women) is in its 1st loan. They are starting with high expectations because they want to help their loved ones by working together with the support of the Paraguayan Foundation.

Lilia is one of the members of this group. She works in hairdressing. She has many customers. Through her good service, customers are increasing every day. She wants to keep growing and she is putting her best effort.

She requests a loan to buy supplies for hairdressing such as hydrogen peroxide, natural hair extension, cotton, enamels, etc. The members thank for the opportunity for continuous  improvement.

loans.use: to buy supplies for hairdressing such as hydrogen peroxide, natural hair extension, cotton, enamels, etc.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 65 años de edad, está casado y su pareja se dedica al comercio, tiene dos hijos que ya son independientes.


Carlos se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio el cual aprendió por medio de su tío, también se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas y trabaja de 7:00 AM a 12:00 PM. 

El crédito lo invertirá para hacer 2 víveres cafetaleros para mejorar su finca.

Sus sueños son comprar un automóvil y así tener una mejor herramienta para movilizarse.
texts.en:
Carlos is 65 years old, married and his partner makes a living with her own business.  He has two children who are already independent.

Carlos makes a living in agriculture.  He has been engaging in this business for 10 years, which he learned from his uncle.  He also makes a living by planting vegetables.  He works from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

The loan will be invested to make 2 coffee nurseries to improve his farm.

His dream is to be able to purchase a car and as such have a better tool to move around.

loans.use: to make 2 coffee nurseries to improve his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, bread among other things to make food.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky works hard to support two children. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Pinky requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency. Pinky is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Bárbara Bersabé

texts.es:
Bárbara de 24 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja se encuentra en EE.UU, tiene una hija que está estudiando, con ella vive su madre y 2 hermanos pero de ella solo depende una persona. 

Ella se dedica a la cosmetología, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio el cual tiene en su casa y su madre se involucra siempre.

 El crédito lo invertirá para comprar mas equipo de cosmetología y mejorar su negocio.


Para un futuro ella sueña con que su negocio crezca y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Bárbara is 24 years old. She has a partner, who is living in the United States. She has a daughter who is studying. Her mother and 2 brothers live with her, but only one person is economically dependent on her. 

She works in cosmetology. She has been working in this business for 6 years, and she works in her home. Her mother always helps her.

She will use the loan to buy more cosmetology equipment and to improve her business. 

For the future, she dreams of her business growing and having better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetology equipment and improve her business.

loans.name: Moeurt's Group

texts.en:
Moeurt is a 51-year-old married woman, with one child, who lives in the Bovel district of Battambang province. 

Growing rice on their one-hectare farmland has been the main source of her family’s income for ten years. Moeurt has also been selling Khmer noodles, and been a paid worker, as additional sources of income to provide for her family’s needs. 

Moeurt has been with VisionFund for one cycle, and has completely paid back the loan. The past loan helped to improve her family's living conditions. 

Now Moeurt is faced with the problem of insufficient money for her rice farm, so she has decided to lead a group to apply for a new Kiva loan.  She will use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer, and pay for harvesting fees. She hopes this loan will help to improve her income, and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for harvesting fees.

loans.name: Joemima

texts.en:
Johnrey is 20 years old and is the fourth of six children in the family. His mother, Joemima, is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. and supports the family through her rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Johnrey is studying for a Bachelor's of Science in Information Technology and is currently in the second of this four-year course.

Joemima is borrowing PHP 6,500 to pay for tuition fees of her son, Johnrey, for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

Johnrey plans to graduate and be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She works in agriculture, raising livestock in the Philippines.

Cheryl requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising livestock for eight years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Cheryl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 58 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Helen has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Helen requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a 49-year-old married woman with ten children, three of whom are in school.. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Roselyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Roselyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Babuhija

texts.en:
Babuhija is a widowed woman with six kids, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. Babuhija operates a stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high seasonality in her place of operation. 

With this KES 30,000 loan, Babuhija wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Thit's Group

texts.en:
Thit is a 28-year-old farmer living in Keo Seima district of Mondulkiri province. She is a married mother of two dependent children who are still in school. Thit struggles to make a living growing cassava on two hectares of farmland, which is her main source of income. She sometimes works as a paid worker in order to earn extra income to meet her family’s needs. She has been involved in this business for 28 years already, but now the cassavas hardly grow and she cannot get good outputs to resell.

This is the second time that Thit has applied for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  As her group's leader, she will use her loan to buy cassava seeds to grow. She hopes to increase the productivity of her crops so that she can earn a good income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds to grow.

loans.name: Alyar

texts.en:
Alyar is 28 years old and married. His wife  doesn’t work. He has two children. He is an internally-displaced person and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region.

Alyar is a skilled, respected, organized, stable, and professional person. He is a farmer and started this work in 2008. In this work, Alyar has experience, but he is not happy with his work because he cannot earn a good income. So, he needs some money. If he has enough money, Alyar will buy fruit and vegetable seeds from other markets. After that he will sow his land and then sell his crops. His biggest dream is to expand his land and plant more seeds. Therefore, he needs Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to expand his land and to plant more seeds

loans.name: Vân

texts.en:
Vân is 27 years old and married. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for six years. Vân lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in their village; moreover the market need is low in this region. 

Vân has no collateral, so she cannot get a loan from traditional banks or credit institutions. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Vân joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business and she has successfully repaid three loans. Vân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Marilú Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Marilú, tiene 44 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 13, 11 y 5 años  de edad, todos  estudian en colegio y escuela. 
Doña Marilú es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con sus ganancias sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella tienen un bazar y papelería en su casa, allí vende  ropa, zapatos, cosméticos cosas para regalos y una gran variedad en  útiles escolares, así como también  colas, jugos, helados y muchas golosinas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y en ciertas ocasiones hasta más tarde, ella también para tener más ventas sale a ofrecer ciertos días de la semana vendiendo puerta a puerta, lleva más de 3 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suyo y darles lo necesario a sus hijos. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, perfumes, helados, útiles escolares y todo de lo que ella vende. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Fortaleza” loan group meets every 15 days in the Leonidas Proaño development in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many tourists all year long, and for being a beautiful city without equal, with many tourist attractions.

This is where Marilú lives. She is 44 years old. She is separated and from that relationship has three children, who are 13, 11, and 5 years old. They are all studying in middle school and primary school. 

Marilú is a person who likes to work and support her children with her profits. She has a variety and stationary store in her house. She sells clothing, shoes, cosmetics, gift items, and a wide variety of school supplies, as well as soft drinks, juices, ice creams, and many sweets. She works every day from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. Sometimes she works later. In order to make more sales, on certain days of the week she sells door to door. She has been in this business for more than 3 years. It allows her to earn her own income and provide for her children. 

She will use this loan to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, perfumes, ice creams, school supplies, and all of the things she sells. She has been in the loan group for 2 loan cycles. She likes it because the loans are a great help to her. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, perfumes, ice creams, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Mariela Mercedes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariela, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, el cual  estudia en jardín de infantes. Su marido es artesano y comerciante.
Doña Mariela junto a su marido tienen una pequeña fábrica de botones hechos en tagua, ellos  tienen un torno (máquina para cortar tagua), ellos elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, productos que entregan en el puerto de Manta o a comerciantes que le compran en su fábrica para luego venderlos a comerciante que envían  al extranjero lugar en el cual les dan el acabado necesario para ser comercializados. Trabajan todos los días, y llevan más de 2 años en esta  actividad la cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua que es la  materia prima para la fabricación de los botones. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos le ayudan en su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Nueva Fortaleza Credit Group meets evert two weeks in the Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño of the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches, much visited all year round, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.   

This is where Mariela lives. She is 39 years old and in a common law marriage, from which she has one 5 year old son who is in pre-school. Her husband is an artisan and a merchant. 

Mariela and her husband have a little tagua button factory. They have a lathe (a machine to cut tagua). They make the buttons in a raw form and deliver the products to the port of  Manta or to merchants who buy at the factory to later sell to a merchant who sends them abroad where they are finished for sale. They work every day and they have been doing this activity for more than 2 years, which allows them to get ahead.

She is going to use this loan to buy tagua, which is the raw materials for making the buttons. She has been in the credit group for three cycles and she likes it because the loans help her in her business. Her dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tagua.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
It was Felisa's privilege to be helped by Kiva fund individuals that helped her acquire a loan previously. She used this to buy a motor engine, supplies, spare parts, and materials needed for her auto repair shop. Because of that, there was great improvement in her business, impacting her income profit. 

She wants to continue this. With that, she's coming to you again to request PHP 50,000. She will use this amount to further improve her inventory, buying more accessories needed for her auto repair business. 

Someday she wants to be successful in her business and then build a life that is more affordable for her family. She's really working hard because she wants to send her children to college and enable them to finish schooling. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more accessories needed for her auto repair business.

loans.name: Mujeres Creativas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Creativas está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción,  la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y mejorar.
La Sra.  Viviana es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde sale a vender sus ropas nuevas que compra de la capital. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de su trabajo tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas nuevas para la venta, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas, blusas, vestidos y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en:
The loan group called “Mujeres Creativas” [Creative Women] is in its 3rd loan cycle with the women’s committee program, in the city of Concepción. It’s an area that's somewhat distant from the city center and it’s still growing. It’s a difficult area to get to, so the women in the group want to work hard so they can grow and improve.

Viviana is one of the members. She lives in an area that is far from the city center, where she goes to sell the new clothing items that she buys in the capital. She hopes that as time passes, and through her work, she will have the means to be able to help her family and loved ones. She is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy new clothing for sale, such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, blouses, dresses, and other things. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, blouses, dresses, and other things.

loans.name: Sameha

texts.en:
Sameha is a 46-year-old married woman from Yata, a village near Hebron city. She is a mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver and his job gives him unstable income. Sameha has a sewing workshop which has been opened for the past three years. She makes traditional and artistic pieces and sell them in the local market. 

Sameha would like to improve her business and expand it, so she decided to take a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop. Sameha appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en: Mamlakat is an honest woman who was born in southern Tajikistan in 1953 and lives in a prosperous area with her family. She is divorced and has twenty years of experience doing business. Today, she buys and sells small items such toys and office notebooks, but she is planning to expand her business so that she can increase her income. Mamlakat has requested a loan from IMON to buy more goods to sell in her small store, and hopes that she can succeed in her business and earn more money on which to live. She is grateful to have the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 15 chicks and chicken feeds for her poultry business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 56 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Eva has a purified water retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Eva requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more gallons of purified water to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of purified water to sell.

loans.name: Roche Amor

texts.en:
Roche Amor is 33 years old and married with one child. Roche Amor works very hard to provide for them.

Roche Amor runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Roche Amor has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, soft drinks, noodles, etc. 

Roche Amor would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nyemba

texts.en:
Grandma School, situated in Chilenje, Lusaka, was founded in 2006 by Nyemba, a loving and caring woman of humble beginnings.  A teacher by profession, Nyemba has worked in government and private schools for 35 years. 

Nyemba founded Grandma School with a view to provide quality education for the children in the Chilenje community and extend it to the nation as a whole. Nyemba has also extended the services of her school to the inclusion of orphaned and vulnerable children to give them an opportunity to also receive the same quality education that is provided to the other children in the community.

Grandma School believes in growing every day and adapting to new ideas, concepts and approaches to addressing the improvement of education in the school. It is because of this that Grandma School wishes to purchase ZEduPads to continue to improve their education by providing e-learning and ICT development for the children in the school. 

The ZEduPad is a tablet computer that provides an e-learning solution for children with pre-loaded educational content that has been mapped to the entire primary school curriculum.

loans.use: To purchase ZEduPads for the children in her school. These are tablet computers that are preloaded with primary school educational content mapped to the primary school curriculum.

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
Louis is a teacher. This loan of $1000.00 will allow Louis to send his child, Fernando, to university. Fernando is not in this photo because he is in school in other country. 

Louis will use this loan to pay for Fernando's school registration, and to help him begin practicing in his field. He is very supportive of his son, and Louis hopes with this will help him to have a brighter future.

loans.use: To pay for school registration for his son, and to help him begin practicing in his field.

loans.name: Noela

texts.en: Noela is the mother of two boys, both of whom are school-aged. She is married and makes a living by managing a nursery school and raising milk cows. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. She is requesting her sixth loan from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. Noela will use this loan to repair her barn and buy one more cow. She dreams of expanding her business so she can own more than ten cows and a big nursery school. She promises to repay the loan fully and on time.

loans.use: to repair her barn and buy a new cow.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es estudiante del último año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Psicología. Ella es hija de una señora sacrificada y luchadora.
Maria está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar su vida a través de sus estudios,
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar el gasto de su tesis.
texts.en:
Maria is a student in the final year of the program for a degree in psychology. She is the daughter of a sacrificing and hard-working woman. Maria is putting her best effort into being able to grow and improve her life through her studies.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the expenses of her thesis.

loans.use: to pay thesis expenses

loans.name: Gerlita

texts.en:
Gerlita is 64 years old and married. She earns her living by operating a sari sari store. She wants to raise the standard of living for herself and her husband, so she decided to buy more good items to sell, and to increase her store inventory so it will generate greater income.

Gerlita's plan for the future is to save money to sustain her needs and her husband's.

loans.use: To buy more good items to sell.

loans.name: Jane Rosaly

texts.en:
Jane Rosaly works hard to support her family. Jane Rosaly is widowed and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Jane Rosaly requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like shells, wire, etc. for her business.

Jane Rosaly has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Jane Rosaly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells, wire, etc. for her business

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is 24 years old and single. 

Justin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, beer, detergent soap, candies, etc. to sell.

Justin has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, beer, detergent soap, candies, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Justin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, beer, detergent soap, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en: Mary Ville is 18 years old and an only child. Her mother Mariza is a member of the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. and supports the family by selling food in the Philippines. Mary Ville is studying for a Bachelor's degree in elementary education and is currently in the second year of a four-year course. Mariza has requested a loan for Php 5,000 to pay her daughter's tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-16. When she graduates, Mary Ville plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Ma. Julie

texts.en:
Ma. Julie is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Julie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Julie has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Ma. Julie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rhea Mae

texts.en:
Rhea Mae is 25 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rhea Mae has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Rhea Mae requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Rhea Mae has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rhea Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en:
Nim is a 35-year-old mother with three children, two of whom are in school while the third is too young to attend school. Nowadays, she is living with her family in a rural village located in Kampong Cham province. Nim grows rice as the main source of her family’s income and buys more rice to sell as an additional source of income to meet her family’s needs.

Due to a lack of funds, Nim is now leading a group to apply for their first Kiva loan via VisionFund. She plans to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for growing rice in order to gain a higher yield. She hopes this loan will help her earn more income and be able to keep sending her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing rice in order to gain a higher yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ruben Ascanio

texts.es: RUBEN ASCANIO: Es un señor jovial y sonriente de 52 años de edad. Está casado con 4 hijos en edad escolar. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura para su familia, solicita un préstamo para mejorar su vivienda que es de  madera y tambo. Con su préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es llegar a tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento) porque es de mayor durabilidad.
texts.en:
Ruben Ascanio is a cheerful and smiling man of 52. He is married, with four children of school age. With the goal of improving the conditions of his home and having a more worthy and secure residence for his family, he is applying for a loan to improve his house, which is made of wood and on stilts. 

With his loan, he wants to buy construction materials -- wood, zinc, and nails -- and cover labor costs. His dream is to have a concrete (cement) house, because it is of greater durability.

loans.use: to improve his home, which is made of wood and on stilts

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es: La Sra. Emilia de 63 años de edad convive con el Sr. Valerio con quien tiene 2 hijos pero que ya no dependen de ellos. Es la presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Nueva Luz” que está integrada por 5 mujeres con todas las ganas de seguir trabajando en equipo ya que llevan más de 5 años trabajando responsablemente. Ella se dedica a preparar desayunos para luego venderlo muy temprano a sus clientes, adicionalmente vende miel de abeja al por mayor y menor. El préstamo lo invertirá en su negocio para comprar los ingredientes como la maca, quinua, soya y los utensilios que necesita para poder preparar sus desayunos para sus clientes. Su plan a futuro es poder comprar un puesto de venta donde pueda ofrecer todo sus productos. Ella se siente muy contenta y agradecida con el apoyo que está recibiendo por parte de los inversionistas de Kiva. En la foto grupal Emilia se encuentra de pie en medio de las demás señoras sentadas.
texts.en:
Emilia is 63 years old and lives with Valerio, with whom she has two children, but neither is dependent on them anymore. She is the president of the communal bank Nueva Luz, which is made up of five women who have the desire to keep working as a team since they have worked responsibly for more than five years now.

She earns a living preparing breakfast foods to then sell them very early to her customers. Additionally, she sells honey both wholesale and retail. She will invest the loan in her business to buy ingredients such as maca (a radish-like root), quinoa, soy, and the utensils that are needed to prepare the breakfasts for her customers.

Her future plan is to be able to buy a sales stand where she can offer her products. She feels very content and thankful for the support that she is receiving from the Kiva lenders. In the group photo, Emilia is standing in the middle of all the other seated ladies.

loans.use: to buy maca, quinoa, soy and honey.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth viene de una familia humilde, vive en la ciudad de Caacupé, su aspiración es terminar su carrera y poder ser una profesional que ayude a las demás personas.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en obstetricia, y por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino para poder ser una excelente profesional que ayude a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y así poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ruth comes from a humble family. She lives in the city of Caacupé. Her goal is to finish her studies and be able to be a professional who helps other people.

She is studying in the program for a degree in obstetrics, and through her studies she wants to be able to become an excellent professional who helps other people.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for her program and thus be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Yohana

texts.es:
Yohana vive en la ciudad de Itá con sus padres quienes tienen como actividad las ventas ambulantes. Yohana es estudiante del 2do año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Enfermería.
Ella pone todo su esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar su vida a través de sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y así poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Yohana lives in the city of Itá with parents who work as street vendors. Yohana is a student in the second year of the program for a degree in nursing.

She puts all her effort into being able to grow and improve her life through her studies, as she has been doing.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay the fees for her program and thus be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio se encuentra estudiando actualmente la carrera en Licenciatura en Administración de Empresas. Está trabajando en una Rectificadora y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder seguir con sus estudios.
De aquí a 5 años se ve ejerciendo su profesión esperando un mejor futuro para él y su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Julio is currently studying his bachelor degree in Business Administration. He is working in a machine shop and through this work has the means to continue with his studies. Five years from now he will be working in his profession looking for a better future for himself and his family.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his university tuition and doing this continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, su meta es estudiar, salir adelante, también superarse como persona para poder ayudar  a su familia.
Ella es una persona que está luchando por crecer y superarse a través de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Nilda is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. Her goal is to study, to get ahead, and also to better herself as a person in order to be able to help her family.

She is a person who is striving to grow and better herself through her studies.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay the fees for her program and in this way be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to carry out maintenance and to purchase new work tools.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está trabajando y estudiando al mismo tiempo, la carrera que está siguiendo es la de enfermería, y con ella quiere abrirse camino para poder ayudar a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios. Ella es una persona que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Liz is from the city of Coronel Oviedo.  She's working and studying at the same time.  She's in the nursing program, with which she's going to make her own way and be able to help people.

She's requesting this loan so she can pay her university fees and keep studying.

Liz is a person who gives it her all so she can grow and be someone in life.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería comercial, es una persona que pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida y un buen profesional.
Diana lucha y comenta que aunque la carrera es complicada está luchando y esforzándose para poder cumplir sus anhelos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios, esforzándose por mejorar y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Diana is studying in the commercial engineering program. She is a person who puts her greatest effort into being able to be someone in life and to be a good professional.

Diana works hard, and she comments that even though the program is complicated, she is working hard and striving to be able to accomplish her dreams.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay the fees for her program and with that, to be able to continue with her studies, making a great effort to progress and to accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.
